Title: Analyste en éthique et en conformité - Ethics Compliance Analyst
Description:
Role and Responsibilities
 


 (English will follow)



   Sommaire du rôle
 


   La personne choisie au poste d’analyste en éthique et en conformité fera partie du Bureau mondial de l’éthique et de la conformité, et interagira avec des collègues des services des affaires juridiques, du contrôle des exportations, de finance, de l’approvisionnement et des unités d'affaires, sur un large éventail de questions de conformité essentielles pour atténuer les risques juridiques et de conformité.
 

   Plus précisément, l’analyste en éthique et conformité assumera des responsabilités importantes relativement à nos processus de diligence raisonnable, à la gestion des ententes contractuelles avec nos partenaires d’affaires, à la revue de leurs rapports d’activités et au processus de renouvellement de leur relation d’affaires avec CAE. L’analyse en éthique et conformité assumera aussi un rôle conseil auprès des collègues de CAE relativement à la mise en œuvre de processus de diligence raisonnable pour les tiers. Enfin, la personne choisie assistera les membres du bureau mondial de l’éthique et de la conformité dans l’exécution de certaines tâches liées aux enquêtes internes et à la gestion des risques juridiques et de conformité.
 


   Tâches et responsabilités
 

 Responsable d’exécuter les demandes de diligence raisonnables pour les partenaires d’affaires ainsi que pour les clients et fournisseurs à haut risque.
 Recueillir tous les renseignements nécessaires pour mener à bien nos processus de diligence raisonnable fondés sur les risques.
 Effectuer une revue de premier niveau des questionnaires de diligence raisonnable et autres renseignements recueillis afin d'identifier les signaux d'alarme potentiels et les domaines nécessitant une revue .plus approfondie.
 Agir comme personne-ressource et point de contact pour toute questions des collègues de CAE concernant nos processus de diligence raisonnable fondé sur les risques.
 Compiler et analyser les données afin de produire des rapports de diligence raisonnable qui mettent en lumière les risques juridiques et de conformité.
 Gérer les ententes contractuelles avec les partenaires d’affaires et s’assurer que ces ententes soient renouvelées ou résiliées à échéance conformément à nos politiques.
 Exécuter certaines tâches liées aux enquêtes internes, comme la revue et l’analyse documentaire et la préparation de comptes-rendus lors d’entrevue.
 Assurer le suivi et la coordination des activités de formation relatives aux programmes d'éthique et de conformité de CAE.
 S'assurer que les exceptions relevées Code d’éthique professionnelle et aux politiques et procédures corporatives de CAE ou les violations présumées aux lois et règlements sont documentées de manière appropriée, cohérente et complète.
 Effectuer d'autres tâches à la demande du leader mondial, Éthique et conformité.



   Expérience et qualifications
 

 Minimum de 1 à 3 ans d'expérience dans la réalisation d'activités ou de tâches de conformité dans un environnement commercial.
 Expérience dans la préparation de rapports de conformité et le traitement de nombreux jeux de données.
 Expérience dans le suivi et la mise en œuvre de programmes de conformité.
 Une expérience dans les processus de diligence raisonnable fondée sur les risques pour les tiers est préférable.
 Une expérience dans l'administration des contrats est préférable.
 Une formation/qualification en droit ou en comptabilité est un atout.



   Connaissances
 

 Compréhension des programmes de lutte contre la corruption.
 Compréhension des exigences en matière de sanctions, de contrôles d’exportation, de droits humains, de concurrence et de lutte contre le blanchiment d'argent.



   Compétences et attributs
 

 Accorde une grande importance à l'intégrité dans les affaires.
 Sûr de soi et confiant dans une variété de contextes, avec une forte croyance en ses propres capacités.
 Capacité avérée à présenter efficacement des informations à d'autres personnes.
 Capacité avérée à résoudre les conflits entre des groupes ayant des perspectives, des objectifs ou des priorités opposées.
 Solides compétences en communication orale et écrite - Français et Anglais.
 Compétences en matière de planification, de gestion de projets, de résolution de problèmes et de gestion du changement.
 Familiarité avec la résolution de problèmes et l'adoption d'une approche proportionnelle et fondée sur les risques.
 Maîtrise de PowerPoint, Excel et des outils connexes de Microsoft Office.
 Faire preuve d'un haut niveau d'objectivité, d'intégrité, de motivation, d'esprit d'équipe, de professionnalisme et de fiabilité.



   ********************
 


   Summary of the role
 


   The successful candidate for the Ethics and Compliance Analyst position will be part of the Global Ethics and Compliance Office, interacting with colleagues in Legal, Export Control, Finance, Procurement and Business Units on a wide range of compliance issues critical to mitigating legal and compliance risks.
 

   Specifically, the Ethics and Compliance Analyst will have significant responsibilities in relation to our due diligence processes, our contract management process with business partners, the review of activity reports and the renewal of business relationships. The Ethics and Compliance Analyst will also assume an advisory role with CAE colleagues in the implementation of third- party due diligence processes. Finally, the successful candidate will assist members of the Global Ethics and Compliance Office in performing certain tasks related to internal investigations and risk management.
 


   Duties and responsibilities
 

 Responsible for performing risk-based due diligence on business partners as well as high risk customers and suppliers.
 Gather all information necessary to conduct the due diligence process.
 Conduct a first level review of due diligence questionnaires and other information collected to identify potential red flags and areas requiring further review.
 Act as a point of contact for any questions from CAE colleagues regarding our risk-based due diligence processes.
 Compile and analyze data to produce due diligence reports that highlight legal and compliance risks.
 Manage contractual agreements with business partners and ensure that agreements are renewed or terminated upon expiration in accordance with our policies.
 Perform certain tasks related to internal investigations, such as document review and analysis and preparation of interview reports.
 Monitor and coordinate training activities related to CAE's ethics and compliance programs.
 Ensure that exceptions to CAE's Code of Business Conduct and corporate policies and procedures or suspected violations of laws and regulations are documented in an appropriate, consistent and complete manner.
 Perform other duties as requested by the Global Leader, Ethics and Compliance.



   Experience & Qualifications
 

 Minimum 1-3 years of experience in performing compliance activities or tasks in a business environment.
 Experience in preparing compliance reports and handling large datasets.
 Experience in compliance program monitoring and implementation.
 Experience performing risk-based due diligence on third parties is preferred.
 Experience in contract administration is preferred.
 Legal or accounting education/qualifications are an asset.



   Knowledge
 

 Core understanding of the general principles of compliance, particularly as it impacts Anti-Bribery and Anti-Corruption programs.
 Understanding of sanctions, trade controls, and human rights is an asset.



   Skills & Attributes
 

 Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, and related Microsoft Office tools.
 Places a high value on doing business with integrity.
 Self-assured and confident in a variety of settings with strong belief in own capabilities.
 Demonstrated ability to present information effectively to others.
 Demonstrated ability to resolve conflict between groups with opposing perspectives, objectives, or priorities.
 Strong oral and written communication skills - French and English.
 Planning, project-management, problem-solving and change management skills.
 Familiarity with resolving issues and taking a proportionate and risk-based approach to compliance due diligence.
 Demonstrates personal traits of a high level of judgement, integrity, motivation, team orientation, professionalism, and trustworthiness.



   #LI-ND1
 


   Position Type
 

 Regular
 

   CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.
 


   Equal Employment Opportunity
 

   At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.
 


   As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.
 


   At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age.
 


   The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

   If there's something we can do to help make the recruitment process or the job you're applying for more accessible, let us know. We can provide accommodations at any stage in the recruitment process. Just ask!

 You use your analytical skills and comprehensive knowledge of your line of business to contribute to business projects and initiatives using data from the databases.

Title: Faculty Business Analyst
Description:
Please refer to the 
  
   How to Apply for a Job (for External Candidates)
   job aid for instructions on how to apply.
 


   If you are an active McGill employee (ie: currently in an active contract or position at McGill University), do not apply through this Career Site. Login to your McGill Workday account and apply to this posting using the Find Jobs report (type Find Jobs in the search bar).
 


   Position Summary:
 

 Reporting to the Director of Administration and working closely with the Associate Dean (Academic), this position will play a significant role in evaluating and improving the IT capabilities for the Faculty of Arts. The Analyst will contribute to the support of faculty-specific IT systems to ensure that they meet the current and future needs of the user community. The Analyst will partner with Central IT Services and Teaching and Learning Services to ensure IT services are being leveraged optimally within the faculty.
  
 Primary Responsibilities:
 



     Responsible for developing a vision of the Faculty’s IT needs that address the requirements of diverse stakeholders and the evolution of technological solutions, in collaboration with Central IT Services and Teaching and Learning Services.
   


     Elicit, analyze, validate, and document IT needs as it pertains to the specific academic, teaching, organizational and/or operational requirements of the Faculty of Arts.
   


     Survey the Faculty user-community to establish IT priorities and measure satisfaction with its Information Technology.
   


     Plan, develop, coordinate, implement processes required to respond to academic, administrative and students’ IT demands.
   


     Work with other IT Professionals and Business Subject Matter Experts in validating and recommending IT solutions that meet business requirements and are aligned with IT orientations.
   


     Prioritize the adoption of existing platforms wherever possible over introducing new solutions with overlapping functionality.
   


     Transform business requirements and conceptual system designs into detailed functional specifications in accordance with design standards.
   


     Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding and distinguish user requests from the true underlying needs.
   


     Assist the stakeholders with the development of business cases.
   


     Support the rollout, promotion, and adoption of IT solutions within the Faculty of Arts by leveraging effective change management practices.
   


     With the support of Central IT Services, promote cybersecurity, data protection, and safe computing practices across the entire Faculty of Arts community.
   


     Ensure faculty compliance with IT directives, policies, and governance.
   


     Support Business Subject Matter Experts and users during user acceptance testing.
   


     Assist in the development of application documentation, user documentation and training materials.
   


     Managing the student computer Lab, including the student staff, and overseeing other computer Labs that are part of the Faculty.
   


     Act as the IT asset steward for the faculty and work closely with Central IT Services to establish procedures for improving the quality of the Faculty’s hardware and software inventory.
   


     Manage software licenses for applications purchased by the faculty.
   


     Continuously evaluate emerging technologies and their potential benefits to the Faculty community.
   


     Act as a key resource in raising, validating, and communicating incidents / problems and act as a liaison between Business Subject Matter Experts, technical teams and/or third-party vendors as required.
   


     Provide estimates for tasks and artifacts under own responsibility.
   


     Directly supervise one staff member
   


 Other Qualifying Skills and/or Abilities
 



     Functional knowledge of IT and Higher Education business domains.
   


     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills & ability to perform root/cause analysis.
   


     Self-motivated and ability to work well with multiple teams in cross-functional set-up.
   


     Ability to take supervisory and management direction to work effectively and with little direct supervision in order to complete tasks.
   


     Ability to work cooperatively with a diverse team of professionals, as well as to work together with other staff on projects for clients we serve.
   


     Demonstrated ability to work on multiple initiatives and to manage deadlines.
   


     Demonstrated knowledge of functional analysis and data analysis.
   


     Ability to understand and clarify business needs formulated by requesters and stakeholders.
   


     Experience in working with third-party software and third-party suppliers.
   


     Demonstrated ability to work on multiple initiatives and to manage deadlines.
   


     Demonstrated effective communication, writing and planning skills.
   


     English, spoken and written. French spoken and read.
   

















                 Minimum Education and Experience:
               













 Bachelor's Degree 3 Years Related Experience /
 





























                               Annual Salary:
                             



























 (MPEX Grade 05) $65,500.00 - $81,870.00 - $98,240.00
 















                 Hours per Week:
               













 33.75 (Full time)
 





























                               Supervisor:
                             



























 Director Administration
 





























                               Position End Date (If applicable):
                             



























 2023-08-31

 2022-07-19

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description:
Métis Nation British Columbia
Technical Business Analyst

POSITION: TERM FULL-TIME (37.5 hours per week) until March 31st, 2023, with the possibility of an extension
 
LOCATION: Provincial Office – Station Tower (13401 – 108th Avenue, Surrey)
 
CLOSES: Posting will remain open until filled and will close without notice


ABOUT MÉTIS NATION BRITISH COLUMBIA
 Métis Nation British Columbia (MNBC) develops and enhances opportunities for our Métis communities by implementing culturally relevant social and economic programs and services. Through teamwork, respect, dedication, accountability, integrity, and professionalism, MNBC strives to build a proud, self- governing, sustainable Nation in recognition of inherent rights for our Métis citizens, assisting in the delivery of services based on policy, process, and specified regulations.
 
 MNBC’s 
 Employer of Choice Initiatives offers employees a competitive total compensation package including: 
 
comprehensive group benefit package or health-care spending account and enrollment in the Municipal Pension Plan
15 paid days per year for statutory and cultural days (Indigenous Peoples Day, Truth and Reconciliation Day, & Louis Riel Day)
carpool, parking & public transit subsidies (Provincial Office only)
educational spending account and professional development allowances to provide annual funding to continue lifelong learning and skills upgrade.
remote workplace supports.
internal advancement & redeployment opportunities


 ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY We are seeking a highly motivated, team-orientated individual to join our Surrey Headquarters’ team as a Technical Business Analyst.  Reporting to the Manager of Digital Government and working as an integral part of our overall IMIT team, the primary purpose of the Technical Business Analyst is to work with our new digital tools to redesign existing business processes to enhance efficiencies. You will work with our departments and ministries to map out existing processes, elicit the requirements for new processes, and design new solutions. The Technical Business Analyst will work heavily in our Office 365 tenant (SharePoint), MS Power Platform (PowerAutomate), and Laserfiche to redesign paper-heavy processes into digital form. You will interact with stakeholders across MNBC and be expected to act as a subject matter expert for automation using our digital tools.  KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES ACCOUNTABILITIES

Performing systems analysis on software programs, applications, and web services
Determining system efficiency and functionality by liaising with internal departments and end- users
Reporting to Management and obtaining approval for system development projects
Efficiently integrating new systems, programs, and applications with business operations and services
Analyzing and improving the performance of web-based customer portals and support services
Lead up to three small and medium-sized projects
Conducts analysis, design, and implementation of new business processes to meet user requirements and design specifications.
Communicates technical concepts to a non-technical audience to gain consensus on changes to requirements and specifications
Functions as subject matter expert on assigned working groups and committees
Provides advice and reports to management regarding alternative solutions, product evaluation, qualitative and quality analysis, and risk assessment
Promoting system efficiency and security by integrating performance metrics and encryption

  THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Information Technology, Business Analysis, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent professional certifications
3 - 5 years of work experience as a Technical Business Analyst preferred
Have experience writing business and technical requirements documents, software design specification documents, and proposals
Understand project management, requirements gathering, and software development life cycle
Understand testing/quality assurance processes, as ensuring the quality of deliverables
Advance knowledge of data security and encryption
Programming experience with API and SDK’s preferred

  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

Demonstrates analytical, interpretative, and problem-solving skills
Excellent analytical and organizational skills
Knowledge of software development and user interface web applications
Strong knowledge of agile software development methodologies
Microsoft Power Platform certification is an asset
Laserfiche certification is an asset


 OTHER COMMENTS

Other duties may be assigned as needed to help ensure the efficient operation of MNBC.
There will be a need to attend meetings and events which may require work and travel outside of the normal business hours.
Ability to provide a satisfactory Criminal Record Check.
Valid BC Class 5 Driver’s license and access to a reliable personal vehicle for work purposes.

  The above requirements are what MNBC is seeking in the ideal incumbent at the time of posting and are subject to change based on needs.  Pursuant to section 41 of the BC Human Rights Code, preference may be given to applicants who self- identify as Aboriginal (First Nation, Métis or Inuit). All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.  PLEASE NOTE THAT CANDIDATES MUST APPLY Using “Technical Business Analyst” in the subject line of your email, please send your resume and cover letter to: Lien Trinh Manager, Digital Government Métis Nation British Columbia Email: ltrinh@mnbc.ca  MNBC is committed to promoting the health, safety, and well-being of all staff during the COVID-19 pandemic. The safety of our employees and Chartered Communities is paramount, and vaccination against COVID-19 is a key public measure to reduce the spread and severity of the virus and its variants. As such, all employees, vendors, and visitors are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Candidates for employment must provide Proof of Vaccination, to be verified by Human Resources, as a mandatory condition of their employment.

 Education : College, CEGEP or other non-university certificate or diploma from a program of 1 year to 2 years 
 Experience : 3 years to less than 5 years

Title: Analyst, Asset Management
Description:
Why join us? 

 Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story. 

 At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers. 

 Oxford is seeking an Analyst to join our Canadian Asset Management team in our corporate head office in downtown Toronto. This position supports the leasing and operating teams in a collaborative effort to focus on driving asset values and investment returns. Initially in this role, you will be driving the performance of Oxford’s Canadian business and no one asset class specifically. 

 The Asset Management group is principally responsible for improving returns and asset values, leading co-ownership relationships, developing asset management plans for each asset, and capital expenditure management. The Analyst will primarily be responsible for providing analytical support to the asset management business and will gain exposure to all facets of the Canadian business including leasing, operations, development, and investments. 

 You will be a key member of an engaged, high-reaching – part of a world-class, winning culture that prioritizes people's development and focuses on long-term growth. We take pride in leading the industry by earning respect through every interaction, every day. 


As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
 Leading a collaborative effort including key internal and external partners to update the Asset Management Plans and Strategic Investment Plans on an annual basis and develop tools to track performance against plan. The Asset Management Plans set the vision, short/mid/long-term goals, outline strategic objectives, and opportunities, and outline accountability and dates for results. 
Working collaboratively with internal partners to maximize returns and enhance asset value by driving NOI to identify revenue improvement and /or expense management opportunities through analysis of operating results, key leasing transactions, market and leasing assumptions, capital expenditures, and implementation of asset management initiatives. 
Providing analytical support and input in the preparation of annual operating, leasing, and capital budgets and quarterly re-forecasts 
Reviewing and analyzing monthly property management reports and financials, variance analysis, and benchmark comparisons 
Crafting portfolio-level tracking and summaries, return calculations, NPV and IRR analysis 
Developing and improving on existing reporting and presentations provided to internal management and co-owners 
Developing high value-add reporting including in-depth analysis on operational benchmarking, leasing performance, and capital projects 
Providing analytical support in strategizing and prioritizing capital expenditure spending in conjunction with asset management plans and return on investment objectives 
Providing asset management support to the valuations, research, development, and investment teams by providing leasing, market, and underwriting assumptions for new developments, financings, acquisitions/ dispositions, internal valuations, and other corporate activity 
Analyzing and recommending new ways to unlock value from new technology and ESG initiatives 
Conducting and performing market research and analysis on a regular basis to identify market conditions and trends 
Participating in process improvement initiatives and creation of data analytics dashboards 
Providing support on various ad-hoc analysis tasks including but not limited to major leasing and capital investment decisions, tenant financial performance and credit summaries, drawing insights from historical and budgeted property-level financials, etc. 
Gaining an understanding of co-owner return hurdles, reporting requirements, investment goals and develop processes, tools and reporting to enhance the co-ownership relationship 


To succeed in this role, you have:
 Undergraduate degree in Commerce, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Real Estate, Urban Planning, or Engineering 
2 -3 years of work experience in real estate (asset management, leasing, investments, private equity or development) 
Experience working for a real estate company, appraisal, or advisory firm is considered a strong asset 
Understanding of basic commercial real estate investment, valuation concepts and terminology. 
Exposure to multi-residential sector is considered a strong asset. 
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint, knowledge of ARGUS DCF 
Familiarity with ARGUS Enterprise, Yardi, and Power BI is considered an asset 
A self-motivated, resourceful individual with a strong work ethic and a high level of attention to detail 
Strong analytical and financial modeling, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication, presentation, problem-solving and project management skills 
Ability to multi-task, work well under pressure with multiple competing deadlines 
A flexible attitude towards a variety of work tasks as is required in a small working group 
Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt 
Driven to achieve results and continuously seeking to deliver the highest performance through creative thinking and collaboration 
Ability to work both independently and as a team member 


Our story:
 Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees. 

 For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com 

 OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

 Vaccination Policy 

 At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

Experience:

Global business environment: 2 years (preferred)
Microsoft Excel and Power BI: 2 years (preferred)

Language:

English (required)

Title: Production Operations Analyst, Planning
Description:
SCOPE

A production analyst is responsible for ensuring optimal production processes. By applying your expertise in planning and executing efficient production flow of an organization’s goods, data, or information.
The production analyst job description entails optimizing Labor cost, production volume, and efficiency by designing scheduling and staffing models that suit the needs of the organization.
It also involves ensuring that proper quality assurance is provided for products or data produced by the company.
Partner with other teams and managers to determine expected production runs within the manufacturing or data information process.
Provide for the monitoring of an on-going production process, to document unexpected slowdowns and proactively identify new bottlenecks.
Support identifying gaps for employee training or development on software or controls to improve efficiency.
It also involves increasing production by performing data analysis.
Collect, analyze, and evaluate production records and trends, as well as evaluate performance.
Responsible for analyzing production and performance reports, as well as interpreting results of overall production in order to make solid recommendations.
The production analyst work description also includes providing operations director, managers, supervisors and production team with analytical reports that are useful in the identification of opportunities to increase production.
Provide support to VP/GM of operations or relevant unit in reviewing and reporting the production forecasts.
Must also possess computing skills, especially in performing data manipulations with Excel.
Have strong communication and interpersonal skills, a detail orientation, and strong initiative to review current processes and make viable recommendations for improvements.

ACCOUNTABILITIES
A production analyst performs various functions in collaboration with the sales team, quality team, new product introduction team, test team, and finance team and ensures the timely and accurate flow of production information and control functions.

Develop and conduct reports, manage meetings, and support the manufacturing where applicable
Responsible for developing models and reporting structures that identify production rates
Responsible for developing standardized and custom reports
Perform plant production analysis
Develop tools aimed at improving production efficiencies
Interface with manufacturer to provide product delivery support to customers
Collect, compile, and present manufacturing progress and status report on weekly basis, or as requested
Serve as the primary contact and interface for sales information requests and provide support to shipping
Required to provide support during peak fulfillment periods to meet corporate financial targets
Coordinate production workflow for one or multiple products/customers
Plan and prioritize operations to ensure maximum performance and minimum delay
Determine manpower, equipment and raw materials needed to cover production demands
Work in conjunction with production management team to assign workers and other staff to production operations
Schedule shifts according to production needs
Monitor and review production plan often to ensure we meet On-Time delivery requirements for our customers/product builds
Creates and manages work orders through ERP system, updates schedule and effectively manages available time and resources; responsible for the proper configuration, planning and documentation of products and processes manufactured at Vexos.
Works and communicates with various departments to develop weekly production schedules.
Updates schedule as demands change and ensures that production is prioritized to meet external and internal customer demands.
Communicates lead time and potential production issues to customer service and configuration departments as well as internal customers in a timely manner.
Works with Supervisors to review and maintain inventory as well as analyze resource needs.
Notifies Department Head of potential resource bottlenecks in achieving 100% schedule attainment.
All other responsibilities as assigned by Manufacturing Manager.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE

Ability to multi-task and work in a fast paced, matrixed environment
Strong communication skills, ability to address things quickly and efficiently with a sense of urgency and escalation
Ability to think critically, apply logical and common sense to solve complex operational and production scheduling problems.
Experience in MRP (Manufacturing Resource Planning) tools.
Strong command of systems and ability to work with Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Excel, Word)
Strong command of the English language (written, spoken and verbal)
Good knowledge of electronic assemblies including through hole and production components, drawings and BOMS
Strong math and problem-solving skills
Familiar with IPC standards
Knowledge of quality systems and ESD control
Manufacturing experience
Perform other tasks as required
Ability to lift up to 30lbs

EDUCATION

Certificate or Diploma in Electronics or Business-related field is preferred
APICS Certification is an asset
Lean Manufacturing knowledge an asset
Experience with IPC Standards

POSITION LOCATION

Theposition is based in Markham, Ontario

Title: (Senior) Business Intake/Conflicts Analyst
Description:
Blake, Cassels & Graydon LLP (Blakes), one of Canada’s largest and most successful law firms, is currently looking for a Business Intake/Conflicts Analyst or Senior Business Intake/Conflicts Analyst to join the General Counsel’s Office in the Toronto office.
The preferred hours of work for this position are 8:00 a.m. – 4:00 p.m. Eastern Time (EST), with the request to be available for overtime from time to time, as required.
Primary responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to: 
· The timely execution of conflict searches and analysis of search data to ensure a thorough review of potential conflicts
· Conducting conflict of interest searches according to the Firm’s defined procedures and using the Firm’s new conflict searching software
· Defining appropriate search parameters, searching multiple databases to identify potential conflicts of interest and other risk issues such as sanctions, and preparing and curating conflict reports for the Firm’s lawyers to review
· Ensuring all relevant information is captured, recorded and maintained in accordance with defined policies and procedures in the Firm’s databases
· Providing coaching and assistance to legal assistants as needed to ensure all required information for new matter opening is captured and recorded accurately, and information for existing matters is updated in a timely manner
· Participating in ensuring policies, procedures and database structures are continuously reviewed and modified to meet changing requirements; the scope of initiatives can range from day-to-day small continuous improvements to the development of new tracking and reporting systems
· Supporting key projects and initiatives undertaken by the General Counsel’s Office as required to manage the Firm’s risk, as well as participating in all required clerical and administrative needs for effective functioning of the office
· Applying sound judgement to ensure effective review of conflicts and knowing when to escalate issues
· For senior role, exhibiting a keen understanding of Intapp Open, and assisting with project-specific testing for new software developments
· For senior role, providing support and guidance to junior team members, and sharing best practices
Qualifications
Education/Experience:
· Undergraduate diploma or degree preferred
· Three to five years of professional work experience in a law firm preferred
· For Senior role, working knowledge of Intapp Open and/or experience with conflict searches required
Skills/Abilities:
· Research and analytical experience
· Strong attention to detail
· Strong research and analytical skills
· Strong computer skills and demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies
· Excellent written and verbal communications skills
· Excellent customer-service attitude with the ability to handle difficult situations with tact and diplomacy
· Impeccable organizational and time management skills, and the ability to multi-task
· Sound judgement and decision-making abilities that can be relied on by all levels of management
· Strong relationship-building skills within the department and across departments
· Positive, professional disposition and flexibility to handle regular interruptions and unexpected changes to workflow
· Team player who is willing to assist peers as needed, troubleshoot problems and participate in developing solutions
How to Apply
To apply for this position, please submit your application and include your cover letter and résumé directly to our application portal.
Blakes wishes to thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Who We Are
At Blakes, we are all about our people. We are committed to not only providing exceptional client experiences, but also fostering an open and inclusive workplace culture for legal professionals and administrative professionals. As a winner of the Canada’s Best Diversity Employers award, as well as the Greater Toronto’s Top Employers award, we know that diversity and inclusion are not simply initiatives on the perimeter of our business — they are the core of our success. We understand the importance of cultivating an environment that brings out the best in each person. Our success as a Firm starts with the hiring, development and retention of top talent.
Blakes welcomes applications from all qualified applicants. The Firm is committed to maintaining an inclusive work environment comprised of people with diverse perspectives, backgrounds, identities and cultures.
The Firm provides accommodation for applicants with disabilities and in respect of other protected grounds during the recruitment process in accordance with applicable laws. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:

8 hour shift

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Our Company
 Hexagon Purus, a Hexagon Composites company, is a world leading provider of hydrogen type 4 high-pressure cylinders, battery packs and vehicle systems integration for fuel cell electric and battery electric vehicles. Hexagon Purus enables zero emission solutions for light, medium and heavy-duty vehicles, buses, ground storage, distribution, maritime, rail, aerospace, and backup power solutions. Hexagon Composites has 1100 employees across 23 global locations.
 Hexagon Purus Systems Canada Ltd. is currently seeking an ERP Analyst (Level 2) to work out of our Kelowna, British Columbia, Canada office. If you are looking to work for an organization that values sustainability and is working towards Clean Air Everywhere, then we are the place for you.
 Job Summary
 Reporting but to Vice President of Operations, responsible for Enterprise Resources Planning (ERP) setup and support using IFS (Industrial and Financial Systems) for task oversight, data manipulation/management, report generation and enterprise-wide support /guidance in product setup and process changes in the ERP software. The Business Systems Analyst will ensure that all data is accurate and functioning as per department supplied information as well as strives to achieve client and end-user requirements, using extensive knowledge of the Purus Systems products, procedures, Databases and computer systems. The Business Systems Analyst is also able to work independently; prioritize, investigate and resolve issues with minimal guidance from others. Make decision to escalate issues in a timely manner to achieve our Service Level Agreements with the business. Will be assigned as a primary functional owner for key applications (ERP) and/or modules. Expanded responsibility in functional areas increases as the person becomes more involved in additional applications.
 Duties and Responsibilities

 Works with ERP systems users from all departments/Business Units on a Global scale to determine appropriate system configuration and Data setup.
 Extensive support to functional business areas for the improvement through utilization of the ERP solution.
 Testing and Validation of new releases of ERP systems and updates to use in a production environment.
 Defines, creates and coordinates test plans, test scripts, and test procedures based on requirements. Collaborate with both internal and third-party consultants/vendors to ensure root cause issue resolution.
 Function as first line support on all ERP related issues, analyze, resolve, and/or escalate issues as they are reported to meet Service Level Agreements with the business and maintain business continuity.
 Provides guidance as administrator with knowledgeable persons throughout the Agency and its partners to help define user needs and develop data processing solutions.
 Evaluates/Prepares and Consults in recommendations for cross functional process establishment and improvement of procedures
 Participates in Change Request process to approve, document, test and certify all changes to the ERP system.
 Uses Oracle/MS SQL/PLSQL for improvements through custom Reports and customization of the ERP system.
 Creates metrics/statistics (using Power BI, SSRS, SharePoint and other software) for showcasing Efficiencies/Deficiencies to critical department sectors.
 Develops new and/or improves existing procedures to ensure integrity of ERP system and databases.
 Creates documentation and procedure guidelines for ERP systems users.
 Supports and/or leads new ERP implementations and initiatives throughout all levels of the company.
 Training, Leading and Mentoring new / less experienced users / team members on general data management logic as well as other related training on software supporting IFS integration/utilization and setup; shares new ERP and manufacturing insights and promotes a positive team environment.
 Engages with all departments to utilize IFS to its fullest through product design/configuration integration and improvements.
 Participates in brainstorming sessions and other team meetings intended to define design priorities and performance goals based on client objectives and software capabilities.
 Shows proficiency by effectively working with others in a collaborative environment under uncertain circumstances to resolve issues that require innovative and unique approaches.
 Integrates product changes into the database and controls critical data setup on a Companywide level.
 Data mining for conversion into usable datasets/reports.
 Assist in determining the impact of operational issues and provide input into their resolution via data extraction and quantification.
 Performs other duties as assigned.

 Qualifications

 5+ years of experience in ERP software within a manufacturing environment. Preferably IFS.
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field
 Proficient in Oracle and/or Microsoft server environment using SQL and PL/SQL languages.
 Advanced Microsoft Office 365 Suite skills (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Project, Power BI, SharePoint, PowerApps, InfoPath).
 Basic knowledge of Parametric 3D Cad Tools (AutoCAD, Solidworks, Creo).
 Leadership experience; planning, preparing and delivering training sessions.
 Previous experience with manufacturing and product design.
 Experience collaborating in a mechanical engineering environment.
 Ability to handle multiple jobs and adapt to a rapidly changing work environment with fluctuating priorities.
 Proven experience in overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software and hardware solutions, systems, or products.
 Demonstrated experience in successfully interacting directly with users.
 Experience supporting ERP software in a multi-distributed manufacturing environment.
 Experience utilizing methodologies such as Agile and/or Waterfall.
 Understanding of Inventory and warehousing logistics.
 Works well under pressure.
 Strong analytical and organizational skills as well as the ability and commitment to produce accurate work on a tight schedule.
 Excellent time management and decision-making skills
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills at all levels (including fluency in English), with an emphasis on clarity and positive collaboration. Additional languages a plus.
 Valid passport with ability to travel Globally.

 Work Environment and Physical Demands
 This job operates in a professional office environment.
 The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
 This is largely a sedentary role; however, some travel may be required by car or plane.
 Valid driver’s license and good driving record required. Travel availability of approximately 10% of the time within the US and internationally, with the ability to travel on short notice
 Disclaimer
 The above statements are intended to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position. They are not designed to contain or be interpreted as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, skills, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
 Hexagon Purus Systems is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and ensures that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, religion, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, age, criminal conviction and political belief.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.
 The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.
 This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.
 Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.



Job Description

About this Role
 If you love digging in the data, have a good eye for details and analytical mind this position represents an exciting challenge for you. You will thrive in a dynamic team whose mandate is to quantify impacts for diverse Risk Events inside of TD Insurance.  You will be asked to produce assessments, correction lists, error lists, reimbursement list, controls, dashboards, investigations, etc. and to prepare scripts for automation and to run the actual weekly and/or monthly production. Finally, this position offers excellent career opportunities within the TD Bank Group.  Working in the Risk Events team, here are some of the tasks you will have to do: Extract, validate, and transform data using SQL Hive & Impala, Pyspark, Python, JupyterLab, etc. Produce assessments, correction lists, error lists, reimbursement list, controls, dashboards, weekly/monthly production.

 Realize complex analysis using company data to quantify errors.
 Extract and transform data from all sources: AKORA Hadoop, Oracle, Excel, Text, hdfs, etc.
 Communicate using common business language with colleagues from various departments: BOC, Underwriting, Actuarial, Finance, Product Management, IT, Business Analysts, etc.
 Do different analysis and research to explain data discrepancies and provide impact analysis. Explain gaps between different data sources.
 Develop knowledge and understanding of tables and their relationships within different layers of AKORA Hadoop architecture and external data sources.




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

 Knowledge of programming: Hive, Impala, Pyspark, JupyterLab, etc.
 Excellent knowledge of programming data extraction: SQL
 Experience in data analysis, actuarial, or the field of mathematics/statistics.
 Experience using Hadoop ecosystem.
 Quick learner, autonomous and responsible.
 Be analytical, rigorous, and quality conscious.
 Good team player.
 Communicate verbally and orally in English, basic French or more (or committed to learn)
 Relevant knowledge of residential and automobile insurance (P&C insurance)- asset




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Initiatives Analyst, Treasury
Description:
Analyze current and create the future state of organizational work flows and systems; re-engineer and improve business systems, work flows, services and programs ensuring they reflect and support divisional and organizational business plans and initiatives. Identify, design and implement both change and improvement initiatives.
Lead Treasury Branch projects and initiatives developing future state of workflows and systems.
Provide advice, consultation, analysis and technical guidance to ensure the effective planning, analysis and design of new business changes and realization of process efficiencies.Major Duties and Responsibilities: 

As project and initiative leader, plan and scope the future state of workflows and systems. This involves identifying and documenting business needs and associated system processing, developing and proposing alternative solutions, outlining assumptions, constraints, costs and benefits; monitoring and providing ongoing updates on project progress, coordinating workflow, system and process testing, clarifying issues and resolving problems.


Re-engineer and improve current business processes, services, systems and programs. This includes conducting research, analysis and investigation into business processes, identifying opportunities for automation and process efficiencies, developing, testing and implementing innovative solutions and initiating activity to ensure processes reflect and support divisional and organizational business plans. Facilitate program development by identifying, investigating, recommending and overseeing the implementation of solutions to realize efficiencies and correct deficiencies in current business services, processes, and programs; and in developing new processes, services, programs and reports.


Facilitate the creation of and agreement to business requirements in order to support change initiatives by reviewing, evaluating and identifying problems and opportunities; identifying and documenting business requirements for process/system changes/enhancements; obtaining agreement and sign-off to ensure the requirements are accurate and reflect business needs; documenting the business requirements. Represent Treasury and act as central contact between project team members, management, business owners, Information Technology Cluster (ITC), external consultants and vendors to facilitate successful implementation.


Perform data and trend analysis to identify, document and inform management on potential impacts of projects, initiatives and system and process changes. Maintain and validate data used in performing analysis. Create, run and validate queries to ensure regular monitoring of business activities. Develop ad hoc queries using various software (ie. Cognos, Ms Access, Excel, PeopleSoft, etc.) to provide business intelligence to management and support decision making.


Develop and maintain databases and applications such as employer payments to support Treasury business activities and transactions and to provide ad hoc and routine report


Act as technical resource or subject matter expert and provide systems, business, technical and analytical expertise to clients including Treasury, Finance, and other areas within the organization as required, , for process and program design, and key business initiatives. Participate in corporate, divisional, and branch projects and initiatives. Represent the Treasury branch on all aspects of corporate-wide projects, including providing business requirements and testing.


Develop and maintain ongoing communication linkages within and between the branch and other areas within the WSIB and Corporate Project Teams. Communicate with organization change enablers to identify current practices, processes, systems and methodologies to devise and implement strategies to cover any obstacles. Provide post implementation support.


Develop educational and instructional materials (including but not limited to system training materials, system and user guides, handbooks, and quick reference guides). Deliver system training on important system or procedural changes to users. Provide follow-up post implementation support by resolving problems and developing procedures, charts and matrices to familiarize staff with changes.


Perform other related duties as assigned or required, such as all aspects of User Acceptance Testing.

Job Requirements: Education

University degree at the undergraduate level with a specialty focus in business administration or computer science.

Experience

Five years prior experience in business administration, analytics and workflow processes.

Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusionWe respect and value the diversity of our people. We strive to create an environment where employees can be themselves and where our differences are celebrated.The WSIB is committed to being accessible and inclusive, and following barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please let us know when we contact you and we will work with you to meet your needs.Disclosing conflicts of interestAs public servants, employees at the WSIB have a responsibility to act in an ethical way at all times to create a respectful workplace and maintain public trust. Job applicants are required to disclose any circumstance that could result in a real, potential or perceived conflict of interest. A conflict of interest is any situation where your private interests may impair or be perceived to impair the decisions you make in your official capacity. This may include: political activity, directorship, other outside employment and certain personal relationships (e.g. with current WSIB employees, customers and/or stakeholders). If you have any questions about conflict of interest obligations and/or how to make a disclosure, please contact the Talent Acquisition Centre at talentacquisitioncentre@wsib.on.ca.Privacy information
We collect personal information from your resume, application, cover letter and references under the authority of the Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997. The Talent Acquisition Centre and WSIB hiring parties will used this information to assess/validate your qualifications, determine if you meet the requirements of vacant positions and/or gather information relevant for recruitment purposes. If you have questions or concerns regarding the collection and use of your personal information, please contact the WSIB’s Privacy Office at privacy_office@wsib.on.ca. The Privacy Office cannot provide information about the status of your application.As a precondition of employment, the WSIB requires that prospective candidates undergo a criminal records name check any time before or after they are hired.To apply for this position, please submit your application by the closing date.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Performance Analyst
Description:
Job Posting


     Halifax Regional Municipality is inviting applications for the Term position of 
     Senior Performance Analyst in Corporate Performance.Halifax Regional Municipality(HRM) is committed to reflecting the community it serves & recognizing Diversity & Inclusion as one of the Municipality’s core values.We have an Employment Equity Policy & we welcome applications from African Nova Scotians & Other Racially Visible Persons,Women in occupations or positions where they are underrepresented in the workforce,Indigenous/Aboriginal People,Persons with Disabilities & 2SLGBTQ+ Persons.Applicants are encouraged to self-identify on their electronic application
     
 Reporting to the Manager,Corporate Performance,the Senior Performance Analyst serves as a consultant & business solutions specialist to the organization,leading,evaluating,planning & implementing improvements in business processes & performance practices.The Senior Performance Analyst monitors performance effectiveness & recommends business solutions aligned with the business improvement cycle established within the Corporate Performance Management Program.
     

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:


Performance Management & Measurement



Develop/maintain key performance indicator & financial analysis data/reports developed in conjunction with Finance
Oversee development of report dashboards/identify opportunity for improvement
Propose strategic recommendations to enhance business value & drive performance improvement related to financial/operational metrics
Facilitate leadership & executive performance review meetings to drive actionable outcomes to hold the organization accountable to objectives
Create models that depict &/or predict trends in service delivery
Maintain governance process associated with key performance indicators & Corporate Performance Management Program


 Business Case Preparation & Benefits Realization:



Lead BU through development of business cases/obtain approval of senior management to proceed gated portfolio process
Analyze/model current state of a service,function,or business process to create a complete picture of existing process flow.
Identify/recommend possible efficiency gains to BU management & monitor progress on achieving intended benefit
Work with Manager/team responsible for establishing Benefits Realization program with forecast/actual benefit


 Business Process Improvements:



Develop process/standardized procedures for core business & service process
Collect/analyze information & present findings on complex issues
Identify opportunity for process improvement & make recommendation to service owners,including changes to job functions,elimination &/or creation of positions
Document business process using relevant modelling techniques such as Swim-lane & Value Stream Mapping


 Project Delivery



Manage projects ensuring effective collaboration amongst team
Create business requirement documents & obtain stakeholder/senior management approval
Analyze training needs/support development of training programs
Responsible for supervising analysts/mentoring team members in the business analysis/project management discipline


 QUALIFICATIONS

Education & Experience



Undergraduate degree in Industrial Engineering,Business Administration,Public Administration or a suitable combination of a degree/experience
5+years work experience in an analytical,strategic planning,or project management role.Must have experience in performance reporting,analyzing data & process improvement
Project Management &/or Business Analysis Certification
Master’s degree,Continuous Improvement Training/Certification, & Change Management Certifications considered an asset

 Minimum 3 years experience with:
 o Implementation/delivery of projects,having participated in all aspects of project life cycle
      o Developing effective/efficient solutions to diverse/complex business problems
      o Interacting with senior management to document,analyze,& recommend solutions & business changes
      o Leading,training& mentoring junior analysts/staff
      o Building relationships with stakeholders including senior management,clients,& technical staff
      o Perform adult education/training
      o Conduct cost benefit analysis
      o Experience in service improvement/business process improvement
     

Technical/Job Specific Knowledge:


Experience using statistical computer language(R,Python,SQL,etc)to manipulate data/draw insight from large data set considered an asset
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques & concepts (regression,properties of distributions, statistical tests & proper usage,etc) & experience with applications
Experience with report writing within Business Intelligence system considered an asset
Advanced proficiency in requirements gathering & documenting,business process modelling & improvement analysis
Proficiency in Microsoft Office/diagramming tools such as MS Visio


 Security Clearance Requirements:Applicants may be required to complete an employment security screening check
     

Please note –Testing may be conducted as a component of the selection process to assess technical/job specific knowledge. Candidates selected for testing,may be tested in a group setting,scheduled at the employer’s discretion
     
 HRM takes the health & safety of its job applicants & employees seriously.Where possible,recruitment testing & interviews will be done by way of phone,video conference,or other virtual means to assist with & encourage social distancing.For applicants with concerns about computer/internet access or to request another accommodation to the recruitment process,please contact your HR representative or jobs@halifax.ca
     

Competencies:Valuing Diversity,Analytical Thinking,Communications,Customer Service,Organizing & Planning,Teamwork & Cooperation ,Organizational Awareness
     

WORK STATUS:Term (up to 18 months)full time
     
 HOURS OF WORK:Monday-Friday,8:30am to 4:30pm for 35 hrs/wk
     

SALARY:Non-Union,NU8 $81,000-$111,400
     
 WORK LOCATION:40 Alderney
     

CLOSING DATE:Applications will be received up to 11:59pm on July 17,2022
     

Please note:We thank all applicants for their interest in this position.Only those applicants selected for interview/testing will be contacted
     
 During the recruitment process,applicants have the right to request accommodation.Applicants invited to participate in assessment process(such as an interview or testing)& who require accommodation,should discuss their needs with Recruiter when invited to assessment process

Title: BHJOB15656_17201 - Business Analyst
Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 154532  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team 
The Global Engineering Fraud, Enterprise Crisis Management, Corporate Security and Global Operations Architecture team develops and manages innovative products designed to support the ever-changing threat landscape. We work in close partnership with our Corporate Security, Fraud Business and key Technology Partners throughout Scotiabank to drive technology on a global basis. We are key team members within Enterprise Technology to ensure business strategies, plans and initiatives are executed /delivered in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

 The Role 
We are seeking an energetic, self-starter willing to take on a challenge! This position will deliver against ongoing and new initiatives to support our Corporate Security (CS) portfolio. CS uses Splunk application to enable seamless digital fraud investigation for more timely proactive fraud risk mitigation efforts. This allows the Bank to streamline and automate the investigative process and generate real time alerts. The incumbent is responsible, through independent contribution and the management/supervision of Senior Manager, for the resolution of complex business problems for the assigned Lines of Business. This includes participating in multiple projects or sections of large projects and providing ongoing support to all assigned units. Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on each user needs and a good understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements for the assigned Lines of Business and devises or modifies procedures to solve complex business problems. Includes analyzing business and user needs, documenting requirements and translating them into proper systems requirement specifications. The individual must thrive on challenge, be proactive and dynamic, and demonstrate initiative and eagerness to learn.

 Some of the Key Accountabilities include:

Independently resolve complex, multi-faceted problems to meet the business needs of the assigned Lines of Business, by applying their business requirements gathering knowledge to the design of methodologies, models, and/or systems solutions. This may involve rapid prototyping, with requirements and solutions developed on an iterative basis that provides interim deliverables until a final production solution is created. This includes conducting research and analysis, accurately and clearly defining user requirements and processes, and liaising with the users.
Participate in the systems implementation process by defining business requirements and processes, developing and/or reviewing test strategies and test cases, performing testing as required, documenting user procedures and workflows, developing conversion and implementation strategies and plans, verifying conversion, providing user documentation, providing user training, and providing post-implementation support.
Provide business support to all relevant areas, including investigation/analysis/resolution of issues and opportunities, user training, and assisting with the design and implementation of systems enhancements. This is made more challenging due the variation in business units/other stakeholders. The incumbent is responsible for ensuring that management is kept informed, and that problems and issues are escalated appropriately.
Continually acquire and enhance knowledge of the Division's business strategies and policies, risk management practices and methodologies, product offerings, fraud controls, Corporate Security policies and rapidly changing technology to be able to provide effective business solutions and services to the end user business lines.
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.


 What You Will Bring to Succeed 



10+ years of IT experience.
 Previous experience in systems integration, Integrating 3rd party vendor products experience.
 The incumbent must be a creative, self-starting, results-oriented, and highly motivated individual with very good analytical skills in order to apply this knowledge to independently resolve complex business problems.
 The inclement must have a good understanding of business system analysis.
 Further, the incumbent must demonstrate leadership skills with very good interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills in order to build consensus and obtain co-operation from the team, end-users and senior management. These skills, along with the incumbent's good time management and organizational skills, will allow the incumbent to effectively manage small projects, while planning and scheduling resources within those projects to optimize productivity.
 The incumbent must also possess a very good understanding of systems development techniques, including requirements specification and testing methodologies, and keep current with rapidly changing technology, experience with complex data, data mapping, user workflows and reporting.
 The incumbent must also possess a good understanding and experience in Agile methodology.
 Excellent problem-solving skills - have vision and innovative approach in resolving production issues, incidents, and the ability to convey them to our internal and external stakeholders.
 Must be flexible to adapt to a dynamic environment, make quick and sound decisions under pressure.
 Must be reliable, pro-active, results-oriented, customer-focused, and attentive to details.

Description:
