Title: Senior BI Developer/Analyst
Description:
BE authentic. BE influential. BE the expert. Be all that and more at Colliers.
 


   At Colliers, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.
 


   BE authentic. BE influential. BE the expert. Be all that and more at Colliers International. Join our team as a Senior Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst in Toronto, ON.
 


   Who you are
 

   As Senior BI Developer/ Analyst you will be part of a high performing, Enterprise Information Management team that’s working on the company’s data initiatives. You will work closely with the global and regional Architecture teams and be involved in the building and maintenance of the company’s data-related solutions, including the data management and enterprise data warehouse.
 


   You will be an energetic, high aptitude, and self-starting individual who is seeking career growth within a fast-paced, flexible, and rapidly growing company. Communication skills and out-of-the-box thinking is key as exploring new technologies to create innovative solutions is highly encouraged.
 


   What you bring
 

 Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, or related field; or equivalent work experience
 Depth and breadth of technical experience in data architecture, data quality, data integration, data migration, data warehousing/data lake projects, and data analytics.
 5-10 years of BI design and development experience in the following: SQL Server (2012 or newer), Power BI, SSAS, SSIS, Enterprise Data Warehouse architecture/development or other BI Stack.
 Demonstrated experience in evaluating business processes and recommending improvements.
 Experience working in a collaborative and team-oriented environment
 Excellent SQL query skills



   Bonus Skills and experience
 

 Familiar with SQL Master Data Services (MDS) and Data Quality Services (DQS)
 Experience with Data Lake and AI/ML solutions
 Experience in developing within Azure Cloud Services
 Knowledge of Dynamics CRM and/or Salesforce



   What success looks like
 

 You bring a depth and breadth of technical experience in data architecture, data quality, data integration, data migration, data warehousing/data lake projects, and data analytics.
 You will successfully design creative solutions for multiple projects in different Canadian lines of business (data warehouses, etc.) to meet the long-term goals of the organization



   #LI-MB1
 


   BE who you are and what you want to be with Colliers. We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team.
 


   Please be aware that due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Colliers professionals in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated to attend any Colliers workplace. As a condition of commencing any role, you will be required to self-report your vaccination status and provide verifying documentation. Should you require medical or religious accommodation related to vaccination please discuss with your Talent Acquisition Advisor.
 

 Direct applicants only please, no agencies.
 

 Colliers is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@colliers.com.

Title: Market Research Professional Services Analyst (Contract)
Description:
What we're looking for
 A passionate market research consulting professional with a strong understanding of survey software and excellent customer-facing skill
 This position is a contract role with the potential to becoming permanent.
 You will

Lead customers through market research projects including consultation, survey design, survey programming, working with vendors on translations, data analysis, and data reporting including data tables and tracker programs.
Provide technical expertise as a market research expert including knowledge of the SurveyMonkey platform, additional solutions, analysis methodologies, market research use cases, and integrations
Manage large-scale data projects, client-facing documents, and presentations
Use SurveyMonkey software knowledge to configure surveys and reports and participate in the implementation design, setup, and review processes

You have

3+ years professional experience in a client-facing role
3+ years of professional experience in market research
Experience using DIY market research tools (including survey design and analysis)
Experience with analytical tools such as SPSS and Excel (maintaining complex spreadsheets and functions)
Consultative selling skills and ability to show customer empathy
Understanding of a range of research techniques
Data gathering skills and market research data skills
Experience solving problems in customer-facing situations

Who we are and what we do
 Momentive (NASDAQ: MNTV), maker of SurveyMonkey, is a leader in agile experience management, delivering powerful, purpose-built solutions that bring together the best parts of humanity and technology to redefine AI. Momentive products, including GetFeedback, SurveyMonkey, and its brand and market insights solutions, empower decision-makers at 345,000 organizations worldwide to shape exceptional experiences. More than 20 million active users rely on Momentive to fuel market insights, brand insights, employee experience, customer experience, and product experience. Our vision is to improve human experiences by amplifying individual voices. Learn more at Momentive.ai.
 What we offer our employees
 Momentive is a place where the curious come to grow and shape what's next. By embedding inclusion into our processes, policies, benefits, and culture for our 1,600+ employees across North America, Europe, and APAC, we're building a workplace where people of every background can excel.
 We've won multiple Culture and Employee awards, including Comparably's Best Workplace for Women and Diversity, and received recognition for our forward-looking benefits policies, including best workplace for parents, vendor benefits standards, our annual holiday refresh, retirement benefits, and Take 4 sabbaticals.
 Our commitment to an inclusive workplace
 Momentive is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We celebrate the unique differences of our employees because that is what drives curiosity, innovation, and the success of our business. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic information, political affiliation, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities.
 #LI-remote

Title: Technology Business Analyst, Capital Markets
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 The Opportunity

 We currently have career opportunities for Senior Consultants and Managers in our Canadian Capital Markets (CM) consulting team. Our team works to build a better world by transforming businesses through the potential of our people, technology, and innovation. Emerging technologies are transforming all lines of business and requires our customers to embrace these new technological capabilities and see them as new competitive advantages.

 We work collaboratively with some of the top executives in financial institutions of all sizes and scales, helping them create and realize the best solutions for the future of their business. Each project is different, so you’ll need to be able to excel in ambiguous situations and confidently navigate ever-changing circumstances. We’ll look to you to be a self-starter, have the ability to translate complex information into simple terms, manage teams, and deliver long-term solutions with confidence. On this team, you’ll have the unique opportunity to imagine the future as well as create it, where you can craft ideas and implement them for our clients.

 Your Key Responsibilities

 As a part of the CM practice, you will advise clients and assist in solving Business and Technology problems in Capital Markets industry. You will provide clients with functional analysis, design, implementation, and technical program management support services.

 You will support or lead the delivery of customer engagements, build customer relationships and lead team development. This will include generating new business opportunities by developing ideas and solutions to present to internal and external clients.

 This will include assisting with performing analysis of business requirements, translating requirements into functional specifications, design of technical solutions and requirements for implementation by development teams. Assisting with feature design, business process decomposition, supporting technical system integration, configuration of systems, modernization, optimization, decommissioning and analysis of underlying front to back data requirements

 You will also be able to support client technology organizations with front to back SDLC, provide hands-on support across one or multiple phases of the process and have experience with Technical Project Management and Agile ways of working.

 Individually and as a member of EY team, you will converse with the with Capital Markets buy side and sell side technology, operations and business clients on traded products and the end-to-end trade lifecycle levels of AVP to Senior VP/Director. You will have the ability to understand business problems and advise on proposed technology solutions. Summarize and document technical discussions, translate technical decisions into business English language and communicate with client’s business stakeholders. Liaise between business and technology teams.

 You will have the ability to effectively integrate with and leverage offshore development teams to scale and accelerate software delivery to meeting deadlines and close work

 Skills and attributes for success

 Agile, growth-oriented mindsets. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world. Experience in business development or delivering against financial targets in a service-oriented context is a plus
 High-performance tech leaders. A strong track record of management of large teams delivering strategic technology-enabled transformations and major digital implementations. Demonstrated team leadership experience in complex contexts, in addition to project management, advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
 Great communicators. Communication is key — we strive to bring our best interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, whether we’re writing an e-mail, building a proposal, drafting an architecture diagram, or cutting code. It is required to be bilingual (French/ English) to work in the Montreal office
 Curiosity and purpose. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world, and who are committed to integrity in every environment
 Integrity and inclusivity. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust


 To qualify for the role, you must have

 Capital Markets Business domain expertise. Intimate knowledge of the trading environment (front, middle, and back office), trading instruments (including Derivatives and Exotics across multiple asset classes), pricing, risk, and knowledge of the risk and regulatory issues within the Capital Markets businesses lines.
 Capital Markets Technology experience. Practical knowledge of the Capital Markets and investment division business and technical architecture and workflows. Experience with implementation of trading and risk platforms; especially with experience in Murex or Calypso.
 Hands-on experience with delivering technology solutions in Capital Markets industry across any of the following process areas:
   
 Transaction processing from pre-trade to settlement, transaction pricing, market risk, position / portfolio management, collateral management, client onboarding as well as risk and regulatory concepts
 Understanding of technology environments across Capital Markets; typical integration of key systems and platforms (trade capture, pricing, reference data, market data, etc.)
 Understanding of basic principles of financial data modeling; data shape, size, velocity of change
 Strong knowledge of transaction lifecycle across CM (FO-MO-BO)
 Strong knowledge of financial instruments and asset classes (e.g., fixed income, multi asset derivatives, equities, FX, commodities)
 Overall understanding of the front to back capital markets data value chain
 Excellent analytical skills with ability to systematically resolve technical problems
 Attention to detail, strong interpersonal skills, good communication across all levels of seniority in an organization


 Ideally, you’ll also have

 Technical Skills (Technologies)

 Experience with technology implementation or support for core CM systems/ applications such as Murex and Calypso
 Deep understanding of the Murex and Calypso product suite, including its application across sell and buy side firms
 Advanced level of application implementation in modern programming languages C++, Java, Scala, Python, Node, or similar programming languages common in financial industry
 Strong understanding of computer science concepts including data structures, algorithm design, complexity, time, state
 Comfortable with object-oriented programming
 Experience working with RDF, JSON, XML and other standard data frameworks and standards
 Strong services-based implementation skills for building scalable, enterprise-grade solutions. SOAP, REST.
 Experience with industry standard RDMS (e.g., MySQL, SQL Server, PostgresSQL) and No-SQL datastores.
 Comfortable working with large data sets, complex objects, performing analysis, modelling and linage
 Demonstrated experience with DevOps technologies (requirements management, version control, automated unit testing, code reviews, build and deployment).
 Understanding business and functional requirements, translating into technical requirements, and designing solutions
 Experience in architecture and design of solutions based on functional requirements
 Experience with application integration, upgrade, decommissioning
 Experience building and deploying applications in cloud
 Leading development teams, agile pods
 Strong knowledge of SDLC, and agile methodologies; experience delivering solutions in an agile environment. Experience with TDD and pairing

 Desired Skills

 BSc/BA in Data Science/ Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; MBA or other relevant graduate degree is a plus [5+ years]
 SCRUM master and PMP certification is a plus
 Understanding of DLT, Cloud, AI/ML technologies and use cases in Capital Markets
 Knowledge of capital markets technology industry trends; knowledge of FinTech’s and their offerings
 Developing technology strategy, architecture principles, product roadmap
 Comfortable interacting with business stakeholders and clients for the purposes of understanding of business problems and design of solutions

 What we look for
 Successful candidates will have a leadership presence with a proven track record of sales and delivery in a management consulting context with established client relationships and experience in Canada.
 What we offer
 At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients, and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.
 We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial, and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

 Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
 Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
 The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 Diversity and Inclusion at EY  Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 EY Way of Work and your health and safety

 EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.

 EY | Building a better working world

 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Are you adept at creating action plans based on business needs and a proficient problem-solver? The Business Analyst will be responsible for the documentation, analysis, and elicitation of business and technical needs across multiple business units. To be successful in this role, you must have exceptional communication skills and a proven ability to communicate technical and business requirements alike. 

 Major responsibilities 



Checks that complex requirements are executable, testable, complete and not ambiguous
Extracts and documents requirements through user stories, use cases, process flow diagrams, etc.
Works with and builds relationships with business units, development teams, and other stakeholders to gather, analyze and prioritize requests
Provides technical and functional support as needed by end users, internal teams and external vendors.
Assists data engineers/dba to create, coordinate, and conduct regular data-cleansing to eliminate corrupt or redundant information from application databases.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business Administration or equivalent work experience
Background working with a variety of simple to complex projects
Ability to communicate to all levels in an organization, strong problem-solving skills, adaptable, flexible, proactive and willing to take ownership
Experience with Agile methodology
4+ years of business analysis experience
Strong focus on relationship building, and communication skills
Experience eliciting and documenting requirements in a clear and concise manner
Comfortable writing basic to moderately complex SQL queries, as well as technical skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Jira (or similar tool)
Experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP implementations is an asset
 Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles. 

 Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go. Download the Robert Half app and get 1-tap apply, instant notifications for AI-matched jobs, and more. 

 Questions? Call your local office at 
1.888.490.4429. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada. 

 © 2022 Robert Half. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to Robert Half’s Terms of Use .

Title: Senior Business System Analyst
Description:
Senior Business System Analyst


 Job Purpose & Summary 
The Senior Business System Analyst provides complex system analysis, software deployment, testing and application support on projects, enhancements and operations related to one or more business system applications including Member onboarding, account & loan origination, and core banking. This role will consult with business partners, vendors, and colleagues to identify user requirements, perform business processes and systems analysis, and help develop overall project solutions.
 This role is considered a subject matter expert in the business processes(es) their assigned business system(s) support.


 Key Accountabilities & Duties 

Coordinate with business, vendor, and third-party stakeholders to develop and implement technical updates to business applications
Participate in projects as an IT resource, complete IT-related takeaways and communicate updates and findings to stakeholders
Provide project-level analysis, producing required documentation deliverables such as business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) recommendations
Provide and support the implementation of business solutions, identifying business needs, determining, and carrying out necessary processes, practices, monitoring progress and results
Manage and prioritize the project queue of system development projects to support strategic business projects and business optimization
Lead meetings with various partners in the business and use business analyst techniques and methodologies to gather business and technical requirements for a project
Collaborate with business SMEs to ensure needs are being met based on project criteria
Understand and translate or clearly explain business and technical requirements to software developers, vendors, and executives
Perform data extraction and analysis from DUCA’s core banking system and other business applications
Maintain a foundational understanding of DUCA’s databases and record structure; advise DUCA executives on reporting and analytical capabilities
Manage DUCA’s internal change management processes for changes to assigned business systems
Work with project managers, business analysts, developers, and system architects to complete high-priority system technical issues
Manage system releases (content, organizational impacts, etc.) and release schedule
Work with the Quality Assurance team to ensure that application releases and updates are free from errors and satisfy end user requirements
Provide third level technical support for assigned business applications, including database updates and third-party interfaces



 Occupational Experience & Education Requirements 

Undergraduate degree in Business, Technology, or a related field
Business Analysis Training or Certification
5 years’ experience in a Banking System Analyst or Business Analyst role
2-3 years’ experience working with a banking system
Experience in a financial institution or credit union considered an asset



 Knowledge, Skills & Attributes

Strong understanding of Business Process Management
Strong research and analytical skills
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Strong interpersonal skills and communication Skills
Proven problem-solving skills
Experience with requirements management
Experience with Account and/or Loan Origination Systems considered an asset
Keen to understand and learn unfamiliar processes
Good understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Good knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL)
Experience with Relational Databases
Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel
Experience with Web Service troubleshooting
Experience with Business Process Management tools (e.g.. Visio)
Experience supporting Central 1 Member Direct or another Online Banking System
Understanding of ITIL Framework
Understanding of application integration standards (e.g. ISO, SOAP, REST, XML)



 Working Conditions
 This position is required to work weekends and nights as necessary to ensure all business applications used in the end-to-end Member sales and services processes are available 24-7 and to support after regular business hours deployments of new systems, patches, fixes, and/or other enhancements.




Department: Information Technology
 Primary Location: Corporate Office
 Employment Status: Full-time
 Hours per Week: 38
 Job Grade Level: 7

About DUCA
 DUCA exists to help people do more, be more and achieve more with their money and their lives. We’re driven by a co-operative philosophy that puts our Members (and Owners) at the centre of every decision we make, gives them a voice in how we’re run, and rewards them for their loyalty by sharing our profits.
 At DUCA, we’re dedicated to creating a positive environment where our employees have growth and development opportunities, a healthy work/life balance, opportunities to give back to the community, and a focus on doing what is right for our Members. DUCA offers a competitive total compensation package including base salary, a short-term incentive (bonus) program, a comprehensive benefits program, pension plan, and employee banking benefits.

DUCA is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Recruitment related accommodations will be provided upon request.
 Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit their application. Applications must include both a resume and cover letter.
 We thank all applicants but only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Parkland is an independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. We’re helping communities stay on the move and our team members serve retail, commercial, and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region and the Americas. Our purpose as Parklanders is to energize people and businesses to get them where they want to go. We’re a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster.
 Position Title: Business Analyst – Power BI (1 year term)
 Team and Location: Calgary, AB
 Position Summary:
 The Business Analyst – Power BI will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of reports in Power BI and other BI platforms for the Commercial Division. Tasks will include gathering and analyzing business requirements to implement timely, accurate, value-add and innovative Business Intelligence (BI) solutions. The position also includes contribution to the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) of those assigned systems of products. This position understands the underlying Business and related technical processes of the application they are assigned to and is involved whenever the Business or IT requires changes to those processes
 Key Responsibilities:

 Deliver timely, accurate, value-add BI solutions for the Commercial Division by understanding and gathering requirements from business stakeholders.
 Responsible for analysis, translation and documentation of business requirements to technical and functional requirements for BI solutions development Ensure BI solutions align with organizational objectives, processes, direction, and architectural strategies.
 Actively involved in and contribute throughout the SDLC, which includes:


 Gather and analyze requirements;
 Design and develop reports, dashboards, KPI scorecards, aggregating data from multiple sources;
 Assist with data modeling and ETL;
 Assist with or administer testing;
 Change owner for Commercial;
 Assist with training material;
 Assists business with developing business cases.


 Support Incident Management, provide assistance with diagnosis and resolution of escalated production issues.
 Act as Commercial liaison for internal contacts related to the Business Intelligence tools and provide Subject Matter Expert (SME) knowledge to the prioritizing process for business requests.

 Qualifications and Skills:

 Post-secondary education in Computer Science would be an asset however relevant experience or related education would also be considered.
 Minimum 2-3 years of experience in a BI delivery role.
 Minimum of 2 years of Business Analysis or equivalent experience.
 Expertise with Microsoft BI toolset including: SSMS, SSRS, and Power BI.
 Aptitude for data analytics and reporting and have a strong background in all aspects of database technology.
 Possess data driven problem solving skills and ability to translate visualization of large datasets.
 Minimum intermediate experience in M-code (Power Query), DAX, and SQL.
 Knowledge of Data Warehouse Lifecycle and Dimensional Modeling.
 Experience with Other Business Intelligence software would be an asset.
 Ability to guide and educate end users on implemented BI solutions as well as support and troubleshoot any business BI related concerns or issues.
 Exposure to change management methodology.
 Knowledge of JDE and Infosys would be an asset.
 Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle or Agile delivery.
 Effective communication for technical and non-technical audiences.

 We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted. Please note:

 Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
 Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
 Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

Title: Business Analyst III
Description:
Company Overview Company Overview 

 Incedo is a US-based consulting, data science and technology services firm with over 2,500 people helping clients from our six offices across US and India. We help our clients achieve competitive advantage through end-to-end digital transformation. Our uniqueness lies in bringing together strong engineering, data science, and design capabilities coupled with deep domain understanding. We combine services and products to maximize business impact for our clients in telecom, financial services, product engineering and life science & healthcare industries. 
Working at Incedo will provide you an opportunity to work with industry leading client organizations, deep technology and domain experts, and global teams. Incedo University, our learning platform, provides ample learning opportunities starting with a structured onboarding program and carrying throughout various stages of your career. A variety of fun activities are also an integral part of our friendly work environment. Our flexible career paths allow you to grow into a program manager, a technical architect or a domain expert based on your skills and interests. 
Role Description Company Value Company Value 

 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity at Incedo. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: BI Developer
Description:
When you join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll be part of an inquisitive team that shares your passion for exploration and discovery. With revenues of more than $40 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and chances to create significant contributions to the world.
 The BI Developer role supports the business functions by using data technologies to drive continuous improvement within the organization. This team member is responsible for growing and optimizing our data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and transformation of raw data into useful datasets. This position will collaborate with our Data Architects, Database Administrators, and Data Analysts on data initiatives and will ensure efficient data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You will have the ability to act as a mentor to help guide and teach others on SQL Server standard methodologies to build an outstanding Supply Chain Analytics team.
 Key Responsibilities: 

Design, code, test, and detail all new or modified applications, tools and reports applying software development agile methodologies.
 Design, document, construct and deploy database architectures and applications.
 Develops, monitors, and maintains ETL processes that extract, transform, and load data from the Data Warehouse and other data sources for use in Supply Chain applications.
 Prepare and deliver automated reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential issues in systems across the Supply Chain.
 Creates metrics for reports and impactful key performance indicators to assist drive interpersonal management in a goal-oriented environment.
 Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for new systems and post-implementation support.
 Deliver training to end users for all modified and new business systems.
 Identifies and provides input to new technology opportunities that will have a positive impact on improving the BI systems.
 Perform analysis for a wide range of requests using data in different formats and from various platforms.
 Perform code reviews to provide continuous improvement to customers.
 Provide technical mentoring to developers and analysts.

 Required Skills and Qualifications

 A Bachelor’s Degree in one of the following: MIS, Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Sciences, or relevant field
 3-+ years relevant experience as a BI Developer or Software Developer using the Microsoft SQL Server Stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS)
 3+ years of SQL Server development experience with T-SQL to build, UDFs, Stored Procedures, Views, Indexed Views and Tables
 2+ years of modern data warehouse architecture design and implementation in Azure and/or AWS
 Azure Synapse Analytics (SQL DW), Azure Data Factory, Azure Blob and/or Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Analysis Services
 AWS Redshift, Aurora, DMS (w / CDC), Glue, Lambda, S3
 Solid understanding of database design principles using normalization and standard methodologies
 Good experience applying the Systems Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
 Experience with SSIS and/or Azure Data Factory for ETL operations
 Demonstrable experience in using MS OLAP technologies in SSAS both Multi-dimensional and Tabular
 Extensive experience with development, deployment, and administration of business intelligence tools such as Power BI for dashboards and reports
 O365 products and services experience a plus
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills

 Additional Skills not required but helpful

 Preferred data warehouse analysis experience, with full knowledge of data warehouse methodologies, structures, theories and how it impacts data modeling
 Experience with the Microsoft Power Platform and modern business application methodologies
 SQL Server query tuning expertise using execution plans and Analysis Services Dynamic Management Views to improve performance
 Experience with SQL Server data partitioning
 Experience with Team Foundation Server or some other source control software
 Experience with SQL Server extended events

 Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.
 Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com
 Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.
 We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
 Accessibility/Disability Access
 Job Seekers with a Disability: Thermo Fisher Scientific offers accessibility service for job seekers requiring accommodations in the job application process. For example, this may include individuals requiring assistance because of hearing, vision, mobility, or cognitive impairments. If you are a job seeker with a disability, or assisting a person with a disability, and require accessibility assistance or an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please submit a request by telephone at 1-855-471-2255*. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist (FTP M&A)
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

The Treasury and Balance Sheet Management (TBSM) department of TD Bank is responsible for overseeing the management of non-trading market risk, consolidated liquidity risk and consolidated capital position for TD Bank’s North American Personal and Commercial (P&C) businesses.  The Funds Transfer Pricing Measurement and Analytics (FTP M&A) team within TBSM supports the margin measurement, reporting, and management functions for the bank's North American P&C businesses. The team defines, attributes and reports the margin and Net Interest Income (NII) performance of the bank’s various products. Team members support the design of new products, portfolio profitability and product pricing decisions. 



Job Description

Overview of Team and Individual Responsibilities:  The FTP Reporting team is responsible for summarizing margin and NII performance for North American business lines through our centralized Tableau reporting platform, utilizing our data to develop insights and support strategic decisioning. The group will own the explanation of actual and forecast results by isolating macro (Capital Markets, economic) and product specific drivers to inform stakeholders from TBSM, Product Management and Finance.   The Business Intelligence Specialist will be responsible for reviewing reporting produced by the team and completing complex reporting initiatives to enhance our reporting data infrastructure and increase our capabilities in delivering analytic solutions.  Key Responsibilities of this position include:

 Develop expertise in FTP Reporting data and infrastructure to identify and implement opportunities for enhancements 
Represent FTP Reporting team in the project streams, acting as SME to determine data and analytics requirements, oversee the execution of Business Acceptance Tests, and prototype reporting outputs 
Act as a team lead by contributing to the professional development and evaluation of Senior Analysts while also conducting secondary review of CDN / US Retail / Corporate (Capital) dashboards to validate content, messaging and presentation consistency.
 Provide tertiary reporting support during the reporting cycle, analyzing data to uncover insights into results and leading meetings to inform senior audiences. 
Develop and maintain relationships with various stakeholders (Finance and other TBSM teams) which are essential in understanding trends, articulating consistent narratives, and promoting adoption of our reporting tools. 
Leverage cross region expertise to raise potential FTP measurement issues and Balance Sheet Optimization opportunities.
 Manage the prioritization and delivery of new reporting requests with varying degrees of complexity, balancing resources and scalability. 
Maintain Tableau expertise with a focus on continuous improvement of reporting capabilities and output, including the user experience, efficiency, available information, and overall evolution of reporting views.
 Contribute to an engaging team culture, sharing knowledge and ideas to increase treasury, banking, and reporting expertise




Job Requirements

Specific Educational Requirements:

 Post-secondary degree in a related field (ex. Finance, Engineering, Comp Science)
 CFA designation, Master's Degree considered an asset.


 Qualifications:


Technical skills:

 In-depth data analysis experience on large datasets and hands-on experience with data visualization (Tableau) and data extraction (SQL)
 Familiarity with the features and characteristics of North American retail banking products.
 Familiarity with Funds Transfer Pricing (FTP) concepts and their application to personal and commercial mortgage, loan and deposit products. 


Competencies and Personal Qualities:

 Superior written and verbal communication skills with an ability to articulate complex concepts to audiences with various backgrounds and seniority.
 Excellent relationship management skills, anticipating stakeholder needs and managing expectations while meeting committed timelines.
 Experience with developing reporting that is creative, intuitive, and comprehensive.
 Advanced capital markets/macroeconomic knowledge with an interest in understanding their connection to the banking industry.
 Team oriented, supportive of collective goals and fostering a learning environment.
 Exemplary work ethic and drive to succeed with an ability to overcome adversity.
 Approach responsibilities with diligence and initiative, taking ownership of issues to ensure successful outcomes.
 Strong conceptual thinking skills with an ability to adapt and connect new business concepts with reporting capabilities to proactively implement change.
 Challenge the status quo and exhibit a forward looking mindset to identify enhancement opportunities that are efficient and scalable.
 Exceptional organizational skills with an ability to prioritize and manage competing initiatives.
 A data analytics thought leader with a track record of delivering meaningful value and ability to influence the adoption of independent data access within an organization.

 



Additional Information

    #LI-Hybrid
   


Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.



Job Family

    Business Intelligence and Reporting 
   


Job Category - Primary

    Enterprise Data & Analytics
   


Job Category(s)

    Enterprise Data & Analytics, Finance / Accounting
   


Hours

    37.5
   


Business Line

    Corporate
   


Time Type

    Full Time 
   


Employment Type

    Regular 
   


Country

    Canada 
   


**Province/State (Primary)

    Ontario 
   


City (Primary)

    Toronto 
   


Work Location

    TD Centre - TD Tower - 66 Wellington Street West 
   


Job Expires

    22-Jul-2022

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Support Services, Deloitte Global Talent
Description:
Job Type: Permanent Reference code: 110223 Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada All Available Locations: Toronto


 Our Purpose

 At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

 Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness. Experience a firm where wellness matters. Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality





 Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cuttingedge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with premier thought leaders in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture?




 What will your typical day look like?



 The Senior Analyst, Business Support Services role will be responsible for supporting operational and administrative activities across Global Talent Operations’ four service areas (Learning Operations, Performance Experience, Talent Acquisition Technologies, and Global Mobility). The key focus for this role is supporting process and system simplifications that drive consistency in service delivery and providing support to special projects. Other responsibilities include culture building and managing centralized processes in partnership with the service areas.

 As the Senior Analyst, Business Support Services you will:


 Partner with the Business Operations Lead in implementing human centered, streamlined standard operating procedures, and identifying opportunities for automation
 Develop a metrics dashboard for GTO leadership and a consistent stakeholder reporting approach that surfaces data and insights relative to GTO performance and tells our story
 Provide infrastructure and support to Service Area special projects and collaborate across teams to drive strategic priorities for our business
 Support program-wide culture building, change, communications, and learning, along with key team and stakeholder calls
 Provide oversight of centralized activities, i.e., liaising with Procurement, Global Privacy and Risk teams, where needed





 About the team



 Deloitte Global:

 At Deloitte, we expect results. Incredible—tangible—results. And Deloitte Global professionals play a unique role in delivering those results. We reach across disciplines and borders to serve our global organization. We are the engine of Deloitte. We develop and lead global strategies and provide programs and services that unite our network. In Deloitte Global, everyone has an opportunity to lead. We see the importance of your perspective and your ability to create value. We want you to fit in—with an inclusive culture, focus on work-life fit and well-being, and a supportive, connected environment; but we also want you to stand out—with opportunities to have a strategic impact, innovate, and take the risks necessary to make your mark. Deloitte Global supports our talented professionals in answering the question: What impact will you make?

 Global Talent supports our high-performing and diverse professionals around the world. We engage with our business units to promote growth and development of our people toward their individual professional and personal advancement while ensuring a balance of career and life goals. Global Talent Operations provides deep expertise and best-in-class delivery of products and services that enable the realization and sustainment of business strategies focused on creating a consistent Deloitte talent experience for all.




 Enough about us, let’s talk about you



 You are someone with:


 A University degree. Master’s degree a plus.
 Minimum of 2 years experience working within operations, preferably in the HR function
 Minimum of 1 year experience working in a large, multi-national organization, preferably in the Consulting or
 HR/Talent function for a professional services firm. Desired level would be an experienced Senior Analyst/Consultant or new Manager
 Experience in product and program management
 Experience in complex environments and working across functional groups
 Experience streamlining and simplifying processes and systems
 Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills





 Our shared values

 While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.
 They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

 Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:


 Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world. 
 Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility. 
 Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being. 
 Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions. 
 Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

 The next step is yours
 Sound like The One Firm. For You?
 At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.
 We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!
 By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally. Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Title: Business Initiatives Analyst, Treasury
Description:
Analyze current and create the future state of organizational work flows and systems; re-engineer and improve business systems, work flows, services and programs ensuring they reflect and support divisional and organizational business plans and initiatives. Identify, design and implement both change and improvement initiatives.
Lead Treasury Branch projects and initiatives developing future state of workflows and systems.
Provide advice, consultation, analysis and technical guidance to ensure the effective planning, analysis and design of new business changes and realization of process efficiencies.Major Duties and Responsibilities: 

As project and initiative leader, plan and scope the future state of workflows and systems. This involves identifying and documenting business needs and associated system processing, developing and proposing alternative solutions, outlining assumptions, constraints, costs and benefits; monitoring and providing ongoing updates on project progress, coordinating workflow, system and process testing, clarifying issues and resolving problems.


Re-engineer and improve current business processes, services, systems and programs. This includes conducting research, analysis and investigation into business processes, identifying opportunities for automation and process efficiencies, developing, testing and implementing innovative solutions and initiating activity to ensure processes reflect and support divisional and organizational business plans. Facilitate program development by identifying, investigating, recommending and overseeing the implementation of solutions to realize efficiencies and correct deficiencies in current business services, processes, and programs; and in developing new processes, services, programs and reports.


Facilitate the creation of and agreement to business requirements in order to support change initiatives by reviewing, evaluating and identifying problems and opportunities; identifying and documenting business requirements for process/system changes/enhancements; obtaining agreement and sign-off to ensure the requirements are accurate and reflect business needs; documenting the business requirements. Represent Treasury and act as central contact between project team members, management, business owners, Information Technology Cluster (ITC), external consultants and vendors to facilitate successful implementation.


Perform data and trend analysis to identify, document and inform management on potential impacts of projects, initiatives and system and process changes. Maintain and validate data used in performing analysis. Create, run and validate queries to ensure regular monitoring of business activities. Develop ad hoc queries using various software (ie. Cognos, Ms Access, Excel, PeopleSoft, etc.) to provide business intelligence to management and support decision making.


Develop and maintain databases and applications such as employer payments to support Treasury business activities and transactions and to provide ad hoc and routine report


Act as technical resource or subject matter expert and provide systems, business, technical and analytical expertise to clients including Treasury, Finance, and other areas within the organization as required, , for process and program design, and key business initiatives. Participate in corporate, divisional, and branch projects and initiatives. Represent the Treasury branch on all aspects of corporate-wide projects, including providing business requirements and testing.


Develop and maintain ongoing communication linkages within and between the branch and other areas within the WSIB and Corporate Project Teams. Communicate with organization change enablers to identify current practices, processes, systems and methodologies to devise and implement strategies to cover any obstacles. Provide post implementation support.


Develop educational and instructional materials (including but not limited to system training materials, system and user guides, handbooks, and quick reference guides). Deliver system training on important system or procedural changes to users. Provide follow-up post implementation support by resolving problems and developing procedures, charts and matrices to familiarize staff with changes.


Perform other related duties as assigned or required, such as all aspects of User Acceptance Testing.

Job Requirements: Education

University degree at the undergraduate level with a specialty focus in business administration or computer science.

Experience

Five years prior experience in business administration, analytics and workflow processes.

Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusionWe respect and value the diversity of our people. We strive to create an environment where employees can be themselves and where our differences are celebrated.The WSIB is committed to being accessible and inclusive, and following barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please let us know when we contact you and we will work with you to meet your needs.Disclosing conflicts of interestAs public servants, employees at the WSIB have a responsibility to act in an ethical way at all times to create a respectful workplace and maintain public trust. Job applicants are required to disclose any circumstance that could result in a real, potential or perceived conflict of interest. A conflict of interest is any situation where your private interests may impair or be perceived to impair the decisions you make in your official capacity. This may include: political activity, directorship, other outside employment and certain personal relationships (e.g. with current WSIB employees, customers and/or stakeholders). If you have any questions about conflict of interest obligations and/or how to make a disclosure, please contact the Talent Acquisition Centre at talentacquisitioncentre@wsib.on.ca.Privacy information
We collect personal information from your resume, application, cover letter and references under the authority of the Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997. The Talent Acquisition Centre and WSIB hiring parties will used this information to assess/validate your qualifications, determine if you meet the requirements of vacant positions and/or gather information relevant for recruitment purposes. If you have questions or concerns regarding the collection and use of your personal information, please contact the WSIB’s Privacy Office at privacy_office@wsib.on.ca. The Privacy Office cannot provide information about the status of your application.As a precondition of employment, the WSIB requires that prospective candidates undergo a criminal records name check any time before or after they are hired.To apply for this position, please submit your application by the closing date.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Merchandising Allocation Analyst
Description:
Home Office Opportunity – Merchandising Allocation Analyst
Department: Merchandising- Allocation Team
Location: Home Office
Date Posted: July 2022
Type: Full Time
BASIC FUNCTION: 
Plan and allocate products to maximize each store's sales potential and inventory productivity to assist the company in meeting its financial planned sales, inventory, GMROI and turn targets. Responsible for maximizing inventory productivity by properly allocating products in the correct quantity, to the right store, at the right time.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Distribute merchandise based on trends analysis, store performance, and customer profiles.
Maximize stock levels while managing inventory flow and store in-stock positions to improve sales performance.
Analyze trends and performance and allocate inventory by store, in-season inventory management, store profiles, and promotional activity.
Maintain proper category assortment.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES: 

College diploma in a related discipline
1-2 years experience in merchandise allocation/distribution for a retail chain of varying store sizes and sales volume.
Intermediate level of knowledge and understanding of merchandise planning procedures and practices. General retail experience
Knowledge of distribution and replenishment systems with JDA being an asset
Ability to compile, analyze data and able to provide recommendations on that data
Keen attention to detail and organized
Work independently and in a group environment
Advanced skills in MS Excel and Word preferred

RELATIONSHIPS: 

Work closely with the Planners and Merchant Team to understand the product mix, assortment and financial goals.
Communicate with Stores/Operations to understand specific requirements and opportunities.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care
Vision care

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Mississauga, ON L4V 1L9: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

Merchandising Allocation: 1 year (preferred)

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant
Description:
Position Overview
 Number of Positions: 1
 Language: This role operates in English.
 Work Model: Hybrid
 Alternate Title: BI Consultant
 Additional Information: The work location for this role is flexible to Guelph, Toronto, Burlington, Montreal and Quebec. This role can be hybrid or remote.






Our Business Intelligence (BI) team empowers decision making using leading edge science and analytics. As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will contribute to the mission by supporting our multi-year Data & Analytics strategy to have effective and efficient data operation management. You will have the opportunity to convert our SAS codes and stored procedures into one of the newest technology, Azure Synapse. Your communication skills will be valued in negotiating and influencing our business partners and putting our client needs at the center of the decisions.


 Technologies you have experience with:

You have experience with SAS, SQL, T-SQL and Azure Synapse.


 
What you’re responsible for:

Extract data as required for project analysis or analysis of our book of business using BI tools or programming language (SQL & SAS). 
Based on an analysis of data and insurance business knowledge, compile and present insightful stories to explain broad business situations 
Document detailed business requirements. 
Construct, test, reconcile and document BI solutions. 
Advanced and efficient in using programming language and BI tools. 
Understand, develop, maintain and improve predictive statistical models used in BI. 
Decide the appropriate type of model to be used for a BI problem between a variety of common models.


 
What to expect:

You will be subject to a Criminal Record and Consumer History background check as a condition of employment, in the event you are the successful candidate.


 
To be successful:

You have an innovative mindset to improve operational efficiencies and ability to influence change, with a primary focus on client needs. 
You use critical thinking skills to recognize assumptions, evaluate arguments, draw conclusions and proactively propose solutions. 
You have strong communication skills to clearly convey messages and explore diverse points of view. 
You build trusting relationships and provide guidance to support the development of colleagues.


 
To join our team:

7 years of relevant experience. 
University Degree in Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent technical experience. 
Property and Casualty insurance experience is preferred. 
Exposure to the use of job related applications, appliances and programming languages (SAS, SQL, Netezza, MicroStrategy) is an asset.


 
What we offer:

Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Employers. 
Flexible work options and paid time off to support your personal and family needs. 
A holistic approach to your well-being, with physical and mental health programs and a supportive workplace culture. 
Paid volunteer days to give back to your community. 
A comprehensive total rewards package, including competitive salary, bonus, pension and benefits.


 






Interested in applying?
 Click 'apply now' to submit your current resume and cover letter. Tell us a bit about yourself, your professional experience and how you think you can make a difference at Co-operators. We look forward to learning more about you and we welcome you to follow us on LinkedIn.
 Co-operators is focused on fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible work environment and we encourage individuals from all identity groups to apply. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact the hiring manager.

Description:
