Title: Specialist, Business Intelligence - BC Cancer Vancouver
Description:
Specialist, Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics


 BC Cancer


 Vancouver




 As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.




   Reporting to the Manager or designate, the Specialist, BI is responsible for the planning, design, development and management of new and existing data warehouse and analytics solutions related to BC Cancer. Applying a broad range of information technology experience, Data Warehousing (DW), Business Intelligence (BI), and clinical and operational knowledge, the Business Intelligence Specialist works with stakeholders to develop analytical products that meet their analytical, reporting, monitoring, surveillance and evaluation needs. This position plans, designs, and develops BI and analytical solutions, including data Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, data marts, reports and dashboards as part of the overall PHSA Enterprise Data Warehouse. This position ensures the integrity and quality of the data accessible through these solutions, and also manages and maintains the metadata and other product documentations.
 



   The Specialist provides input to the overall goals, objectives and operations of the department by providing feedback and recommendations specifically with respect to BI issues. The Specialist works across all levels of BC Cancer providing leadership and support in the area of BI development/maintenance and information reporting via dashboards, scorecards or reports.
 



What you’ll do




Architect and implement leading edge solutions to develop enhance and improve Business Intelligence solutions. This include leading the design, creation, documentation and implementation of complex data marts, multidimensional cubes or other semantic models, reports and front-end interfaces.
Collaborate with members of the PHSA Data Analytics, Reporting and Evaluation (DARE) team on conceptual design, development, and implementation of the Enterprise Data Warehouse. Architect and implement optimal database schemas and ETL solutions to integrate data from various source systems into integrated linked data marts.
Lead the identification of new data sources and implement data extraction routines from departmental feeder systems. Provide advice and direction on data availability and quality. Consult and problem-solve with feeder departments regarding routine data extracts.
Participate in the development, definition and reporting of performance indicators as related to program operations, access and throughput, for use at the program director and executive level. Liaise on behalf of the agency with external consultants on the provisioning of patient specific data, as well as providing education on analysis and interpretation.
Provide technical expertise in the development of Analytics and Business Intelligence Solutions by assessing client needs/requirements, reviewing technical options, determining the design and architecture and leading all levels of the solution development and deployment.




 What you bring




A level of education, training and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s Degree in Health Information Science, Business, Computer Science or Management Information Systems from a recognized school plus a minimum of five (5) years of recent related BI, data warehousing, data modelling or analytics work experience preferably in a healthcare environment.




   You will also have:
 



Advanced knowledge, and experience in application of best practices of data standards, database design, data architecture and modelling.
Expertise in developing ETL solutions, tabular models, relational and multi-dimensional databases and data marts.
Superior database querying, and query optimization skills using Structured Query Language -preferably T-SQL, MDX or DAX or equivalents.
Expert knowledge and understanding of relational and multidimensional (OLAP) databases as well as proven knowledge and experience in working with SQL Server or Integration Services (SSIS), Analysis Services (SSAS), Reporting Services (SSRS), Performance Point, SharePoint, Visual Studio , etc.
Experience in the development and maintenance of popular BI platforms including Power BI and Tableau




 What we bring




   Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
 

Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Perks include access to fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.




 Regular, Full-Time

686 West Broadway, Vancouver BC V5Z 1G1 - This is a Hybrid position

Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.

Monday to Friday; 0830-1630

Requisition Number: 129202




 What we do




   BC Cancer provides comprehensive cancer control for the people of British Columbia.
 



   BC Cancer is part of the Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA).
 



   The Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, manages and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose.
 



   Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services
 



   PHSA and BC Cancer are committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.
 



 ATTN: PHSA Employees:




   To be considered as a PHSA employee (internal applicant) for this position, 
  you must apply online via your internal profile at http://internaljobs.phsa.ca
 



   Please note the internal job posting will no longer be accessible after the expiry date of
   July 04, 2021. If the internal job posting has expired, please contact the Internal Jobs Help Desk and advise that you would like to be considered as a late internal applicant for this position. 
  Please do not apply for the external job posting.




   If you have not registered your internal profile, a password is required to log in for the first time. To obtain your password, please contact the 
  Internal Jobs Help Desk at 604-875-7264 or 1-855-875-7264. Please note regular business hours are Monday – Friday (excluding stats), 8:30am to 4:30pm. For inquiries outside of regular business hours, please email the Internal Jobs Help Desk at internaljobshelpu@phsa.ca and a Help Desk Representative will contact you the next business day.

Title: Implementation Analyst (Bilingual)
Description:
The Implementation Services team at GS1 Canada is looking for a driven, analytical, and customer service oriented individual. You will support GS1 Canada’s initiatives with outbound/inbound account activity with subscribers and prospects. You will support the team with various projects and lead implementation lifecycles while providing exemplary customer service and strengthening key stakeholder relations.
 GS1 Canada is a neutral, not-for-profit organization that develops and maintains global standards for efficient business communication. At GS1 Canada, it is in our DNA to do the right thing. We believe in the power of standards to transform the way we live and work. We believe in the uniqueness, drive, and passion of our people to carry our values and vision forward. We are a team of friendly and passionate people, optimistic about our capabilities. Together with our people-centered culture and innovative solutions, our vision is to become a strategic partner that inspires, leads, and enables best-in-class supply chain standards.
 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provides day-to-day technical implementation support for GS1 Canada initiatives (i.e. phone, email, face-to-face)
Establishes and maintains relationships with contacts within key organizations to ensure support efforts are effectively promoted and supported
Develops subject matter expertise of primary GS1 Canada products and services
Assists in developing a customer centric organization and providing customer value through effective and efficient support, management and tracking of subscriber activities
Provides assistance and guidance for data analysis and reporting to support the implementation process
Leads training sessions or presentations on GS1 Canada tools and services
Creates and updates user documentation and standard operation procedural documents
Provides technical / business support for retailer / vendor account management e.g. ad hoc analysis and reporting
Assists in the user acceptance testing and deployment of GS1 Canada service enhancements or new implementations
Supports and drives all data integrity initiatives through the certification and discrepancy processes
Researches and recommends efficiencies and process modifications that will assist in providing customer value and improving departmental efficiencies
Performs administrative support for team
Liaises with other internal departments as required
Performs various other duties, special projects as delegated or assigned

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Minimum 2 - 3 years of customer service and technical support (i.e. help desk) experience preferably within a technical support centre
Fully Bilingual (English/French) - **We offer a bilingual signing bonus! **
Proficiency with MS Office Suite (i.e. Word, Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint) is required
Proven ability to meet tight deadlines and take responsibility for timely and accurate completion of tasks assigned
Strong organizational and communication skills, possessing a high level of problem solving and analytical abilities
Team player who enjoys a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast paced, results based environment and requiring flexibility to changing needs
Advanced skills with Access and SAS is an asset

We are open to working remotely!
 GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.

Title: Operations Control Analyst
Description:
CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.
  
 What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our 
  
   Hybrid Work Model
  .
 


   Job Description
 


   Position Purpose
 

   The Operations Control Analyst is responsible for ensuring accuracy in plant systems transactions impacting stock pallet count audits, reporting metrics, process compliance, data associated with Stock deficit and C Gen Loss, and coaching and reviews with the plants.
 


   Major/Key Accountabilities
 

 Travels to facilities to perform audits for Inventory & Transaction Controls, and Op's Compliance programs supporting standardization
 Support Compliance Controls process improvements with field work, documentation, and controls tools developments
 Maintain Audit Templates, Audit analysis and action follow up
 Perform plant stock audits to closure within set deadline per audit SOP
 Perform plant compliance audits and action follow up
 Identifying and recommending solutions to all system related issues in Plant Stock Management
 Support Audit Result summaries to Op's Compliance Manager
 Developing ad-hoc reports, support ongoing reports, and perform data analysis
 Proficiency in analyzing external reports and providing insights
 Support with training to the plant Inventory & Transaction personnel
 Support Op’s Transaction Management tasks with Reversals Tracking and ZINT closure performance



   Qualifications
 

 University Degree
 Business Analytics



   Experience
 

 Power BI and/or Business Warehouse is an asset
 Audit experience is an asset
 Willingness and ability to travel up to 75% of the work week
 Experience with accounting systems (Dynamics, SAP, or equivalent)
 Plant Inventory Controls experience
 Plant performance management experience



   Skills and Knowledge
 

 Excellent verbal & written communication skills
 Analytical & problem-solving skills
 Strong interpersonal skills
 Intermediate or advanced level of knowledge of Excel, Power Point, and Word
 Intermediate knowledge of Power BI and Business Warehouse



   Languages
 

   Required English Desirable French
 


   Objectif du poste
 

   L’analyste du contrôle des opérations est responsable de veiller à l’exactitude des transactions dans les systèmes de l’usine en lien avec les audits des dénombrements des stocks de palettes, des indices de mesure rapportés, de la conformité des processus, des données associées aux déficits des stocks et à la perte de stocks C-Gen et de l’encadrement et de l’examen des résultats avec les usines.
 


   Principales responsabilités
 

 Se rendre dans les établissements pour effectuer des audits des stocks et des contrôles de transactions ainsi que des programmes de conformité de l’exploitation pour favoriser la standardisation
 Soutenir les améliorations des processus de contrôle de la conformité avec des activités sur le terrain, de la documentation et le développement d’outils de contrôle
 Actualiser les modèles d’audit, les analyses des audits et les mesures de suivi
 Mener les audits des stocks des usines dans les délais, conformément à la PES sur les audits
 Mener les audits de conformité des usines et appliquer les mesures de suivi
 Trouver et recommander des solutions pour tous les problèmes en lien avec le système de gestion des stocks des usines
 Soutenir la production de sommaires sur les résultats des audits pour le chef de la conformité de l’exploitation
 Préparer des rapports ad hoc, soutenir la production des rapports réguliers et analyser les données
 Être en mesure d’analyser les rapports externes et de fournir ses observations
 Contribuer à la formation du personnel responsable de l’inventaire et des transactions dans les usines
 Soutenir les tâches de gestion des transactions de l’exploitation avec le suivi des annulations et le taux de fermeture des ZINT



   Qualifications
 

 Diplôme d’études collégial ou universitaire
 Analytique commerciale



   Expérience
 

 Connaissance de Power BI et/ou de Business Warehouse, un atout
 Expérience avec les audits, un atout
 Volonté et capacité de se rendre dans les usines jusqu’à 75 % du temps de travail de la semaine
 Expérience avec les systèmes comptables (Dynamics, SAP, ou un équivalent)
 Expérience avec les contrôles de l’inventaire des usines
 Expérience en gestion du rendement d’une usine



   Compétences et connaissances
 

 Excellentes aptitudes à la communication orale et écrite
 Aptitudes analytiques et en résolution de problèmes
 Fortes capacités relationnelles
 Maîtrise intermédiaire ou avancée d’Excel, de Power Point et de Word
 Maîtrise intermédiaire de Power BI et de Business Warehouse



   Preferred Education
 
 Bachelors
 

   Preferred Level of Work Experience
 
 3 - 5 years
 

   CHEP Canada invites applications from all qualified individuals. CHEP is committed to fostering workplace diversity, and, provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process. If you require this information in alternate format; require communication supports; an accommodation in applying for a posting and/or if you are selected for an interview, please contact our Recruiting Department and a recruiter assigned to the posting will work with you to meet your needs.
 


   We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to developing a diverse workforce in which everyone is treated fairly, with respect, and has the opportunity to contribute to business success while realizing his or her potential. This means harnessing the unique skills and experience that each individual brings and we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.
 


   Individuals fraudulently misrepresenting themselves as Brambles or BXB Digital representatives have scheduled interviews and offered fraudulent employment opportunities with the intent to commit identity theft or solicit money. Brambles and BXB Digital never conduct interviews via online chat or request money as a term of employment. If you have a question as to the legitimacy of an interview or job offer, please contact us at recruitment@brambles.com.

Title: Service Operations Business Analyst, Salesforce
Description:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest. Affirm, Inc. proudly includes Affirm, PayBright, and Returnly.

 The Servicing Technology team focuses on Designing, Developing, Implementing, and Maintaining our Case Management System (CMS). CMS is the foundation for all omni-channel interactions, meant to enable outstanding servicing for our Customer Service Associates and our diverse network of Affirm Customers and Merchants across the Globe.
 The Service Operations Business Analyst, Salesforce is a key member of our CRM Applications team. In addition to being responsible for business analyses, the BA will work directly with the project team and clients gathering requirements to analyze, design and/or implement technology best practice business changes. As a Service Operations Business Analyst, Salesforce, you will work with senior members of the team, such as the CRM Architect, ensuring the successful delivery of Salesforce.com implementation. We are looking for someone with solid functional and/or industry knowledge, as well as Salesforce products, specifically Service Cloud.
 What You'll Do:

Work with internal partners to gather business and functional requirements, by scoping, defining, and prioritizing requirements.
Mapping functional requirements to Salesforce.com features and functionality.
Understand and document requirements for configuring, testing and launching our CRM solution.
Understand CRM requirements and Identify product requirements for future enhancements.
Critically evaluate information gathered from various sources, reconcile inconsistency and break down high-level information into details.
Work with Architects and Developers to transform new requirements into Salesforce.com design and implementation.
Develop, maintain and perform processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity in platform applications with Salesforce Administrator and functional managers
Create training materials and documentation for Salesforce.com users and help train new end users on Salesforce.com and related applications.
Supports testing cycles (UAT, regression, system) and/or Training/Training Materials.
Supports PM with project updates, scheduling, etc.
Maintain and coordinate communication with cross functional partners throughout each project.

What We Look For:

2+ years of Business Analysis and Salesforce administrator or Salesforce App Builder experience.
Demonstrable experience implementing CRM solutions from start to finish, including the creation of business requirements and other formal documentation.
Demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements, and successfully drive projects to completion.
Previous experience working in a SCRUM or agile environment is preferred.

Location - Remote Canada


   #LI-Remote
  



Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles are remote and can be located anywhere in the U.S. and Canada (with the exception of the U.S. Territories, Quebec, Yukon, Nunavut, and the Northwest Territories) unless the job indicates a different global location. We are currently building operations in Spain, Poland, and Australia. Employees in remote roles have the option of working remotely or from an Affirm office in their country of hire, and may occasionally travel to an Affirm office or elsewhere for required meetings or team-building events. Our offices in Chicago, New York, Pittsburgh, Salt Lake City, San Francisco and Toronto will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis, subject to local COVID-19 guidelines.
 All full-time jobs at Affirm (excluding interns and apprentices) are tied to a transparent grade-based pay range taking location into account.
 [Colorado Candidates] In accordance with Colorado's Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the grade for this position in Colorado is listed above. You can find the Colorado base pay range and benefits here. 


   If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people who believe in Affirm's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways—not just candidates who check all the boxes.
  


Inclusivity:


At Affirm, People Come First is one of our core values, and that's why diversity and inclusion are vital to our priorities as an equal opportunity employer. You can read about our D&I program here and our progress thus far in our 2021 DEI Report.
 We also believe It's On Us to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process.
 By clicking "Submit Application," you acknowledge that you have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy, or the Affirm Employment Privacy Notice (EU) for applicants applying from the European Union, and hereby freely and unambiguously give informed consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of your personal information as described therein.

Title: Sr Analyst, Marketing & Sales Analytics
Description:
WHO WE ARE 

 HomeEquity Bank is a Schedule 1 Canadian chartered bank and the leading national provider of reverse mortgages, with a growing portfolio. As the only bank solely dedicated to serving homeowners 55 and up, we’re passionate about helping Canadian homeowners live retirement on their terms. We live that commitment every day, with a range of reverse mortgage solutions that include our flagship CHIP Reverse Mortgage™ product. 

 Our Values, Our Passion 
At HomeEquity Bank, our values drive and inspire our actions with our customers, our partners and each other. 

 We Are Customer-Focused, Passionate Advocates. 

 We Have the Courage to Act and Do the Right Thing. 

 We Are One Team, with One Vision. 

 We Think Long-Term, We Are Ever-Evolving. 

 We Strive to Be Exceptional and Inspire Greatness. 


Position Summary:
 The Senior Analyst will work closely with Consumer Sales and Marketing leaders to help support the group’s many initiatives. The successful candidate will be responsible for working collaboratively with leaders to identify opportunities and put forward supporting recommendations. The role will also be accountable for the development of executive content, supporting the VP and EVP. 

 This role requires a critical and strategic thinker with excellent data analysis skills. The development and tracking of Key performance indicators will be critical to enhance the understanding of the business and to improve decision-making. The successful candidate must be able to exercise discretion, good judgment and take initiative. Working with and presenting to the Executive Team, the incumbent must act as a key resource in providing data and analytical support to achieve our objectives. 


MAJOR ELEMENTS OF THE ROLE:


Support Consumer Sales and Marketing group in planning and reporting on, annual plan/performance, projects and initiatives
Leverage data and analytics to gain a deep understanding of business, uncover trends, and help drive critical business decision-making
Strong ability to anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and develop and implement solutions
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify needs and opportunities to build reports and dashboards
Develop content for executive level presentations regarding business updates
Work with business partners to understand business objectives and develop valuable reporting and provide ad-hoc data extracts
Work with Call Centre, Sales, Analytics and IT teams

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:


Bachelor’s degree in Administration, Finance or other related field (MBA preferred)
Related work experience in an analytical role
Experience working with Sales or Marketing team is a plus
Critical thinking skills with an ability to identify opportunities, clearly and concisely put forward recommendations
Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset
Report creation and automation
Verbal, written and presentation skills
Natural collaborator and motivated by team success
Self-starter who will thrive in fast-paced work environment
Experience with Looker or other BI tools, SQL, Salesforce is a plus
 WHY WORK AT HOMEEQUITY BANK? 

 Great Environment 
HomeEquity Bank offers a hybrid working environment supported with a culture of flexibility – an approach that is unique to each person, and that enables both business and individual needs to be met in a mutually beneficial way. 
We pride ourselves in recognizing and celebrating performance, community service, teamwork, and diversity among our employees. 

 A Dynamic Culture – With People at the Centre 
We believe our people make all the difference, and our tireless commitment to inclusivity, professional development, and employee engagement/experience has been recognized through awards including the Globe and Mail’s Report on Business: Canada’s Top Growing Companies 2021 (2 years in a row), Strategy Online Top 10 Brands Awards (at #8) and as a Canadian Mortgage Professional (CMP) 5-Star Mortgage Employer 2022. 

 Growth and Opportunities 
We provide challenging and rewarding careers in a wide variety of fields. We continuously develop and train our employees through professional growth opportunities and on-the-job training. We also encourage our employees to develop professionally and personally though a series of career developing programs including our Educational Assistance Program, designed to reimburse costs related to professional learning and development, as well as providing employees unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning. 

 Celebrating Great Work and People 
We believe in an environment that celebrates success, knowledge, leadership, and work that is inspired by our core values. For these reasons, we have created several programs that make it easy for our employees to say ‘great job’ to their colleagues and leaders. 

 From our Appreciate! Program to the High Five Award Program and President’s Award Program, we recognize professional achievement with a variety of rewards including points towards gift cards, merchandise, and travel experiences, as well as group RRSP/DPSP contributions and more. 

 Our Community Leadership Program also recognizes employees who make a positive impact in their communities through volunteer work with a grant for their charity of choice. Additionally, we provide employees with the opportunity to take a paid day off each year to support their favourite local charity. 

 The Perks 
HomeEquity Bank offers a competitive total rewards package that includes the following: 


Extended health and dental benefits
Employee & Family Assistance Program
Employer Matched Group Retirement Savings Plan
Employee Share Ownership Plan
Well-being initiatives including: a wellness account; virtual self-care programs and extended mental health benefits
Employee corporate discount for GoodLife Fitness
 Stay in the Know 

 Find out what we’re up to online, and learn more about what makes HomeEquity Bank a great place to work: 

 LinkedIn 
Youtube 
Facebook 
Chip.ca

Title: Analyst - Retail
Description:
Job Description
  As an Analyst, working with a team environment, you will assist in providing analytical insights to our Retailer clients through the preparation of data summaries and special analyses. You will also take action which directly results in enhanced quality for our clients and improved efficiency internally.
 The ideal candidate will have:
 Post-secondary degree in Business, Marketing, Mathematics, Economics or related field
 Strong interpersonal skills
 Team oriented
 Passion for customer service
 Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
 Able to demonstrate insightful data analysis by turning raw information into insights
 Loves to work with data and has a passion for finding insights from it
 Solid written and verbal communication skills
 Excellent attention to detail, good logic and time management skills
 Demonstrated problem solving skills
 Strong technical skills with an emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint
 Marketing, sales or category management experience preferred but not required



 Additional Information
 
 About NielsenIQ
 NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.
 NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

Title: Revenue Management Artificial Intelligence Business Translator
Description:
Description 

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.


This opportunity will be based at Air Canada's Montreal Headquarters in Dorval.

 The Revenue Management (RM) Artificial Intelligence (AI) Business Translator reports into the Manager, Revenue Management AI Labs and is involved in the various AI-related projects attached to Revenue Management. Primarily, the role "translates" business needs including requirements, context, processes etc. into advanced analytics language and reversely the outcomes of AI into business implications, validating that the desired outcomes are achieved. The business translator becomes the champion for our AI initiatives within the RM organization. 
 

Job Description

 Maintain and develop a deep knowledge of the business objectives, processes, practices, challenges, and systems of the RM department. 
 Demonstrate a deep understanding of RMs business needs and assess the viability of AI to its challenges; conduct diagnostics to identify new AI use case opportunities. 
 Act as an ambassador for AI within the RM department to promote our initiatives, provide education on our AI projects and ensure the business teams feel included. 
 Maintain a permanent link with the business teams throughout the project steps, articulating back analytics propositions to business stakeholders to gather feedback. 
 Responsible for gathering the proper information and documentation to translate all business needs to the AI development teams, including proving trainings to AI development teams as required. 
 Act as the bridge between the RM business teams and AI specialists; share insights with business stakeholders and collect inputs to verify and iterate analytical results. 
 Support analytics design decisions on priorities and areas of focus by taking relevant inputs from business teams and defining a clear plan for the AI development team. 
 Support the business and AI teams by performing various data analyses, validating assumptions, extracting relevant insights, and testing and interpreting models and outputs. Drive the discussions on the evaluation of the performance of the model and value measurement (as sometimes performance for business differs from pure data science performance). 
 Provide guidance and support to RM users by sharing model results, recommend best practices to best leverage our AI initiatives, and assess the commercial impacts of model formulations and outputs. 
 Responsible for documentation and execution of use cases performed by the lab team including data engineers, data scientists, designers, business process designers as well as inputs of multiple end-user stakeholders. 
 With the change management team, participate in the development of adequate visualizations (UI/UX) to present actionable results to the business stakeholders and maximize adoption of the solution. 
 Demonstrate a good understanding of data bases, data availability, and work closely with the RM Science & Innovation team to leverage their expertise in the various projects. 
 Demonstrate a good understanding of Air Canada's RM practice and processes, working closely with the RM Advancement & Practice team to ensure solutions are integrated into Revenue Management teams' workflows and properly used to generate additional revenue. 

Qualifications 

 University degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, or equivalent, or relevant experience in Revenue Management. 
 Self-starter and ability to work under pressure, changing priorities and tight deadlines with limited supervision. 
 Strong interpersonal skills with the abilities to work autonomously, synthesize complex situations, and communicate at multiple levels of expertise and across multiple teams to gain buy-in and support. 
 Ability to efficiently translate complex concepts into understandable language. 
 Strong conceptual, analytical, data modeling, and problem-solving skills. 
 Strong results orientation and sense of ownership. 


Additional assets

 Experience with predictive modeling, machine learning, data science or coding. 
 Experience in revenue management, forecasting, optimization, or demand elasticity modeling. 


Conditions of Employment:

 Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position. 


Linguistic Requirements

 Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates. 
 

Diversity and Inclusion

 Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees' unique contributions to our company's success. 
 
 As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.
 

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted

Title: Lead Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 153367  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team
 The Foreign Exchange Technology (FX) team supports Scotiabank’s Global FX business by providing functional and technical expertise in FX products and related internal and third-party applications. We are looking for a Lead Business Systems Analyst to join our growing team in Toronto.
 The Role
 The business analyst team acts as a liaison between business stakeholders and internal development groups, gathers robust requirements for enhancement/modification requests, recommends effective solutions for business and technology objectives, and conducts thorough testing of technology solutions. As subject matter experts, the team also serves as an escalation point for production issues and assist other internal technology groups. 
Responsibilities

 Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders including business end users and upstream / downstream technology groups to gather comprehensive information related to problems, projects and requests
 Participate in all aspects of a systems development life cycle within the development team (Requirements Analysis, Design, Development, Test, QA, Data Lineage, Implementation and Support).Act as a liaison and primary communication channel between appropriate business line and development teams on requirements, issue resolution, status, project execution and prioritization.
 Work closely with internal development resources as well as third-party vendor contacts to design and test creative and efficient solutions
 Actively participate in or lead team stand-ups and scrums to ensure broad awareness of in-flight initiatives and coordinate work efforts
 Manage functional and technical requests as well as bug investigations and discretionary work efforts using a variety of tools including JIRA, Confluence, and ServiceNow
 Actively participate in improving team processes and workflows, with an emphasis on knowledge retention and intra / inter-team cooperation
 Accountable for understanding all stakeholder needs, providing detailed product design specification by way of user stories and assisting in the prioritising of stories during Sprint planning.
 Turn business requirements into technical specifications and other technical documentation (data transformations, design and operational support documentation).
 Knowledge of bank’s products (i.e. capital markets and retail) and operational process and controls. Specifically, FX products, payment processing, and confirmations.
 Fluent in Agile techniques and demonstrated experience in working within an agile environment, either as a product owner or as a team member.
 Apply a variety of analysis tools to interpret data and identify patterns.


 Qualifications

 At least 3-5 years of experience in capital markets business systems analysis role, ideally in Foreign Exchange
 3-5 years of Capital Market Business Analysis experience ideally in Foreign Exchange.
 Strong knowledge of Foreign Exchange products and trade lifecycle, especially front/middle office functions such as trade execution/booking, P&L, and risk
 Hands on experience with the software development lifecycle, leading technical specification discussions with developers as well as SIT/UAT testing
 Practical technology project experience, as a business analyst and/or a project manager
 Effective written and verbal communication skills to bridge between technical content and business objectives
 Practical SQL and/or Unix experience would be a strong asset
 Experience with capital markets trading systems, ideally in the Foreign Exchange market such as Wallstreet FX, Murex, eFX Trading venues, etc.- Nice to have


 What's in it for you?

 We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
 We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences.
 You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
 Onsite cafeteria.
 Dress codes don't apply here, being comfortable does.
 We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (pension & profit sharing), generous vacation, personal & sick days, personal development funding, maternity leave top-up, parental leave and much more.


 #ScotiaRED #IN-TECH

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Engineer, AWS People Experience and Technology (PXT)
Description:
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or related technical/engineering field
 5+ Years of experience working with data in an analytical sense
 5+ Years of SQL experience
 5+ Years of data visualization building experience
 Excellent writing and communication skills



 Job summary
  The AWS People Experience and Technology (PXT) team is looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Engineer who will help reshape how the business thinks about its people metrics holistically. You will come in and establish relationships across the business and HR to pinpoint specific metrics and insights that are actionable and provide business impact, and then build self-service dashboards and tools to put the right data and insights into the hands of HR and business leaders at the right time.
 
 Key job responsibilities
 

 Work backwards from the key AWS business problems to build data visualizations of people metrics
 Partner with product managers to design the ideal user experience from question to data discovery to insight to action. Help us move from merely reporting the news to automating the action plan
 Eliminate the need for data pull requests by developing datasets, dashboards and reports using AWS technology

 A day in the life
  Are you someone who likes to work at the intersection of business and tech? Are you the type to roll up your sleeves and dive headfirst into data? Do you like challenging the status quo and breaking convention? If so, come join the AWS People Experience and Technology (PXT) team 
 
 About the team
  AWS is powered by our people, and the AWS Human Resources team takes the lead in identifying, hiring, and supporting the industry’s best workforce. Our ongoing innovation across verticals and geographies is driving unprecedented growth, so we’re seeking best-in-class Human Resources and Talent Acquisition professionals to accelerate the development and sustainability of our organization.
 
 As competition for best-in-field talent intensifies, the AWS Human Resources team plays an essential role in continually raising the bar for our workforce. Whatever your specialty, the common thread across every role on the team is an innovative mindset and a commitment to creating a positive employee experience. Join our team and help us achieve our mission to become Earth’s Best Employer.




Master’s Degree in technical or engineering field
 Expert-level knowledge of SQL
 Working knowledge of AWS tech stack. Glue, Redshift, S3, Quicksight, and Sagemaker will be used regularly in this role
 Experience as a leader/mentor of data analytics resources
 Experience influencing business leaders and executives to think differently
 Experience working directly with business owners to field requirements and interpret results
 Experience testing causal arguments against historical datasets
 Experience documenting technical/data systems for technical and business leaders

 Amazon s’engage à créer un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif. Amazon est un employeur qui offre à tous les mêmes opportunités et ne fait pas de discrimination fondée sur la race, l’origine nationale, le sexe, l’identité sexuelle, l’orientation sexuelle, le statut d’ancien combattant protégé, le handicap, l’âge ou autres statuts protégés par la loi. Les personnes handicapées qui souhaitent présenter une demande d’accommodement, sont invitées à aviser leur recruteur.
 
 Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Title: Bilingual Media Insights Analyst (R0998529)
Description:
Company Description: 

Merkle Canada is the integrated data unit for Dentsu. We are the first and only, truly integrated data agency in the market.
 Our team has backgrounds ranging from market researchers to data scientists and analytics consultants. We manage all things “data” for our clients and deliver building blocks for smarter campaigns and drive the evolution towards data-driven marketing. We aim to bridge the divide between online and offline data. Oh and being a “nerd” is not an insult, it’s a compliment!



Job Description: 

Our Merkle team is looking to add a Media Insights Analyst to their evolving team. The ideal candidate will have worked as an analyst with experience in media at an agency, corporate, media research, or media owner environment. A willingness to learn and good, clear & confident communication skills are required. The ability to think outside of the box is welcomed.

 Develop presentations, overviews, and tactical POVs that explain in detail media performance results to internal stakeholders and clients.
 Have the ability to set up appropriate testing scenarios to determine key insights and answers to key business questions
 Observe, analyze and report on digital media campaigns and provide recommendations for optimization by acting as the connective tissue between media planning, media buying, Carat and other DAN agencies for data, analytics and insights including:
 Campaign analysis
 Market Mix Models
 Provide detailed media delivery information for review by MMM partner to be used for Client’s Media Mix Modeling.
 Leverage Media Mix Optimization recommendations coming from Client and MMM partner
 Social Analytics
 Media Optimization
 Linkage to proprietary research and tools including:
 Creative testing
 Innovation testing
 Data driven decision making for media allocation
 Leverage the data and insights that client provides to bring strong data-driven thinking to media and creative touch-points. It will be important to integrate and work with any martech stack that the client has in place and help bring the customer journeys that have already been created to life.
 Build consumer and audience profiles using CCS, CCS Planner and other behavioral data
 Work with Client to develop 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data segments to deliver against or exceed benchmarks during planning, optimizations and maintenance. Generation of insights informing optimal audience
 Generate insights for campaign and organic site traffic




Qualifications: 


At least 4 years of experience working in a relevant role and willingness to manage others
 Bilingualism French and English mandatory
 Strong knowledge of Microsoft Suite (MS Access, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
 Experience working with SQL, Python, and/or Statistical programs such as R is a plus
 Strong knowledge of Tableau appreciated
 Strong knowledge of the media planning and buying processes from pre planning to post-analysis.
 Hands on experience with third party buying, tracking and reporting tools including a strong knowledge of advanced reports such as reach vs. frequency and cross-site duplication is an asset




Additional Information: 

We know through experience that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better business results. We strive to create workplaces that reflect the clients we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.
 We are committed to working with our candidates from all ability levels throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Canada.Recruitment@dentsuaegis.com or to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.
 #LI-AF2






More Information:
Our Culture: Merkle’s energy and personality lives through everything we say and do. Learn all about what defines our people and our vibe.
Students & Recent Graduates: Start your career at Merkle and get on the path to success.
Experienced Hires: Leverage your expertise, challenge the status quo and grow your career at Merkle.

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence (BI)
Description:
Company Description
  Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization
 When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $500 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion by 2050. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.
 CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:

 Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
 Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
 Accelerated exposure and responsibility
 Global career development opportunities
 Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles
 A flexible/hybrid work environment combining in office collaboration and remote working
 A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance

 If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.



 Job Description
  Position Description
 Reporting to the Director, Business Intelligence (BI) – Management Insights & Analytics, the Manager will leverage data, technology, and partnership across both the Investment Departments and Core Services to support these teams in their decision-making process required for the execution of their responsibilities. Within the Finance, Analytics and Risk (FAR) department, the BI team delivers visual and dynamic advanced analytical solutions by providing an integrated and independent view of key investment and business metrics with self-serve monitoring reports.
 As a Manager, you will be responsible to lead and assist in various projects that involve multiple stakeholders.
 Role-Specific Accountabilities

 Strong ability to lead the team in a fast pace environment and manage simultaneous projects through adherence to standard practices.
 Collaborate with various internal stakeholders to plan, manage, and oversee data pipelines, dashboard integrations, and the infrastructure of databases.
 Leverage strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills to work with data providers and end users in assessing, transforming, and storing data for analytical and reporting requirements.
 Ability to identify existing and potential risks and propose recommendations for solutions.
 Proactively improving existing processes and adapting to changes to resolve issues.
 Work with the team and Project Manager(s) to create feasible timelines, identify project risks and actively resolve issues.




 Qualifications
 

 A post-secondary degree in Finance, Business, Computer Science, Mathematics or equivalent.
 5-7+ years of data science, data management technology, ETL and experience working on complex projects is required.
 5+ years of people management skills
 Experience managing and monitoring the end-to-end of data pipelines and projects, as well as developing and implementing technical solutions to meet business needs is required.
 Demonstrates broad financial market domain knowledge and construct insights from portfolio data.
 Experience setting up data infrastructures and streamlining data with Python and SQL is required.
 Extensive experience working with large data sets with Python and SQL is required.
 Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
 Experience working with Cloud technology, Tableau, Jenkins, and Jira would be considered an asset.
 Innovative thinking, diverse perspectives, and a keen interest to learn.

 Additional Information
  Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-KE1
 #LI-Hybrid
 At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.
 We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.
 Our Commitment to Inclusion and Diversity:
 In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
 Disclaimer:
 CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

 Mandatory Vaccine Policy
 All employees in the Toronto, New York, San Francisco, Mumbai, Sydney, Hong Kong, and Sao Paulo offices will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Accommodations to this policy will be made for medical or other protected grounds. Please contact us to discuss any accommodation needs.

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Salesforce
Description:
Who we are:
 Ivey Business School acknowledges and respects the traditional lands of the Anishinaabek, Haudenosaunee, Lūnaapéewak, and Attawandaron peoples, where Western University and Ivey Business School are located. This land continues to be home to diverse Indigenous peoples, whom we recognize as contemporary stewards of the land and vital contributors of the community.
 Ivey Business School (www.ivey.ca) at Western University (www.uwo.ca) is Canada’s leading provider of real-world, case-based business education. Drawing on extensive research and business experience, Ivey’s faculty provides the best classroom experience, equipping students with the knowledge, skills, and capabilities they need to confidently take on today’s leadership challenges and opportunities through Case-Method Learning. Ivey offers undergraduate and graduate degree programs, as well as Executive Education at campuses in London, Toronto, and Hong Kong.
 Who you are:   You are a solution-oriented, strategic thinker with a strong blend of system design, business process and Salesforce expertise. You play an integral role in managing the stakeholder consultation process required for the successful planning, designing, building, testing, and support of complex IT challenges, particularly within Salesforce, while guiding others on best practices and methods of resolution.
 With demonstrable expertise in Salesforce, you will be involved in company wide strategic projects, focused on solutioning within the enterprise platform for both current and future needs.
 You will apply strong project management skills to assist stakeholders in designing high quality technology solutions – from requirements gathering to user support.
 By building strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external vendors, you provide specialized and informed insights that are essential in the selection of new technology solutions and the refinement of existing ones. This knowledge allows you to manage vendor agreement discussions and negotiations. It also builds trust and inspires internal stakeholders to regularly review and optimize their IT business solutions.
 You are always researching new technologies and approaches to ensure that Ivey’s technology solutions are modern and optimized to provide the best experience for all Ivey stakeholders (e.g., students, staff, faculty, alumni, and corporate partners).
 You excel working in a highly collaborative team that uses an agile approach to workload management.

 What you’ll do:
 Technology solution design and implementation
 Solution design and implementation – primarily focused on salesforce, across multiple projects, involving cross-functional groups, departments, and external vendors

 Perform complex business and system analysis work to optimize business processes through designing and implementing end-to-end user centric solutions supporting business requirements
 Document and develop detailed diagrams of current state business problem, user stories and requirements as it relates to the overall solution, as well as the supporting applications and interfaces, identify gaps, and discover new opportunities for automation
 Translate functional business problems into technical requirements and well-architected end-to-end solutions that align with industry best practices and support business goals
 Research and promote business workflow and technology discussions and make appropriate recommendations to improve efficiency and end-user experience
 Create and present proposed solution designs clearly via diagrams, presentations, and verbally to the IT team business stakeholders
 Partner with business stakeholders to analyze the current workflows identifying opportunities for improvement from an experience perspective
 Facilitate requirement gathering sessions, solution proposal presentations, feature demonstrations, and support end user acceptance testing sessions with customers
 Propose solutions that optimize Salesforce system performance, increase adoption of Salesforce Lightning and improve user experience
 Provide thought-leadership to business partners by recommending innovative features, products, and technologies that should be introduced into the product roadmap which align to business vision and goals
 Measure the productivity impacts, improvements and other key metrics changes as a result of implementation of new processes and technologies
 Perform post project go live support to ensure adoption and successful change management
 Triage and support Tier 2+ inbound requests such as troubleshooting issues and bugs, and identifying future enhancements to improve user experience


 Project management and implementation
 Project Management (across multiple projects, involving cross-functional groups, departments, and external vendors)

 Lead highly complex system integration projects that require cross-functional group coordination (e.g. Systems Architecture and Developers).
 Initiate project with business case, project scope and overall project plan
 Plan for and manage risk with user stakeholder team members
 Create, adjust and execute project work plan
 Break project into work packages with vendor and/or I.T. developers
 Monitor and control project costs and scope
 Enforce project standards and deadlines
 Engage directly with Western Procurement on RFPs or with Western Legal as required for vendor contract review


 Priorities and cost implications for major projects

 Gather and analyze external costs for purchased solutions
 Negotiate with vendors to discover contract options and acquire the most cost-effective solutions for technology requirements.
 Monitor costs against estimates and communicate as appropriate
 Budget and ensure training and development of team members
 Coach team members and foster learning environment for ongoing improvement of team capabilities
 Sponsor and coach collaborative team goal-setting and achievement


 Support of Ivey systems and users of those systems

 Offer and optimize the support options available for Ivey custom, off-the-shelf and 3rd party (cloud) solutions
 Provide expertise and support to colleagues offering Tier 2 Support to increase their capabilities in resolving complex application-related issues to ensure high-quality support is provided to end users


 Roadmap planning and system integration documentation
 Contribution to IT Roadmap of Products and Services

 Engage with managers, senior and executive staff in the business units to bring forward high level business technology opportunities
 Explore and propose innovative technology opportunities
 Collaborate on creation of and priority setting for projects on the I.T. roadmap
 Collaborate on the development of the IT Roadmap of Products and Solutions
 Maintain documentation of relevant aspects of the IT Systems Map and integrate the documentation with other areas of IT.


 What you have:
 Education and Experience:

 Completion of an undergraduate degree or college diploma in a related field.
 5 – 7 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Business Systems Analyst with increasing levels of responsibility
 4+ years of in-depth, hands-on experience with consultation, design, and documentation of enterprise scale Salesforce solutions.
 Ability to understand business requirements and convert them into solution designs
 Previous Sales Cloud experience
 Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
 Deep understanding of how systems and automation support end-to-end business processes
 Excellent time management, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
 Experience with agile-scrum methodologies
 Certified Salesforce Administrator, App Builder, Sales Cloud Consultant, or CPQ Specialist is an asset
 Familiarity and experience working in a variety of business solutions. Experience working with higher education specific solutions is an asset, as is familiarity with Ivey’s current platform solutions, but not required
 Understanding of Salesforce Lightning Experience with previous experience designing solutions for Lightning Experience is an asset

 
Skills and Abilities:

 Expertise in the integration of on-premise and cloud-based solutions, including advanced Windows Server administration, Office 365 administration, SQL server administration, LMS platforms such as Canvas and LTI and API concepts.
 Demonstrated ability to providing direction and mentorship of developing team members
 Demonstrated leadership of multi-department and cross-functional project teams delivering technology solutions
 Ability to recognize opportunities outside of scope of responsibility and take initiative to engage managers and senior Ivey leaders
 Ability to provide leadership to stakeholder teams in developing high quality solutions. Lead cross functional discussions to drive transparency, agreement, and alignment.
 Demonstrated use of business process review methodology to elicit business requirements
 Proven track record of business process analysis, mapping and documentation for multi departmental and cross-functional teams
 Demonstrated design and documentation of functional requirements, use cases and acceptance criteria
 Proven ability to evaluate 3rd party software against business needs
 Ability to manage vendor relationships for successful implementations including exceptional negotiation skills.
 Expert-level experience and in-depth knowledge of Business Data Modeling; demonstrated familiarity with SQL and relational databases
 Proven ability to make sound decisions based on experience and the information at hand.
 Track record of working independently as well as collaboratively on a team, keeping all members and stakeholders well-informed about both positive and negative situations
 Excellent written and verbal communication; influencing and presentation skills
 Lifelong learner with the drive to explore and adapt to new technologies
 Capabilities to multi-task and shift priorities as required


 Location:
 London, Ontario
 Position Type
 This is a full-time (35-hours/week) 3-year renewable contract with full benefits.
 Hiring Range
 Based on the salary band for this role, candidates can expect to be offered a starting salary in the range of $73,500-$91,900. When determining salary, Ivey Business School considers the market, candidate experience, as well as internal equity. Once in the role, successful candidates will have the opportunity to progress through the range and beyond the hiring range of the band, through annual increases. The maximum salary for this band is approximately 20% higher than the top end of the hiring range.
 Application
 If you are excited about the opportunity to work for Canada’s most prestigious business school, working alongside the brightest staff, students, and globally recognized faculty, tell us why by submitting your resume and cover letter via the Ivey Careers page today.
 Application will close July 13, 2022 at 11:59 pm.
 Covid-19
 Effective September 7, 2021, all employees and visitors to campus are required to comply with Western's COVID-19 Vaccination Policy.
 Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion at Ivey
 Ivey Business School is committed to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion. Please explore Ivey’s EDI homepage for more information on Ivey's commitment to EDI, to read about Ivey’s progress in the EDI Update, and to meet Ivey’s EDI Advisory Council members.
 Ivey Business School invites applications from all qualified individuals. Ivey is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace, and welcomes applications from women, members of racialized groups/visible minorities, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, persons of any sexual orientation, and persons of any gender identity or gender expression.
