Title: Workforce Reporting Analyst
Description:
Overview 

 At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions. 
Workforce Operations @ Neo 
Our Workforce Operations team plays a significant part in enabling our business areas to be at their most efficient through the sourcing, planning and reporting of our resources. Workforce Operations focuses on ensuring we have the right people, in the right place, at the right times so we continue to deliver exceptional experiences to new and existing customers. By planning ahead and leveraging data to make decisions, this team helps to drive forward the continued long-term success of our business. 
The Role 
As our next Workforce Reporting Analyst , you’ll be responsible for historical reporting, trend analysis and KPI tracking to ensure our customer support and customer acquisition channels are being optimized and resourced effectively. We’re looking for someone who loves to analyze & synthesize data and can turn that data into a story for various lines of business. 


What you'll be doing:
 Provide forecasting and staffing recommendations to the business by sharing insight on historical data, current trending and future state Alongside the Workforce Management team, create and share daily reporting on Key Performance Indicators from across the business (this will include KPI’s such as Call Volumes, Abandon Rate and Service Levels achieved) Respond to leaders questions, concerns, or requests around reporting and key trends Collaborate with the WFM team to design, create, and maintain reports including onboarding new hires, schedule changes, and managing time off Understand when concerns need to be escalated to department leadership Work with our leadership teams to improve our processes and tools 


Who we're looking for:
 You bring 2-3 years of experience in reporting and data analysis You have strong expertise with reporting tools including spreadsheets, Data Studio, Talkdesk and Zendesk You bring an understanding of Workforce management systems or scheduling/resourcing tools You have database experience and ability to dig into any problem, and troubleshoot any kind of technical issue 


What will help you succeed:
 You bring strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail, grit, perseverance, organization and a thirst for learning You are intellectually curious, and won’t stop investigating a problem until you have identified the root causes You are a structured and logical thinker, capable of taking a problem and breaking it down into its component parts 


About applying with us:
 At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future. 

 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Senior Analyst, Analytics & Insights (Call Center & Operations)
Description:
Canada's Challenger Bank™



 Equitable Group Inc. trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: EQB and EQB.PR.C) and serves a growing number of Canadians through Equitable Bank, Canada's Challenger Bank™. Equitable Bank has grown to become the country's eighth largest independent Schedule I bank with a clear mandate to drive real change in Canadian banking to enrich people's lives. Founded over 50 years ago, Equitable Bank provides diversified personal and commercial banking and through its EQ Bank platform has been named #1 Bank in Canada on the Forbes World's Best Banks 2021 and 2022 lists. EQ Bank provides state-of-the-art digital banking services, like the Savings Plus Account that reimagines banking by offering an everyday high interest rate, plus the flexibility of a chequing account, as well as a wide range of smart banking solutions for Canadians, like fast international money transfers, US dollar accounts and a suite of registered products.
  


 Purpose of Job


 


    The Analytics & Insights Sr. Analyst will be responsible for supporting the Senior Manager, Analytics & Insights Team on a variety of projects, including advanced analytics use case identification & execution, customer call center & operation analytics, data analysis and strategic planning. These projects usually involve cross-functional teams and contribute to the overall strategy and direction of the company, and support senior executive and Board-level decision making. The incumbent will use his or her analytical abilities to provide both qualitative and quantitative input supporting the development of recommendations for Senior Management. Types of uses cases currently in the scope of this role includes call/chat forecasting, agent schedule optimization & call/chat tagging and many more.
  





 Main Activities 


Support development & implementation of advanced analytics roadmap (30%)
 Support multiple analytics projects for the Bank , and ensure projects are aligned with strategic priorities of the cross functional lead for call center
 Support the new enterprise data enhancements and the associated analytical insights and capabilities that this will provide
 Create and deliver presentations to communicate findings from analysis
 Support the evaluation of appropriate partners, tools, methodologies, and analytical techniques to ensure our measurement solutions are most complete, integrated, advanced and on par with latest industry trends

 Analytical analysis for problem solving (40%)
 Develop familiarity with internal systems and gather relevant data from various internal sources, establishing repeatable processes/ methodologies that enable quicker turnaround on analysis 
Design and manage dashboards that consolidate KPIs and metrics across the business; conduct ad-hoc analysis using data to support business decision making
 Assess and diagnose information needs, design and define suitable analytical solutions to generate meaningful insights that address business problems
 Present key insights and recommendations based on research and data analysis
 Support forecasting for calls volumes & chats for proactive planning
 Lead the effort to optimize agent schedule rostering to improve SLA of the call center
 Use quantitative methods (i.e., Excel models) to develop insights that support decision making on new products & initiatives 
Use SQL to source necessary data for ongoing understanding of customer behaviour and to support internal consulting projects
 Support the brainstorm, structure and problem solving processes for a range of strategic and tactical customer-facing topics

 Cross-functional collaboration with various teams to deliver analytical insights (30%)
 Collaborate with teams across the Bank to deliver quality analysis, interpretation of findings and clear articulation of results and insights to internal business partners
 Support Call Center/ Operations in their delivery and analytical review of various strategic engagement tactics and improve their KPI
 Use advanced analytical techniques to advance the capabilities of analyzing voice & text data to drive proactive decision making 
Support Customer Experience (CX) and Contact Center in planning & evaluating marketing campaigns and meeting their customer insights needs
 Support creation of monthly reports to support the operation team








 Knowledge/Skill Requirements


 Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Math, or Computer Science
 3-6 years of work experience in Analytics, Strategy, Data Science roles, ideally in Financial services preferred
 Strong business acumen and passion for understanding and solving problems for consumers of financial services using rigorous data-driven methods and advanced analytical approaches
 Past experience in call center analytics projects will be a value add
 Excellent analytical, modeling and problem solving skills 
Excellent oral and written communication skills
 Proficient in using MS Office (Excel, Access, Power Point)
 Experience with databases (e.g. SQL code) and data visualization (e.g. Tableau) is an asset
 Strong attention to detail and time management skills








    #LI-Hybrid
  


 What we offer [For full-time permanent roles]




    Competitive discretionary bonus
  

    ✨ Market leading RRSP match program
  

    Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits
  

    Employee Share Purchase Plan
  

    Maternity/Parental top-up while you care for your little one
  

    Generous vacation policy, personal days and even a moving day
  

    Virtual events to connect with your fellow colleagues
  

    Annual professional development allowance and a comprehensive Career Development program
  

    A fulfilling opportunity to join one of the top FinTechs and help create a new kind of banking experience
  





    Equitable Bank is deeply committed to inclusion. Our organization is stronger and our employees thrive when we honour and celebrate everyone’s diverse experiences and perspectives. In tandem with that commitment, we support and encourage our staff to grow not just in their career path, but personally as well.
  


 We commit to providing a barrier-free recruitment process and work environment for all applicants. Please let us know of any accommodations needed so that you can bring your best self to the application process and beyond. All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position. 
  



   We can’t wait to get to know you!

Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY  As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

 LIFE at OPENTEXT:
 At OpenText and in IT, we believe in every employee having meaningful, purposeful work. By joining our team, you will join a community of supportive and collaborative peers focused on innovation, teamwork, and driving successful outcomes. You’ll be expected to bring with you an ideation and “Yes, if” mindset. And, as you build your network and demonstrate your professional excellence, you will have the opportunity to forge your own career path and professional growth.

 The Opportunity: 
OpenText is looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst for the Center of Excellence within the IT organization to help support our Sales & Marketing business. This individual will take charge of a project and deliver results that will make the organization more profitable. Can work on multiple projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that improves corporate processes. To be successful, the senior business systems analyst’s focus will be on process design, process reengineering, business requirements, gap analysis, data flows and provide internal ticket triage support for the business.
 
You Are Great At: 
The successful candidate will be part of the COE team and have the following responsibilities: 

Work closely with broad user groups to coordinate and complete Operational Excellence activities to support sponsored projects and enhancements by:


 Documenting and developing current state process flows.
 Determine and document business requirements for business processes and ensure they don’t conflict with the requirements for future projects.
 Preparing Gap Analysis.
 Documenting and developing future state process flows.
 Participate in the discussions of the functional spec & technical design.
 Coordinate the IT executive review of the proposed design & obtain sign off.
 Coordinate the business review of the proposed design & obtain sign off.
 Develop comprehensive E2E test cases and steps that will be loaded into HPALM.
 Manage & triage defects assigned during testing.
 Obtain sign off from the business for go live.
 Prepare communications out to the business for the change impacts.
 Prepare user training documentation for new functionality if required.
 Document & coordinate the deployment plan.


 Being a top performing business systems analyst with knowledge in the Sales & Marketing space. 
Provide support to business users on systems issues, escalating to Manager, COE, or an IT development/technical team as appropriate.
 Provide period end support to users as required, tickets, escalations, solutions.
 Create and build Operational Excellence Culture through inclusion, engagement, communication, and celebration.
 Use active listening and discussion skills to identify issues, ensure understanding and facilitate problem-solving.
 Match different influence strategies and negotiating styles to fit the person or situation.
 Provide development opportunities and support to maximize Operational Excellence orientation across the organization.
 Collaborate with others to generate appropriate Operational Excellence deployment plan with organizational measures of success.
 Act as communication liaison between IT team and other pillars and functional areas.
 Involve and coach business leaders in preparing for and sustaining change.
 Be a change champion within the site and network by prompting questions and promoting team-based behavior.
 Using applications such as Salesforce (CPQ), Marketo, ZiftOne, Partner Programs, SAP, ITSM, ServiceNow, HPALM, JIRA, Web applications, eCommerce.


 What It Takes: 
The successful candidate will have the following Core Requirements:

 BA certified or equivalent experience.
 5+ years of professional/technical experience – prior experience and in-depth knowledge of SFDC, Marketo and partner programs.
 Strong experience in user testing with attention to detail with emphasis on accuracy.
 Ability to prioritize, organize, and accomplish multiple tasks, both as part of a team and independently.
 Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
 Experience in production support is an asset.
 Knowledge in the eCommerce/On-line space.
 A high standard for work ethic and quality is required.


 OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com).

 Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Systems Analyst Location: Toronto, ON Duration: Long Term Contract
Job Description:
The Senior Business System Analyst (BSA) will be working on big data platform with data from multiple internal and external data sources; the BSA will need to be able to create new variable/feature requirements, data mapping, and data gap/issue investigation. The Candidate will also support the IBM applications for GRM's credit strategies and models.

  Understanding various lending product and client attributes from upstream systems Performing data gap analysis, systems, processes and procedures as required for the project Create reporting mapping logic or requirements documentation Communicating requirement to development and QA, performing testing, coordinating UAT testing and assisting production implementation Report the BA team working status and raise concerns or issues that may hinder the project progress as planned to management and PMs Contributing to the process re-engineering and process improvement Supporting the GRM credit strategy and analytics team 
 
Must-have

Experience in data hub with various data sources of lending products (e.g. Line of credit, credit card, mortgage etc.) and client databases Experience in systems implementation, process improvements or systems reengineering projects with a banking organization or consulting company Knowledge of SDLC lifecycle, waterfall, Agile, and others and experience with Confluence and Jira 
  Moderate or advanced proficiency in SQL and ability to read through Python code for understanding existing variable mapping logic Good collaboration skills and willingness to function as part of a team Good problem solving skills in order to perform independent root cause analysis of data issues Ability to prioritize and multi-task Undergraduate degree or higher, preferable in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, or Engineering 
 
Nice-to-have

  Work experience with credit related systems, e.g. 
  ESN-D, EDW, ERDL, CORE, and CSDM etc. Retail banking experience and/or financial institution experience Experience with 
  Hadoop and Hive Experience with API implementation Data Science and Machine Learning experience

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
E INC is the parent company of EBlock and EDealer, unifying our approach to products, services, and strategies under one Vision and one Mission: to create the best digital auction and retailing platform in the world by connecting the automotive wholesale and retail experiences. Our brands and their technologies make it easy for a vehicle to move between buyers and sellers throughout its entire ownership lifecycle. https://e.inc/

 Role Summary
 E INC is seeking Sr. Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team to build and manage BI reporting. The role with work with stakeholders from various sides of the business to pull data and perform analyses to drive business decision making. Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and other helpful information and at times, be prepared to present findings and discuss trends and insights. Review and improve data and analytics processes, methods, and tools to increase efficiency and accuracy. The candidate will also be an active contributor to the Data & Analytics team policy committee to establish and implement standards across the company.


 What You Will Do:

Solve data questions requiring advanced transforms, custom queries, statistical analyses, or other related tasks outside the realm of possibility for a self-service tool.
Create ad hoc scripts to extract meaning from the underlying data and answer relevant business questions.
Develop and maintain predictive modeling and forecasting to help key stakeholders build a proactive strategy.
Convey results that speak to the requester’s core business questions and provide key insights and relevant action items.
Clearly communicate nuanced and complex analytical concepts, often translating meaning to impact on the business.
Sustain a comprehensive knowledge of analytics tools (such as Power BI, SQL, JupyterLab, Tableau, statistical languages/packages, or other tools to easily analyze and visualize data) and apply knowledge to help build out more dynamic, automated, and easy to consume reporting for key stakeholders.
Build reporting dashboards from start to finish, including identification of strategic key performance indicators (KPIs), queries to obtain the data, visualizations, and dashboard maintenance.
Educate team members on data literacy to promote proper and relevant usage of dashboards and reporting while also maintaining a general understanding of team and project priorities.
Collaborate with internal partners to identify and understand key data sources for analytics.



 What You Will Need:

MBA or Master’s degree in field related to statistics, data analytics, programming, Information Systems, Data Science or Computer Science.
5+ years of experience in the following:
Advanced and experienced in SQL and SQL Server.
Advanced and experienced in building complex dashboards for variety of audiences with advanced BI tools such as Tableau, Google Analytics or PowerBI.
Experience utilizing databases and warehouses for analysis.
Experience with infrastructure tools (e.g., Transactional Systems knowledge, data repositories, data catalogues)
Experience with data management tools (e.g., integrations – structured/rectangular and non-structured data/excel, external, APIs)
Programming background, specifically in statistical languages and packages such as Python.
Experience with forecasting, statistical analysis, predictive algorithms, clustering, and segmentation.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and interfacing with a broad set of stakeholders across various functions (i.e., Business, IT, Operations).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills presenting complex analytical results to both technical and non-technical audiences.



 Why work with us? E INC is a growing company that is continuing to evaluate our ongoing commitment and investment in our team members with:

Competitive pay
Medical, Dental & Vision
401k/RSP with Match
Paid time off
Flexible working environment
Continuous Learning
And an amazing culture to top it all off!



 E INC. is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. E INC. recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age disability, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other protected by law. Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst, Corporate Systems
Description:
Role Description
 The Business Systems Analyst, Corporate Systems is responsible for working with internal business clients, internal technical support, and external vendor stakeholders to ensure Corporate Application system implementations, upgrades, enhancements, and changes are well defined and appropriately implemented and supported. This is based out of our Vernon, BC office with the possibility of working remotely.
 Responsibilities
 Analysis of business requirements

 Collaborate with corporate customers to determine systems requirements
 Translate business needs and requirements into coherent functional and technical specifications
 Review business opportunities, technical specifications, as well as provide advice to determine if the initiatives are feasible Coordinates and participates in the implementation of changes, enhancements and upgrades to Corporate Systems applications
 Create ad hoc reports responding to requests for data and analyze business procedures and problems to develop specifications
 Act as an advisor and make recommendations in response to new solutions
 Ensure the roadmap for Corporate Applications is aligned with other IS roadmaps

 Project development and support

 Participates in the planning and execution of projects that impact business applications and their stakeholders
 Translates business needs and requirements into coherent functional and technical specifications

 Documentation of processes and technical specifications

 Participate in the definition and improvement of business application support processes and procedures.
 Assist in the preparation and update of business processes.
 Prepare, maintain and distribute business application technical and business user documentation.
 Provide references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation, providing service desk support and training users.
 Prepare and deliver informative, well-organized presentations and communications.

 Troubleshooting and system maintenance

 Troubleshoot, analyze, prioritize and help coordinate the resolution of problems and issues with business applications.
 Provide Tier 2 and Tier 3 support for business applications and liaise with the IS Service Desk on incidents or service requests.
 Coordinate and participate in the implementation of changes, enhancements and upgrades to business applications.
 Participate in and coordinate all types of testing and quality assurance activities related to business applications.
 Configure and manage business applications per business and technical requirements.
 Establish and maintain close working relationships with vendors and service providers.

 Experience

 Minimum 5-7 years’ experience working with business systems in a medium to large organization
 Experience with Azure DataLake
 Experience with PeopleSoft HCM solutions
 Experience with PeopleSoft security
 Experience with Cloud based applications and their support and implementation

 Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

 Strong understanding of integrating finance applications
 Manage vendor escalations
 Knowledge of Microsoft Synapse
 Skill in systems testing of specification requirements
 Skill in business or technical writing as evidenced by previous work-related experience
 Ability in using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems
 Ability to effectively participate in multiple major projects or project roles or lead a variety of project team activities/tasks
 Ability to perform objective analysis and re-engineering of business processes to maximize quality service and cost-effectiveness
 Comprehensive knowledge of the automated business applications, and their relationships to each other, and interfaces to outside systems
 Experience in effectively serving on successful information systems project teams

 Education

 Post-secondary graduate with a degree, diploma or certificate in computer science or equivalent combination of education, training and experience

 Special Requirements

 Evening and occasional weekend work may be required
 Ability to participate in on-call after hours’ support rotation may be required
 Kal Tire is the largest independently owned tire dealer in Canada with over 250 locations. Our business philosophy centers on exceeding our customers’ expectations and relies on our entrepreneurial team members to provide exceptional customer service.

Title: Associate Market Data Specialist (analyst)
Description:
As a leading global technology solutions provider to the investment management industry, Confluence helps clients solve complex investment data challenges across the front, middle and back office. From innovative portfolio analytics to regulatory and financial reporting solutions, Confluence invests in the latest technology and data and in its team of industry experts to meet the evolving needs of asset managers and service providers. Headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA, Confluence services over 400 clients in 40 countries, with locations across Europe, North America, South Africa, Australia and Asia.

 The Montreal office is the market data hub for the global company. The Equity, Index & Operations team is responsible for the quality and daily assessments of equity type securities, mutual funds, exchange rates, indices as well as the customer service for our North American client base. 
We are currently recruiting for a Market Data Specialist to join our Equity and Data Operations team in Montreal. This is an exciting new role with many opportunities to work with financial market data and grow within our team.
 
Responsibilities

 Validating price returns, corporate events and historical performance to match client expectation as well as benchmarks. 
Ensuring data quality and identifying outliers (Equities, FX rates, Corporate Actions, some Fixed income evaluation data).
 Constantly seeking process automation, methodology updates, workflows improvements and documentation.
 Analyzing issues at any point in the workflow from vendor, to internal system, to client delivery.
 Providing support to external clients, internal client services and development teams.

 Essential Qualifications

 Very comfortable with financial market data and how stocks, bonds, indices, etc. are used.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. 
Solid knowledge of Excel and SQL.
 Ability to work in a fast paced environment with production deadlines.
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, working knowledge of French.
 Flexible with occasionally working a non-standard shift as required: 
   
8:00am to 4:00pm
 2:00pm to 10:00pm (~ once a week)


 Ideal Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree in Business/Finance, mathematics, statistics, economics, or related fields.
 0 to 1 years in similar role.
 Experience with financial instrument data, bond terms and conditions, equities and derivatives.
 Knowledge of asset and portfolio analytics.
 Ability to write simple code in VBA or other (an asset).
 Experience with JIRA/Confluence ticketing system.

 Personality:

 Very high attention to detail.
 Constantly challenging the status quo.
 Team player.
 Willingness to take responsibility and be autonomous.
 Eager to learn.

Title: Regulatory Analyst
Description:
Overview 

 At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions. 

 Finance @ Neo 

 Neo Financial is looking for a full-time Regulatory Analyst to join our team in Calgary, AB. Our finance team is more than just your average group of number crunchers with their heads down in data. They see the big picture and are all about growth opportunities, knocking down business barriers, and building a future in the fintech world. Make your mark with transformative products and technologies, alongside some of Canada’s most successful business leaders and tech minds. 


What you'll be doing:
 Responsible for completing and analyzing data accurately from various sources to prepare regulatory returns and reports, including: OSFI, ASC, CDIC and other authorities on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis Complete daily/weekly capital reporting Identify and implement reporting process improvements Develop an in-depth knowledge/expertise of Canadian regulatory rules and interpretations Participate/assist with regulator queries Participate in various audits – external, regulatory, and compliance Assist with monthly financial reporting packages, including variance analysis Preparation of monthly reconciliation of assigned balance sheet accounts and investigate/remediate issues Complete ad-hoc reporting/analysis or projects 


Who we're looking for:
 3-4 years progressive experience in a relevant finance role, preferably within a financial institution Strong knowledge of ASPE and IFRS Ability to develop and maintain strong internal and external working relationships Strong analytical, decision making, planning, and organizational skills Comfortable working with autonomy and ownership in a fast paced environment, taking initiative to resolve issues A professional accounting designation or a CFA is considered an asset 


About applying with us:
 At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future. 

 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Hedge Fund Investment Due Diligence Analyst - Structured Credit
Description:
Job Summary & Purpose:
 Albourne Partners (Canada) Limited is looking for a Hedge Fund Investment Due Diligence Analyst. The Hedge Fund Investment Due Diligence Analyst provides support for hedge fund manager selection, investment due diligence and strategy analysis with a focus on Structured Credit strategies.
 The Company:
 Albourne is an investment consultant which was founded in 1994. Albourne advises over 300 investors, including institutional investors, financial intermediaries, and family offices, on over $650 billion alternative investments across the liquidity spectrum. It specializes in Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Private Credit, Real Assets, Real Estate and Dynamic Beta.
 Albourne empowers its clients to be the best investors they could be by providing Portfolio Advice, Research (Investment, Operational and Quantitative due diligence), Data & Analytics, and Implementation Support (middle and back office) services. Albourne seeks to minimize potential conflicts of interest by only providing non-discretionary advice, which it does on a fixed fee basis.
 Albournes 550+ employees are in 11 offices globally, including London, San Francisco, Connecticut, Munich, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tokyo, Toronto, Nicosia, Bahrain, and Bermuda. Albourne is proud of its flat structure with over 90 Partners, over 75 of whom are either share or option holders.
 Albourne strives to be a sustainable company with three main goals: 1) Aspiring to be a multi-generational firm with broad internal ownership and a Partnership structure; 2) Treating our employees and clients fairly; and 3) Advocating for positive change for its benefit and for the alternative investment industry best practices have always been a defining part of who we are.
 Responsibilities:
 Fund Investment Due Diligence

The Fund investment due diligence process includes the initial screening of investment managers; participating in meetings with the managers; quantitative performance analysis and qualitative due diligence;
Prepare written meeting notes and assist in the preparation of investment due diligence reports;
Provide ongoing monitoring of funds in client portfolios or on fund lists in the given strategy to ensure accuracy of existing research and ratings
To the extent possible help build relationships between Albourne, the client and covered managers to assist with client access to funds

 Strategy Analysis

Assist in the production of strategy forecasting for assigned strategies within Hedge Funds
Assist in the production and maintenance of asset class/industry research outlining the key attributes, trends and drivers of a given strategy
Identify and recommend any additional tools or analytics which will enhance the overall accuracy of Albournes research 

Additional Responsibilities

Ensure internal database is maintained with up-to-date information
Meet deadlines set by management and clients
Support business development activities, including involvement in client marketing and portfolio construction as needed
Communicate with clients as required
Any other ad hoc projects as assigned

 Desired Qualifications:

University graduate or equivalent with 3 5 years experience in alternative fund investment due diligence, investment management, or related experience with a preference for knowledge of hedge funds and/or structured credit.
Possession of or advanced progression towards relevant professional qualifications (i.e. CFA, CAIA) preferred
Strong Excel skills
Literate in financial markets and terminology
Knowledge of Bloomberg preferred
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Proactive self-starter, proficient time management and multi-tasking
Professional demeanor and strong interpersonal skills
Travel (as required)
Regulatory registration (dependent on regional requirements)

 Benefits:

 Comprehensive group health coverage
 Registered retirement savings program
 Bonus scheme
 Casual dress
 Education reimbursement
 Company events & social hours

 Albourne offers:

 A collegiate work environment
 Wellness program
 Sponsored charity day events and volunteering opportunities
 Biennial company offsite events

 Job Type: Full-time, Hybrid
 Location: Toronto, Canada
 Work authorization: Must be eligible to work in Canada
 Albourne is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce, encouraging applications from all qualified individuals.
 Albourne Partners (Canada) Limited (APCA ) is in full compliance with the AODA
 APCA will accommodate applicants disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact HR.
 You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
 Albourne thanks all applicants but only successful candidates will be contacted.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
At Desjardins, we believe in equity, diversity and inclusion. We're committed to welcoming, respecting and valuing people for who they are as individuals, learning from their differences, embracing their uniqueness, and providing a positive workplace for all. At Desjardins, we have zero tolerance for discrimination of any kind. We believe our teams should reflect the diversity of the members, clients and communities we serve.
 


   If there's something we can do to help make the recruitment process or the job you're applying for more accessible, let us know. We can provide accommodations at any stage in the recruitment process. Just ask!
 


   Job Level
  NV-10
  As a data analyst, you collect, process, analyze and use data that comes through different channels. You extract, describe, analyze and interpret the data needed to make informed business decisions.
 
 You lead stakeholders in projects for designing analytical solutions adapted to a wide range of business needs and in complex strategic data collection, processing and analysis interventions.
 
 You make recommendations on the planning and execution of operationally and conceptually complex analytical projects and initiatives that involve using your ability to use multiple databases, your analytical skills and your in depth, comprehensive understanding of the line of business and the organization.
  Your initiatives require extensive, in-depth knowledge of your line of work.
 
 You serve as a data use specialist advisor and subject matter expert for various stakeholders, and as a resource person and coach for decision-making bodies. You interact with many stakeholders in other fields to understand and communicate issues, and influence decision-making.
 

   General Information on the Position
 


   Other working conditions
 



     Workplace : Position located in Lévis or Montreal, depending on the applicant selected. The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work
   


     Number of jobs available : 1
   



   Qualifications
 



     Bachelor's degree in a related field
   


     A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience
   



   Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered
 



     For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required
   



   Desjardins Cross-sector skills
  Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning
 

   Key competencies for the job
  Collaborates, Drive results, Innovation, Interpersonal Savvy, Organizational savvy, Strategic mindset
 

   Work Location
  150, rue des Commandeurs Lévis
 

   Trade Union
  Non Syndiqué
 

   Unposting Date
  2022-07-24
 

   Job Family
  Data (FG)
 

   Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for reviewing business operations to address problems and enable continuity. We will rely on you to identify potential risks and opportunities by collecting and analyzing information. Your goal is to ensure that our company operates efficiently. As a Business Analyst, you should have excellent analytical, problem-solving and communication skills. You should be highly organized and able to prioritize effectively while meeting strict deadlines. most importantly experience of legal contract vetting and understanding of business laws for contract framing and vetting and liasoning with lawyers required, especially in the areas of europe, bangladesh, pakistan, Arabic countries and South East Asia.
Responsibilities:

Create business requirements and use cases.
Analyze processes and data to create prototypes of new solutions.
Create documentation and communicate requirements to the technical team.
Architecture design, implemenation and testing of new systems.
Design complex queries and analyze data to extract insights.
Work with business users, subject matter experts or business analysts to get clear requirements for new solutions.
Analyze results from user acceptance tests and refine system architecture.
Build functional specifications from business requirements and design specifications.
Perform other duties as needed.

Salary: $67,237.00-$72,496.00 per year
Benefits:

Paid time off

English not required

8 hour shift

Title: Senior Analyst OR Manager, Advisory & Assurance (Audit)
Description:
Our client in Toronto, is seeking a Senior Analyst OR Manager, Advisory & Assurance (Audit) for their team. In reporting to the Director Risk Advisory, you will be responsible to lead and execute to the audit plan and liaise with a variety of cross-functional stakeholders in critical and exciting regulatory, operational, and strategic areas. The engagements range from regulatory audits, process optimization, data analytics and visualization, risk and controls assessments, assurance, and special high-priority consulting projects as requested by senior management and the Board. This will be a hybrid working arrangement. 

 This individual is expected to demonstrate strong banking and financial services experience, leadership, and interpersonal skills to help drive partnerships and engagements. PLEASE NOTE THAT COMPENSATION AND RESPONSIBILITIES WILL BE TAILORED TO THE LEVEL OF ROLE BEST SUITED FOR THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE . For the Senior Analyst we are looking for 1-3 years of experience, and for the Manager, 3-4 years of experience. 


The Role:
 Simultaneously lead and execute the planning, execution and reporting of multiple high-priority and high-visibility Assurance and Advisory engagements, focusing on governance, regulatory audits including OSFI requirements, AML, credit risk, market risk, capital adequacy, and performance improvements. 
Conduct opening and closing meetings with Senior Executives and Management Board members. 
Prepare and communicate audit findings and recommendations with senior levels of Management. 
Conduct research of new and emerging issues and best practices in risk assessment, auditing, and accounting. 
Deliver and present highly visual, creative, client-focused deliverables and presentations. 

 Requirements 


About You:
 You have exceptional communication skills. You can manage client relationships and communicate effectively around the project lifecycle with client contacts and senior leadership. You can proactively develop and own relationships with key stakeholders in the business. You are a collaborative team player. You have superior Relationship Management skills. You are comfortable presenting to Senior Executives. 


Your Key Qualifications:
 A bachelor’s degree in business, accounting, finance, or a related field. 
A CPA in good standing. CIA or MBA a strong asset. 
1-4 years of experience in the Financial Services Audit Practice at a large accounting firm OR 1-4 years of experience in Financial Services Audit/ERM/Risk at a Bank/Financial Institution. 
Experience in projects related to Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) requirements, in areas such as anti-money laundering (AML) and capital adequacy (ICAAP), outsourcing of business activities (B-10) and the Financial Consumer Agency of Canada (FCAC). 
Strong business acumen, with an ability connect the dots between the business strategy, tactics, risks, and control environment, with significant exposure to risk/control mindset & frameworks. 


Why Apply:
 Unique opportunity to join a large world-class team of risk advisory & audit professionals with a proven industry leader. 
Ability to make an impact on business leaders through projects and risk discussions. 
Direct access to Executive Leadership and the Board. 
A competitive compensation and benefits package. 
Employee share ownership program and pension plan. 
Diversity and inclusivity. 
Commitment to community support and volunteerism. 
Recognition and social events. 

 If interested in learning more about this role and partnering with Robert Half in the search for your next full-time role, please apply online referencing Senior Analyst OR Manager, Advisory & Assurance (Audit). Kindly note, due to volume - only those applicants who most closely match the hiring requirements of our clients will be contacted for a further conversation. We thank all applicants for their interest. 

 Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Title: Bilingual Electronic Communications Analyst, Internal Controls
Description:
Requisition ID: 150695  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose: Contributes to the overall success of the GWM Internal Controls Monitoring and Testing Program, ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
 Bilingual French and English written and verbal skills are required.
 Accountabilities:

   1. Manage the electronic communications program that monitors and retains employees’ e-mail and other electronic communications in accordance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices.
  

Execute and report the results of the eCommunications Monitoring Program primarily focused on Asset Management businesses (e.g. 1832 AM, PIC and JFL).
Review electronic communications thoroughly and exhibit a high level of understanding relating to those communications required to be escalated to management
Maintain an informed and consistent level of knowledge of regulatory requirements and system functions, reduce regulatory, reputational, and financial risk to Global Wealth Management.



   2. Contribute to the activities relating to data analysis supporting the GWM Business Line:
  

Perform research, analysis, and maintenance of client data within the appropriate internal system(s)
Ensures work is processed and distributed accurately according to established SLA’s
Perform daily analysis and maintenance of various reports utilizing Microsoft Office applications and Data Analytics tools
Work directly with other business units to resolve ad-hoc issues
Responsible for the escalation to Manager, Senior Manager, and appropriate Compliance Department of all matters which may present a potential issue
Execute additional responsibilities focused on Business Unit and Branch / Field Support initiatives, as required. Maintain and develop technical skills and increase ability to navigate through Excel spreadsheets and databases efficiently and accurately



Follow the eCommunications escalation process and address issues identified by sending the customized escalation templates, in a timely matter.
Communicate with business unit(s) when electronic communication concerns are identified by explaining the applicable regulatory and BNS requirements.
Provide daily, weekly, and monthly results, reporting and statistics to Management
Identify and escalate to Management trends, repeat findings, and patterns of identified issues.
Participate in initiatives to increase awareness of eCommunications conduct.
Conduct periodic analysis on the supervised employees lists (registrants and traders) to ensure accuracy and provide updates to relevant partners (Technology, Project Delivery and Global Relay Vendor).
Identify opportunity to filter and eliminate marketing emails and/or duplicates to increase efficiency
Work with our technology partners to ensure the Global Relay application is operating effectively.


   3. Performs duties in a professional and thorough manner:
  

Ensuring that the daily work volumes are completed according to deadlines and that service standards are
 always met.
  

Perform other duties as assigned to enhance the monitoring team’s support capabilities and success.
Effectively communicate with other business partners and front-line employees regarding firm policy and regulatory requirements, when needed.
Assist wealth business units to resolve issues, as required
Actively participate in team-learning development activities and team-performance achievements
Provide relief for and assume responsibility of other colleagues in their absence



Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of their respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct, and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.


 Education & Experience:


Post-Secondary Education completed – Required.
CSC (Canadian Securities course) - Preferred.
French Proficiency – Required.
Proficiency in English and French language (verbal and written).



 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Alberta : Calgary || Canada : Alberta : Edmonton || Canada : Ontario : Ottawa || Canada : Quebec : Montreal  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Business System Analyst
Company: DUCA Financial Services Credit Union Ltd.
Description:
Senior Business System Analyst


 Job Purpose & Summary 
The Senior Business System Analyst provides complex system analysis, software deployment, testing and application support on projects, enhancements and operations related to one or more business system applications including Member onboarding, account & loan origination, and core banking. This role will consult with business partners, vendors, and colleagues to identify user requirements, perform business processes and systems analysis, and help develop overall project solutions.
 This role is considered a subject matter expert in the business processes(es) their assigned business system(s) support.


 Key Accountabilities & Duties 

Coordinate with business, vendor, and third-party stakeholders to develop and implement technical updates to business applications
Participate in projects as an IT resource, complete IT-related takeaways and communicate updates and findings to stakeholders
Provide project-level analysis, producing required documentation deliverables such as business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) recommendations
Provide and support the implementation of business solutions, identifying business needs, determining, and carrying out necessary processes, practices, monitoring progress and results
Manage and prioritize the project queue of system development projects to support strategic business projects and business optimization
Lead meetings with various partners in the business and use business analyst techniques and methodologies to gather business and technical requirements for a project
Collaborate with business SMEs to ensure needs are being met based on project criteria
Understand and translate or clearly explain business and technical requirements to software developers, vendors, and executives
Perform data extraction and analysis from DUCA’s core banking system and other business applications
Maintain a foundational understanding of DUCA’s databases and record structure; advise DUCA executives on reporting and analytical capabilities
Manage DUCA’s internal change management processes for changes to assigned business systems
Work with project managers, business analysts, developers, and system architects to complete high-priority system technical issues
Manage system releases (content, organizational impacts, etc.) and release schedule
Work with the Quality Assurance team to ensure that application releases and updates are free from errors and satisfy end user requirements
Provide third level technical support for assigned business applications, including database updates and third-party interfaces



 Occupational Experience & Education Requirements 

Undergraduate degree in Business, Technology, or a related field
Business Analysis Training or Certification
5 years’ experience in a Banking System Analyst or Business Analyst role
2-3 years’ experience working with a banking system
Experience in a financial institution or credit union considered an asset



 Knowledge, Skills & Attributes

Strong understanding of Business Process Management
Strong research and analytical skills
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Strong interpersonal skills and communication Skills
Proven problem-solving skills
Experience with requirements management
Experience with Account and/or Loan Origination Systems considered an asset
Keen to understand and learn unfamiliar processes
Good understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Good knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL)
Experience with Relational Databases
Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel
Experience with Web Service troubleshooting
Experience with Business Process Management tools (e.g.. Visio)
Experience supporting Central 1 Member Direct or another Online Banking System
Understanding of ITIL Framework
Understanding of application integration standards (e.g. ISO, SOAP, REST, XML)



 Working Conditions
 This position is required to work weekends and nights as necessary to ensure all business applications used in the end-to-end Member sales and services processes are available 24-7 and to support after regular business hours deployments of new systems, patches, fixes, and/or other enhancements.




Department: Information Technology
 Primary Location: Corporate Office
 Employment Status: Full-time
 Hours per Week: 38
 Job Grade Level: 7

About DUCA
 DUCA exists to help people do more, be more and achieve more with their money and their lives. We’re driven by a co-operative philosophy that puts our Members (and Owners) at the centre of every decision we make, gives them a voice in how we’re run, and rewards them for their loyalty by sharing our profits.
 At DUCA, we’re dedicated to creating a positive environment where our employees have growth and development opportunities, a healthy work/life balance, opportunities to give back to the community, and a focus on doing what is right for our Members. DUCA offers a competitive total compensation package including base salary, a short-term incentive (bonus) program, a comprehensive benefits program, pension plan, and employee banking benefits.

DUCA is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Recruitment related accommodations will be provided upon request.
 Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit their application. Applications must include both a resume and cover letter.
 We thank all applicants but only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Management Information Systems Analyst
Description:
WESTMAN COMMUNICATIONS GROUP (Westman) is seeking applications from energetic, highly motivated individuals to become part of our growing team!
Westman is an industry-leading communications provider based in Brandon MB, offering residential and commercial High-Speed Internet, Digital TV, and Phone services in communities across southwestern and central Manitoba. Westman also owns and operates radio stations Q Country 91.5 FM and 94.7 STAR FM, which broadcast throughout southwestern Manitoba. Established in 1977, as a locally owned and operated cooperative, Westman is dedicated to delivering competitive and innovative services, providing an exceptional member experience, and supporting the communities they serve. Westman empowers their employees to be innovative, team-oriented, community-based, and customer-focused, championing a culture centered around strong values.
What you’ll do: 

Assist in the monitoring and managing of customer and operational data, taking action/ownership to ensure the accuracy, consistency, relevance, and timeliness of information
Participate in proactive MIS collaboration with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to identify, analyze and understand business challenges and opportunities
Generate and distribute management reports in an accurate and timely manner
Coordinate with Billing System Administrator to provide ad hoc reports as needed
Perform data analysis for generating reports on a periodic basis
Learn and maintain knowledge of internal business processes
Assist with designing, monitoring, and supporting internally developed systems and solution integrations
Assist in maintaining coding standards and documenting internally developed solutions

What you’ll bring to the team: 

Certificate or diploma in a related field and/or 5 years of equivalent experience
Accredited course in database management or equivalent experience
5+ years of experience with large SQL databases
5+ years of experience with software and web application development
Solid understanding of SQL, database structures and routines
Knowledge of various software development languages (PHP, HTML, Java, .Net)
Strong strategic and critical thinking along with proven analytical and problem-solving skills
Results-oriented and process driven, with high expectations for self and team
Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence others, accompanied by well-developed presentation and facilitation skills
An equivalent combination of experience and education may be considered

DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS:  This position is open until filled.
Westman is a successful, fast-paced and dynamic organization, with a positive, team-oriented work environment. We offer competitive compensation including a comprehensive and unique benefits package. Leverage your knowledge with a local technology leader.
As an equal-opportunity employer, we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. While we thank each applicant for their interest, only selected candidates will be contacted.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Title: Analyste des Systèmes NetSuite | NetSuite Systems Analyst
Description:
[English description to follow]
 Sonder révolutionne l'hospitalité grâce à un service innovant alimenté par la technologie et à des hébergements inspirants et conçus de manière réfléchie, combinés en une seule expérience gérée de manière transparente. Officiellement lancé en 2014 et basé à San Francisco, Sonder rend un monde de meilleurs séjours ouvert à tous avec une variété d'options d'hébergement - des chambres aux suites et aux appartements - que l'on trouve dans plus de 30 villes réparties dans huit pays et sur trois continents. L'application innovante de Sonder permet aux clients d'accéder à des fonctions en libre-service et à une assistance sur le terrain 24 heures sur 24 et 7 jours sur 7. Qu'il s'agisse d'un simple enregistrement en libre-service ou d'équipements de salle de bains de luxe, nous offrons le meilleur d'un hôtel sans aucune formalité.

   En tant qu'analyste des systèmes, NetSuite, au sein de l'équipe des systèmes d'affaires, vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les utilisateurs des finances, de l'approvisionnement et d'autres équipes interfonctionnelles, sur diverses initiatives de système et fournirez un soutien tout au long du cycle de vie du projet. Vous serez l'expert résident de NetSuite et de l'écosystème des applications connexes.
 


CHEZ SONDER, VOUS SEREZ :


Vous serez un partenaire commercial solide et serez le point de contact pour les clôtures de fin de mois, les améliorations et la résolution de problèmes pour la gestion des dépenses, la gestion des commandes et des encaissements, la gestion des rapports et la gestion des achats.
Traduire les exigences commerciales en solutions bien architecturées qui tirent le meilleur parti de NetSuite et de l'écosystème des applications connexes.
Participer à des sessions de conception d'entreprise ; développer une documentation détaillée des solutions de processus d'entreprise et recommander une architecture appropriée qui soit alignée sur les objectifs de l'entreprise.
Contribuer à l'analyse des données, aux besoins en matière de rapports, aux initiatives d'amélioration continue, à la gestion du changement et au soutien pour une utilisation optimale de NetSuite.
Fournir une assistance pendant les tests et documenter le flux des processus d'affaires des solutions nouvelles et existantes, selon les besoins, et fournir une assistance pour la migration des données.
Collaborer avec les autres membres de l'équipe Sonder et les partenaires externes pour identifier et fournir les meilleures solutions NetSuite à nos parties prenantes.
Soutenir les utilisateurs de NetSuite pour les questions ou les demandes de service liées à leurs activités quotidiennes.



CE QUE NOUS RECHERCHONS :


Un baccalauréat, de préférence en informatique, en comptabilité ou en finance.
Minimum 3 ans d'expérience professionnelle avec une certaine expérience fonctionnelle de NetSuite. Une certification NetSuite et une connaissance de SuiteScript seraient un plus.
Solide connaissance démontrable de la configuration fonctionnelle de NetSuite. Une expérience des intégrations NetSuite serait un plus.
Bonne connaissance des finances générales, de la reconnaissance des revenus, des achats, des paiements et de la fiscalité. Vous devez avoir une expérience du module de traitement des paiements et une expérience des systèmes fiscaux comme Avalara, Vertex, etc.
Compréhension de la structure des tables et des données de Netsuite, un atout.
Expérience dans la collecte des exigences commerciales, la fourniture de conceptions conceptuelles et détaillées pour répondre aux besoins commerciaux, la rédaction de spécifications fonctionnelles détaillées pour le développement de programmes personnalisés, les tests et le soutien après la mise en service.
Doit être capable de créer des recherches sauvegardées et de personnaliser des rapports dans Netsuite.
Vous êtes à l'aise pour travailler avec des équipes interfonctionnelles et avec des tiers.
Solides compétences en communication écrite et verbale. Capacité à transmettre des stratégies, des priorités, des compromis et à s'engager avec des équipes interfonctionnelles par le biais de spécifications techniques détaillées et/ou d'images filaires.
Haut degré d'autodirection et d'autonomie.

Nous offrons également d'excellents avantages sociaux pour vous faciliter la vie et vous permettre de vous concentrer sur ce que vous savez faire le mieux :

Une rémunération compétitive
Plan d'options sur actions généreux
Assurance médicale, dentaire et visuelle
Les membres de l'équipe exonérés bénéficient de congés payés. Les membres de l'équipe non exemptés accumulent des congés payés.
Crédits annuels gratuits et remises pour rester à Sonders
Une entreprise avec une grande vision, un environnement de travail dynamique et une équipe de collègues intelligents, ambitieux et avec lesquels il est agréable de travailler !

 Nous sommes un employeur qui respecte l'égalité des chances et nous valorisons la diversité au sein de notre entreprise. Nous ne pratiquons aucune discrimination fondée sur la race, la religion, la couleur, l'origine nationale, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'âge, l'état civil, le statut de vétéran ou le statut de handicapé ou d'autres classes protégées.

Sonder is revolutionizing hospitality through innovative, tech-powered service and inspiring, thoughtfully designed accommodations combined into one seamlessly managed experience. Officially launched in 2014 and headquartered in San Francisco, Sonder is making a world of better stays open to all with a variety of accommodation options — from rooms to suites and apartments — found in more than 30 cities spanning eight countries and three continents. Sonder's innovative app empowers guests by making self-service features and 24/7 on-the-ground support just a tap away. From simple self check-in to boutique bathroom amenities, we bring the best of a hotel without any of the formality.
 As the Systems Analyst, NetSuite within the Business Systems team, you will work closely with business users in finance, procurement and other cross-functional teams, on various system initiatives and provide support throughout the project lifecycle. You will be the resident expert on NetSuite and the related applications ecosystem.
 AT SONDER YOU WILL:

Be a strong business partner and will be the point of contact on month end close, enhancements, and issue resolution for expense management, order-to-cash, record-to-report, and procure-to-pay.
Translate business requirements into well-architected solutions that best leverage NetSuite and the related applications ecosystem.
Participate in business design sessions; develop detailed business process solution documentation and recommend suitable architecture that is aligned with business objectives.
Assist with data analysis, reporting needs, continuous improvement initiatives, change management and support for optimal usage within NetSuite
Provide support during testing and document business process flow of new and existing solutions as needed, and provide support with data migration.
Collaborate with other members of the Sonder team and external partners to identify and deliver the best NetSuite solutions to our stakeholders.
Support NetSuite users with issues or service requests related to their day-to-day activities.

WHAT WE LOOK FOR:

Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer science, Accounting or Finance.
Minimum 3 years of working experience with some NetSuite functional experience. NetSuite certification & Knowledge of SuiteScript would be a plus.
Strong demonstrable NetSuite functional configuration knowledge. Experience with NetSuite integrations is a plus.
Good knowledge of general finance, revenue recognition, procurement, payment and tax. Must have experience in the payment processing module and experience with tax systems like Avalara, Vertex etc.
Understanding of Netsuite Table/Data Structure a plus
Experience in gathering business requirements, providing conceptual and detailed designs to meet business needs,writing detailed functional specifications for development of custom programs, testing and post go live support.
Must be able to build saved searches and customize reports in Netsuite.
Comfortable working with cross functional teams and with third parties.
Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to convey strategies, priorities, tradeoffs and engage with cross-functional teams through detailed technical specifications and/or wireframes.
High degree of self direction and independent drive.


 We also have great benefits to make your life easier so you can focus on what you're best at:

Competitive compensation 
Generous stock plan 
Medical, dental and vision insurance (where applicable) 
Flexible vacation 
Annual free credits and discounts to stay in Sonders 
A company with a huge vision, a dynamic work environment, and a team of smart, ambitious and fun to work-with colleagues! 
Workplace flexibility for remote positions #ABetterWaytoWork 

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status or other protected classes.

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence - BAU
Description:
Requisition ID: 156244  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Reporting to the Senior Manager, Business Intelligence, the Manager contributes to the overall success of Retail & Small Business in Caribbean, Central America & Uruguay (CCAU) by creating business reporting and collaborating with CCAU countries on data inputs required to develop and execute Business Strategies, Plans and Priority Initiatives in the Region by working with multiple stakeholders across International Banking. Analyze and evaluate business reporting from each country in CCAU to ensure data integrity and alignment of all information. They ensure all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

 Accountabilities:


 Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
 Generates and analyzes Retail & Small Business execution data and reports across countries to ensure integrity of cumulative CCAU retail data reports.
 Support the business leverage data and identify opportunities for improvement, detect trends, recognize potential issues, and offer solutions with the goal of improving efficiency, increasing productivity, and generating profit for the business.
 Requirement to combine data from different data sources (data marts, excel, among others) to integrate a combined CCAU level reporting in excel and Power BI format. SQL required
 Development, optimization, and implementation of data models according to business needs, for proper data management and reporting implementation, complying with the regulations established by IT Toronto, PIA Data Office and Global Analytics.
 Structures required executive reporting and works with multiple countries and stakeholders across the CCAU to develop, receive and deliver such reporting on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis.
 Collaborates with IB Consumer and Small Business and IB strategy stakeholders to ensure CCAU targets and reporting is aligned with their expectations and delivers such reporting to them on timely basis
 Manages strategic focus and execution maintaining with a clear understand of Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture to be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Ensure the levels of satisfaction of internal customers in relation to the requirements received (delivery time, quality of information, SLA, etc.)
 Development, optimization, and implementation of dynamic reports aligned with the self-service strategy, following the guidelines and best practices of the region.
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
 Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.


 Education and Experience:


 Engineering/Bachelor's degree in Computer Science / Data Science / Computer Science or related areas
 2+ years of experience in the financial sector.
 3+ years of experience with SQL, Oracle, SAS, solutions including implementation, setup, configuration, troubleshooting, tuning and infrastructure.
 3+ years of experience with data analysis and visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik)
 Advanced knowledge in using scripting and automation languages ( Python, R, Visual Basic, C#, JavaScript)
 Intermediate knowledge of use of productivity tools (JIRA/Confluence/Bitbucket)
 Advanced knowledge on Management of spreadsheets and desktop database (Excel, MS Access, SQLite)
 Strong written and verbal communication skills.
 Must be fully Bilingual in English and Spanish


 Please Note: This position is open to a local working location should you reside in the following region: Caribbean / Central America and Uruguay

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

 Incedo is a US-based consulting, data science and technology services firm with over 2,500 people helping clients from our six offices across US and India. We help our clients achieve competitive advantage through end-to-end digital transformation. Our uniqueness lies in bringing together strong engineering, data science, and design capabilities coupled with deep domain understanding. We combine services and products to maximize business impact for our clients in telecom, financial services, product engineering and life science & healthcare industries. 
Working at Incedo will provide you an opportunity to work with industry leading client organizations, deep technology and domain experts, and global teams.
