Title: ON - 2022 Customer Operations Graduate Leadership Program, BI Data Science & Developer Program
Description:
Req Id: 315372

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.
 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.

 Big data is a big deal. If you are passionate about transforming data into business value, this fast-growing, innovative field is where you want to be.

 Bell’s Business Intelligence team collaborates with partners across the organization and provides strategic guidance supported with data. We work with the latest and greatest BI technologies like SAS, Hadoop, and Python to leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.

 Our mandate is to provide actionable insights and enable Bell to use machine learning to drive business decisions and create solutions that directly enhance our products and services.

 This is a terrific opportunity for recent graduates or graduating students to help transform the organization in driving one of the most significant strategic mandates within Bell. As part of this team, you will have opportunities to work with new technologies, build project management skills and discover meaningful insights that will ultimately impact millions of customers.

 How the program works: Over the course of 12 months, the BI Data Science + Developer Program allows you the opportunity to enhance your professional skills and expand your knowledge of BI and new technologies through training opportunities, while working on exciting projects that include marketing optimization, fraud detection, and AI/Machine Learning.

 You will spend the first 2 months on the front lines gaining a 360° view of the customer experience while working on a special project to put your learnings towards improving the customer experience.

 From there, you will be assigned a permanent role in one of the following areas in BI based on your skills and interests:

 Data Engineering
 Software Development
 AI and Machine Learning


 Key Responsibilities:

 Leverage sophisticated analytical techniques including predictive modeling, text mining, forecasting, neural networks, segmentation and other data mining methods
 Explore large, new sources of data; communicate and present insight opportunities to business teams across the organization to influence decision making
 Translate business requirements into design, implementation and documentation of efficient BI processes
 Take part in defining and improving the overall architecture to create effective enterprise-level data solutions


 You should apply if:

 You are in your final year of your undergraduate degree or are a recent graduate with a Masters degree in:
   
 mathematics / statistics
 computer science / engineering
 software engineering
 or a related area

 Data engineering focus:
   
 Experience with programming languages such as Java, Scala, Python, C++
 Exposure to development tools such as version control systems and IDEs
 Proficiency working in Linux/Unix environment (eg. command line tools, shell scripting)
 Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks and tools (eg. Hadoop, Spark, HDFS, MapReduce, Hive)

 Development and production focus:
   
 Experience with the design, development and maintenance of ETL processes, data marts, operational data stores and online analytical processing (OLAP)
 Exposure to data warehouse technologies such as SQL Server, Teradata, SAS or others
 Knowledge of data modeling and architecture (Normalized and multidimensional)

 Machine learning focus:
   
 Knowledge of ML Algorithms including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning modules, and text analytics
 Experience with ML frameworks such as Spark ML, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, H2O, etc.
 Highly driven to learn about the newest machine learning techniques and to apply them to solve business problems
 Exposure to big data tools and technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark
 Experience with relational data warehouse and fluent in SQL
 Exposure to development tools such as version control systems and IDEs

 Experience in telecommunications is a plus
 You can work with a team as well as with business partners, to inform, influence, support and execute on decisions and strategies
 You have the ability to communicate quantitative results to a variety of audiences
 You are able to manage multiple projects and priorities
 Bilingualism (English and French) is an asset in Ontario and a requirement in Quebec


 Application Instructions:

 Apply on the Bell careers page.
 You must submit a resume and most recent transcripts (unofficial accepted) to be considered.
 Focus your efforts and apply to a maximum of 3 Bell postings that match your skills and interests.


 Top tip / Please note: We hire on a rolling basis. What does that mean? This means that applications are reviewed as they are received, and positions may be filled while this job ad is still live. What can you do about that? You can apply as early as possible to give yourself the best chance!

 Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

 Additional Information:
 Position Type: Management Job Status: Grad Hire Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Toronto Application Deadline: 07/20/2022

 Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

 At Bell, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities.

 Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions regarding accessible employment at Bell please email our Diversity & Inclusion Team at inclusion@bell.ca.

 Created: Canada, ON, Toronto

 Bell, one of Canada's Top 100 Employers.

Title: Information Risk & Compliance Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a motivated Information Risk and Compliance Analyst to join the dynamic Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics (DNA) team within OMERS' Data & Technology. DNA applies data, analytics and AI to develop scalable and appropriately governed solutions that drive sustainable growth at OMERS. 

 In this role, you will will develop and nurture strong relationships with key governance partners (including Risk, Compliance, Audit, Legal, Privacy, Cybersecurity) and OMERS business units to identify applicable laws, regulations and industry standards governing the handling of records and data. You will also develop, implement and maintain key processes and controls for complying with those requirements, such as data retention and disposition processes. In doing so, you will directly strengthen our compliance practices, manage risks to our organization and help optimize the ability of data to support a diverse array of global business functions. 


As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
 Understanding the function, location and ownership of records/data across the OMERS enterprise and updating inventories, metadata repositories and other tools necessary to enable an enterprise-wide retention and disposition program. 
Researching laws, rules and regulations impacting the records retention, including the duration, location and manner for keeping records across in legal jurisdictions from across the globe. 
Maintaining a network of business area representatives with accountability and ownership for records retention and disposition decision-making, as well as points of contact for records/data inquiries and issue resolution requests. 
Developing and maintain procedures and workflow processes necessary to support efficient, compliant management of records and data in line with best practices, laws and regulations. 
Working with information management and technology team members to implement a new Enterprise Data Retention Standard by applying retention categories and rules in electronic content management solutions and structured data systems. 
Coordinating a legally defensible data disposition program applicable to physical records, electronic documents and structured data. 
Apply record hold and discovery processes in response to litigation, claims, audits, investigations, personal information access requests and other legal proceedings. 
Developing and implementing an Enterprise Archives program , including establishment of archival selection criteria for physical records, electronic content and structured data. 
Drive a culture of compliance, risk management and innovation by delivering records and data-related training, awareness and enablement programs. 


To succeed in this role, you have:
 Degree or diploma in Archives, Information Studies, Library and Information Science, Law, Compliance or Policy Management AND/OR relevant professional certification, such as Certified Records Manager (CRM), Certified Records Analyst (CRA) or Information Governance Professional (IGP). 
3-5 years experience developing and implementing records/data retention, disposition and archival preservation controls. 
Solid grasp of records/data retention, disposition, legal holds, archival preservation, content management systems and information governance standards and best practices. 
Experience identifying and assessing legal/regulatory requirements impacting the handling of records and data. 
Experience using and applying data and information governance controls to electronic systems, such as structured databases, electronic records management systems and content management systems. 
Ability to build relationships and facilitate discussion across a diverse group of stakeholders from different business units. 
Demonstrated experience in project and time management. 
Advanced analytical skills, including the ability to interpret and apply complex legal language, industry standards and policy statements. 
Polished written communication and dynamic presentation skills targeted at all levels of the organization. 
Experience automating or enhancing records and data management processes through the use of technology is an asset. 
Experience working in the finance, pensions, investments or commercial real estate sectors is an asset. 


Our story:
 Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

 OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

 Vaccination Policy 

 At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Title: Lead Analyst, Data Risk Management
Description:
Overview 

 At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions. 

 Risk Analytics @ Neo 

 Neo’s Risk Analytics team works hard to enable a high growth portfolio with sound risk management principles while optimizing credit decisioning across the customer lifecycle. This team of high-performers leads the development and implementation of key credit risk strategies to effectively manage the lending portfolio inline with our business objectives. 

 We’re looking for an experienced data leader with a keen interest in building a risk data function to join us as a full-time Lead Analyst, Data Risk Management in our Calgary headquarters. In this role, you’ll manage a team of high-performing analytics professionals to build, run and maintain data pipelines and data services that solve complex business challenges in the Risk Analytics domain. You will collaborate with our risk analysts and data scientists to improve data transparency and to enable better decision-making processes. 


What you'll be doing:
 Design, develop and deliver a risk analytics data strategy, enabling advanced data-driven credit decisioning Working closely with our Data team, define and govern data modeling and design standards, tools, best practices related to data modeling Utilize large volumes of data in order to extract and manipulate large datasets using standard tools such as SQL and Python; leverage large-scale data processing tools such as Apache Spark Propose, design and engineer solutions and improvements to data technologies finding ways to automate, optimize and scale processes Design, implement, and test advanced data solutions to equip risk analysts with appropriate data to develop sound credit strategies Build and maintain dashboards, and metrics to ensure successful monitoring of live data, features and models; utilize BI tools such as Looker or Tableau Lead and support various ad hoc projects, as needed 


Who we're looking for:
 You bring 5+ years in practical work experience in the data management with a familiarity in big data platforms such as Apache Spark or similar You bring 3+ years of experience in leading risk management teams You have experience in data warehouses, design and development You bring advanced programming skills in languages such as Python, SQL, Javascript You have a post-Secondary education in a quantitative field preferred (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science, etc) You are data-driven; eager to understand the numbers and provide meaningful insights 


What will help you succeed:
 You have strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt communication to different audiences You think strategically with the ability to see the big picture may be affected by risk strategies You’re self-organized with the ability to operate independently and prioritize effectively You’re a self-starter who is highly focused and driven to achieve business objectives You take a collaborative approach and with the ability to engage purposely with stakeholders You have experience in a fast-paced environment where competing priorities, uncertain outcomes and iteration is the norm 


About applying with us:
 At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future. 

 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Senior Tax Analyst, Indirect Tax
Description:
Location: TORONTO, Ontario, Canada 
   

Category: Finance
   



Job Opened: July 6th, 2022 
   

Education: Bachelor's Degree 
   



Job Number: 220003HE 
   

Job Type: Full-Time
   



Remote: No 
   



job description
 Day In The Life:
Reporting to the Senior Manager of Indirect Tax, the Senior Tax Analyst will support the day-to-day operations of the Indirect Tax function. You will assist in tax compliance, tax audits, special projects and provide expert advice to business units to manage the Indirect Tax function within the organization effectively. The successful candidate must possess excellent analytical and interpersonal skills to work independently and with the tax team in a complex environment with a confident, hands-on approach.
What You Will Do:

Oversee monthly GST/HST, QST, and PST returns preparation and month-end closing activities.
Perform product taxability review, data analysis, and system testing.
Support continuous process improvements and maintenance of internal controls along with documentation for indirect tax functions.
Assist with research and ad-hoc projects.
Collaborate with other business units to address indirect tax queries.
Identify tax legislative and administrative changes that may impact business activities and procedures.
Prepare responses to Federal and Provincial sales tax audit queries.

What You Will Need:

Strong written and oral communication skills
Outstanding accounting, analytical, and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
A team player who is organized and works well under pressure
Flexible, resilient, and able to thrive in a dynamic, rapid-paced environment
Deep personal accountability for the work assigned, with a passion for excellence
Strong business acumen with the ability to quickly assess a new environment and develop solutions that support the business strategy
Creative with a strategic mindset along with the ability to turn concepts into action 
University or College degree in Finance-related discipline preferred 
2+ years of relevant experience in Canadian Indirect Tax 
Excellent IT skills/aptitude, including excel/access to formulate reports for Indirect Tax analytics
Hands-on experience working with MS Power Query, MS Power BI, or SQL would be an asset

What You Can Expect:

A People-first culture where One Team spirit and Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are celebrated and promoted at every step of the way
An opportunity to work with highly supportive teams to help you build the career you want and leave your Stripe at The Bay
A competitive benefits package including unlimited paid vacation, medical, dental, vision, parental leave top up coverages, retirement savings and more
A ways of Working Program that enables you to work where you are most effective
A living Well Program that provides a variety of offerings and resources to enhance your physical, mental, and financial wellness, including corporate gym membership rates.
An amazing associate discount of up to 40% off top brands


 
About HBC:
HBC is a holding company of investments and businesses at the intersection of technology, retail operations and real estate.
It is the majority owner of iconic ecommerce companies: Saks, a leading online destination for luxury fashion, and Saks OFF 5TH, a premier luxury off-price ecommerce company offering top brands at the best prices. Both businesses were established as separate operating companies in 2021. HBC also wholly owns Hudson’s Bay, Canada’s preeminent multi-category retailer, as well as SFA, the entity that operates Saks Fifth Avenue’s physical locations, and O5, the operating company for Saks OFF 5TH stores.7
With assets spanning top markets and prime locations across North America, HBC owns or controls — either entirely or with joint venture partners — approximately 40 million square feet of gross leasable area. HBC Properties and Investments, the company’s real estate and investments portfolio business, manages these assets along with additional real estate offerings, including Streetworks Development, its property development division.
Founded in 1670, HBC is North America’s longest continually operating company and is headquartered in New York and Toronto.


Interested in Social Media?
Follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram


NOTE: Only applications submitted online will be accepted.
 Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

 HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

 HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

Title: Analyste des systèmes d'affaires - NFN / Business System Analyst - NFN
Description:
Chez Parkland, notre objectif est de promouvoir Journie et stimuler les communautés. Nous sommes un fournisseur et un distributeur indépendant de carburant et de produits pétroliers, ainsi qu'un important exploitant de dépanneurs. En tant qu’une seule équipe Parkland, nous sommes fiers de servir divers clients détaillants, commerciaux et grossistes à travers le Canada, les États-Unis, la région des Caraïbes et l’Amérique du Sud. Nous alimentons une famille croissante de marques connues localement, dont M&M Food Market, Fas Gas Plus, Pioneer, RaceTrac, Superpumper, Esso, ON the RUN, Ultramar, Bluewave Energy, Pipeline, Chevron, Columbia Fuels, Island Petroleum et Sparlings Propane.
 Nous reconnaissons que la diversité nous donne un avantage et que l'inclusion nous fait avancer. Nous sommes également une équipe passionnée, composée de personnes qui ont les pieds sur terre et qui s'engagent à amener nos clients, nos collègues et nos communautés plus loin, plus rapidement. C'est pourquoi nous accueillons des personnes talentueuses ayant des perspectives, un bagage et une expérience, qui contribueront au succès de l'équipe de Parkland.
 Titre du poste: Analyste des systèmes d'affaires - NFN
 Équipe et emplacement: TI – Calgary, AB ou Montréal, QC
 Résumé du poste:
 NFN est l'acronyme de « National Fueling Network ». Il s'agit d'un programme offert par Parkland pour consolider les offres de cartes multiples pour nos clients de parcs de véhicules commerciaux et de détail à travers le Canada. Cela permettra à nos clients de faire le plein avec une seule carte dans différentes stations de marque Parkland et de recevoir une seule facture.

 En utilisant la plateforme WEX, les clients utiliseront une carte de marque NFN pour leurs besoins en carburant dans les stations acceptées. Les transactions seront enregistrées par WEX et transmises à Parkland pour traitement. Les ventes et la facturation seront gérées sur le système ERP JD Edwards de Parkland et seront renvoyées à WEX pour que les clients puissent les consulter sur leur portail eManager.

 L'analyste des systèmes d'affaires - NFN devra :

 Tirer parti des processus d'affaires et des compétences techniques pour combler les lacunes de communication entre l'entreprise, le développement et les autres équipes.
 Analyser les besoins des utilisateurs, développer des histoires d'utilisateurs et des critères d'acceptation pour les satisfaire.
 Travailler sur le backlog du produit, en s'assurant qu'il est visible, transparent et clair pour tous.
 Se concentrer sur les mesures de niveau de service et les indicateurs de performance clés pour atteindre / dépasser les objectifs.
 Collaborer avec les équipes pour identifier et atténuer les risques et résoudre les problèmes techniques.
 Gérer les interdépendances des fonctionnalités avec les autres équipes de développement et les équipes commerciales/opérationnelles.
 Travailler activement avec les étapes de développement, les sprints et les histoires. Identifier et organiser les étapes de la prochaine itération.
 Agir en tant que point de contact unique pour l'évaluation des problèmes liés au NFN.

 Principales responsabilités:
 Support

 Évaluation / triage des problèmes liés au NFP

 Analyse commerciale

 Rencontrer les parties prenantes (c.-à-d. les utilisateurs finaux, les opérations, les vendeurs) pour connaître les besoins.
 Création d'histoires d'utilisateurs, travail avec les parties prenantes sur les cycles de sprint.

 Conception, coordination et planification des tests d'AQ

 Création de cas de test, de scénarios, mise à jour des scripts de test.
 Coordination des tests pour les mises à jour et les améliorations.

 Documentation et rapports :

 Mise à jour des flux de travail pour s'assurer que la documentation est à jour.
 Création de la documentation de soutien.
 Conception et analyse de rapports.
 Rapport sur chaque cycle de sprint.

 Qualifications et compétences:

 Diplôme en systèmes d'information ou expérience équivalente.
 Certification IIBA (CBAP) un atout.
 Bonne compréhension du SDLC et du concept SaaS.
 Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience dans les domaines suivants :
   
 Analyse commerciale
 Gestion de projet
 Conception de tests d'AQ

 Connaissance des outils de conception de processus (par exemple : MS Visio, Lucid chart, Draw.io) .
 Maîtrise des outils d'analyse de données, notamment Power BI, Tableau, SQL et DAS.
 Connaissance des données.
 Solide compréhension des systèmes ERP et de leurs intégrations (les modules Finance, Approvisionnement, Prix sont un atout).
 La connaissance de JD Edwards est un atout.
 Capacité à établir des priorités de manière efficace et à gérer des tâches multiples.
 Excellent sens de l'organisation.
 Aptitudes à l'innovation, notamment curiosité, agilité et stratégie.
 Approche axée sur les résultats.
 Connaissance exceptionnelle des principes de conception centrée sur l'utilisateur.
 Maîtrise de la communication orale et écrite, capable de communiquer avec les utilisateurs informatiques et commerciaux.
 Capacité à collaborer avec de grandes équipes.
 Excellentes compétences techniques, de diagnostic et de dépannage.
 Compréhension des normes de qualité de conception.
 Connaissance des systèmes de point de vente et du processus de ravitaillement en carburant.
 Excellentes compétences en matière de service à la clientèle, capacité à faire preuve d'empathie et de professionnalisme.
 Capacité à avoir une vue d'ensemble.

 Ce que nous offrons: 

Notre plan d'incitation annuel basé sur les performances, une prime annuelle récompensant vos performances.
 Une part de notre succès, grâce au régime d’achat d’actions des employés et à une contribution équivalente offerte par l’entreprise.
 La participation à Parkland Pledge, un programme de don caritatif mené par les employés.
 Des forfaits médicaux et dentaires flexibles, un compte de gestion de frais de santé et un programme d’aide aux employés et à leur famille.
 Une opportunité d'apprentissage et de développement de carrière, une formation en leadership et des opportunités internationales.
 Un programme de recommandation d’employés : obtenez jusqu’à 2 000 $ pour votre recommandation.
 L'emphase sur un mode de vie sain grâce à des initiatives de bien-être et à un programme annuel de remboursement des frais de conditionnement physique.
 Des rabais et des programmes de bourses d'études pour les membres de la famille.
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la sécurité et une formation continue à la sécurité.

 Veuillez noter:

 Les candidats doivent être légalement en mesure de travailler au Canada en ce moment. Parkland regrette de ne pas pouvoir parrainer les demandeurs de visas d’emploi.
 Corporation Parkland s’engage à appliquer les principes de l’équité en matière d’emploi. Veuillez noter que l’emploi du masculin a pour seul but d’alléger le texte.  At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including M&M Food Market, Fas Gas Plus, Pioneer, RaceTrac, Superpumper, Ultramar, Chevron, Esso, and ON the RUN.
 We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team.
 Position Title: Business System Analyst - NFN
 Team and Location: IT – Calgary, AB or Montreal, QC
 Position Summary:
 NFN stands for National Fueling Network. It is a program offered by Parkland to consolidate multiple card offerings for our commercial cardlock and retail fleet customers across Canada. This will allow our customers to fuel using one card at different Parkland brand stations and receive one invoice.
 Using the WEX platform, customers will use an NFN branded card for their fueling needs at accepting locations. Transactions will be recorded by WEX and passed to Parkland for processing. The sales and invoicing will be managed on the Parkland JD Edwards ERP system and will be passed back to WEX for customers to view on their eManager portal.

 The Business System Analyst– NFN will:

 Leverage Business process and technical skills to close communication gaps between business, Development, and other teams.
 Analyze user needs, develop user stories and acceptance criteria to meet them
 Work on the product backlog, ensuring that it is visible, transparent, and clear to all
 Focus on Service Level metrics and Key Performance indicators to meet / exceed targets
 Collaborate with teams to identify and mitigate risks and to fix technical problems
 Manage feature inter-dependencies with other development and Business/Operations teams.
 Actively work with development stages, Sprints, and stories. Identify and organize the steps for the next iteration.
 Act as a single point of contact for assessing NFN related issues

 Key Responsibilities:
 Support

 Assessing / Triaging NFN issues

 Business Analysis

 Meeting with stake holders (i.e. End users, Operations, Vendors) for requirements
 Creating user stories, work with stake holders on Sprint cycles.

 QA Test Design, Coordination and Planning

 Creating Test Cases, Scenarios, Updating Test Scripts
 Coordinating testing for updates and enhancements

 Documentation and Reporting:

 Updating workflows to ensure documentation is up to date
 Creating support documentation
 Report Design and analysis
 Report on each sprint cycle.

 Qualifications and Skills:

 Degree in Information Systems or equivalent experience
 IIBA (CBAP) certification an asset
 Good understanding of SDLC and SaaS concept
 Minimum of 5 years' experience in the following areas:
   
 Business Analysis
 Project Management
 QA test design

 Knowledge of Process design tools (i.e.: MS Visio, Lucid chart, Draw.io)
 Proficiency in the use of Data analytic tools including Power BI, Tableau, SQL, and DAS
 Data literacy
 Solid understanding of ERP Systems and integrations (Finance, Supply, Pricing modules an asset)
 Knowledge of JD Edwards is an asset.
 Ability to prioritize effectively and manage multiple tasks
 Excellent organization skills
 Innovative skills including Curiosity, Agility, Strategic
 Outcome-focused approach
 Exceptional knowledge of user-centered design principles
 Proficient in both oral and written communication, able to communicate to both IT and Business users
 Ability to collaborate with large teams
 Excellent technical, diagnostic, and troubleshooting skills
 Understanding of design quality standards
 Knowledge of POS systems and fueling process nice to have
 Excellent customer service skills, ability to show empathy and professionalism
 Proficiency in being able to see the bigger picture

 We Offer:

 Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.
 A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching.
 A flexible group benefit plan that offers health and dental coverage choices to meet the needs of each unique employee. Inclusive of life and disability insurances, Health Care and Lifestyle Spending options, and a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.
 Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.
 An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral.
 In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.
 Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.
 A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.

 Please note:

 Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.

Title: Analyst, Integrated Business Planning
Description:
At Saputo, our best comes from our people. We’re a talented and caring team with a longstanding history of excellence. Since our first days delivering cheese on a bicycle, we’ve grown into a leading global dairy processor by staying true to the culture that defines us. Each of our employees is committed to uphold our tradition of care, quality, and passion through food, and together, we foster an environment where we can all make contributions that matter–from our manufacturing plants to our office locations and everywhere in-between.
 


   Overview of the Role
 

   As an IBP Analyst, you will support the Manager, IBP in tasks related to the execution of the Saputo Canada IBP process.
 


   How you will make contributions that matter:
 



     Assist and support the monthly IBP process
   


     Maintain the IBP master data, aggregate to an appropriately high level to help support the determination of what to present at the Executive IBP meeting
   


     Track key metrics for the IBP team to monitor the effectiveness of process decisions. Report metrics back to IBP process owner and the team to identify progress, root causes for correction or process improvement
   


     Track decisions made from the meeting to ensure they are executed in each function/department/team. Work with IBP Manager to escalate items if required
   


     Effectively gather datasets from multiple sources and interpret data into actionable insights by leveraging advanced statistical models
   


     Prepare scenarios and conduct what-if analysis to create alternate scenarios for reconciling demand, supply and financial plans
   


     Support continuous improvement initiatives and challenges with the process
   


     Maintain helpful and positive communication style working with cross functional teams within Saputo
   


     Supports and maintains Saputo Dairy Products Canada G.P.’s quality standards
   



   You are best suited for the role if you have the following qualifications:
 



     Bachelor’s degree in Business, Operations Management or related quantitative degree
   


     1-3 years experience working knowledge in Retail, Manufacturing, CPG and Food Service environments preferred
   


     Experience working in the Sales and Operations environment would be an asset
   


     Advanced working knowledge of MS Office, database, data visualization and software such as RStudios, Python and Tableau is an asset
   


     Strong attention to detail and accuracy
   


     Excellent organization and time-management skills
   


     Solid business acumen and communication skills, both written and verbal
   


     Ability to present insights in a clear, coherent and compelling format
   


     Ability to work in a cross-functional team environment
   



   We support and care for our employees and their families by providing:
 



     Competitive salaries
   


     Advantageous corporate agreements
   


     Full range of group insurance benefits
   


     Group retirement pension plan with employer contribution
   


     Purchase option of company stocks
   


     Group RRSP
   


     Health and wellness program in the workplace
   


     Assistance program for employees and their families
   


     Saputo products at a discounted price
   



   Saputo welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations up to the point of undue hardships, are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We support employment equity. Saputo strives to embed diversity and inclusion in its operations and invites candidates from all horizons to join its family.
 


   Our story began in Canada in 1954, when the Saputo family's hard work and dedication created a thriving dairy business. More than 65 years later, our roots in this country remain strong with our Corporate Headquarters in Montréal. Today, we are a leading cheese manufacturer and fluid milk and cream processor in Canada with well-loved brands, such as Saputo, Alexis de Portneuf, Armstrong, Baxter, Dairyland, Joyya, Milk2Go, Milk2Go Sport, Neilson, Nutrilait, Scotsburn* and Woolwich Goat Dairy. Thanks to our national footprint, we're proud to bring our best to our customers and consumers, and have plenty of opportunities for our employees to grow in their own way. And we do it while also striving to build a healthier future for our people and the communities where we operate, guided by our values and the Saputo Promise.
 


   Join the Saputo Dairy Products Canada team to make your contributions matter every day!

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Loyalty/CRM/Clientelling/CDP
Description:
Location: TORONTO, Ontario, Canada 
   

Category: The Bay Technology
   



Job Opened: July 11th, 2022 
   

Education: Bachelor's Degree 
   



Job Number: 220003DU 
   

Job Type: Full-Time
   



Remote: Yes 
   



job description
 Day In The Life:
As a Business System Analyst for Loyalty, CRM, Clientelling & CDP, you will focus on gathering and documenting business requirements for the Loyalty/CRM/Clienteling team. You will engage business and IT stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze, document and validate system requirements that meet business needs. Working with a solution architect, and other business analysts, developers, and engineers from cross-functional teams, you will leverage an analytical approach to understand the current business process, perform gap analysis, assess options, and propose the solution design, using Agile methodology.
The successful candidate will analyze the business requirements for the Project and Convert them into Business Rules, Business Processes, Activity diagrams, use-case, detailed Technical requirements, and system goals and pass it to cross-functional and relevant teams like OMS, POS, Data, Middleware etc. This individual will also act as liaison between product business owners and technical staff. They will have led multiple projects through scope/discovery, estimation, development, implementation, and post deployment support with the ability to influence solution design.


What You Will Do:

Perform application system analysis, prepare data flow diagrams and design screen/report layouts as part of business systems solution/application design
Responsible for solving complex business issues, which requires critical thinking and thinking outside the box
Documents all processes, changes, and solutions
Develop, coordinate, execute and perform in-depth tests, including system, unit testing, and functional testing
Communicate in weekly/biweekly status, showing progress against outstanding milestones., status, issues, risks and dependencies
Manage day to day Change Requests
Administer and participate in system integration and supports acceptance testing
Assist project team in presenting an application/solution Context to IT & User interface teams
Assist users in developing conversion and implementation procedures
Assist project team in presenting an application/solution Context to IT & User interface team
Assist users in developing conversion and implementation procedures
Develop systems context with Integration/ Technical Developers
Analytical approach and techniques used to understand business problem/requirement and propose recommended solutions
Develop a clearly defined and agreed upon project functional and non-functional requirements and translate business requirements to technical specifications for development
Work with Project Managers and Developers to define project scope and objectives based on business needs and industry standard
Balancing user community needs/requirements with project schedule and IT resources available to determine system design


 
What You Will Need:

4 year college degree /university
Have considerable experience in Loyalty, CRM, CDP in E-commerce / Retail Set-up
QA testing experience required
Experience leading meetings and gathering requirements
Strong oral/written communication skills
Strong analytical/organizational skills
Time management when involved in multiple projects of complex nature
Functional expertise - Customer Selling Channels - POS Retail, POS Banking, Pricing, Promotional/Loyalty program
Omni Channel * Mobile - Customer experience exposure
Working Knowledge of SQL, UML, Databases, Digital systems and a good understanding of IT practices and methodologies
MS Office - PM, Visio, PowerPoint
Test Tools (Exposure)
Retail – POS, Payments, Pricing, Loyalty - store systems
Planning and estimating techniques
Strong System Analysis Skills - Functional



What You Can Expect:

A People-first culture where One Team spirit and Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are celebrated and promoted at every step of the way
An opportunity to work with highly supportive teams to help you build the career you want and leave your Stripe at The Bay
A competitive benefits package including unlimited paid vacation, medical, dental, vision, parental leave top up coverages, retirement savings and more
A ways of Working Program that enables you to work where you are most effective
A living Well Program that provides a variety of offerings and resources to enhance your physical, mental, and financial wellness, including corporate gym membership rates.
An amazing associate discount of up to 40% off top brands


 
About The Bay:
As Canada’s oldest startup, The Bay is a digital-first, purpose-led retailer. Our mission is to help Canadians live their best style of life. 
The Bay is on a high-growth trajectory to become one of the largest digital retail businesses in Canada through TheBay.com and its Marketplace. If you are looking to join an iconic brand, create impactful change and be recognized for your work, we want you to join our team. 
At The Bay, smart, high-performing team members will challenge you to learn and grow every day. We value ambitious work and great ideas grounded in data and insights. We are looking for talented people who love a fast-paced environment, embrace change and are looking to make an impact with groundbreaking ideas.
We are a digital-first company and brand for a diverse world and we need a diverse team to reach our potential. Come and join a winning team that supports collaboration and demonstrates innovation, energy, creativity and vision every day.


Interested in Social Media?
Follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram


NOTE: Only applications submitted online will be accepted.
The Bay welcomes all applicants for this position; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 Thank you for your interest In The Bay. We look forward to reviewing your application.
