Title: Compensation Analyst
Description:
Transform the way the world runs networks  The Opportunity
 The Compensation Analyst is a key member of Sandvine’s Global Human Resources function.
 The Analyst will take a lead role in the design, development, and administration of base salary, variable compensation, and incentive compensation programs. The Analyst is responsible for administering monthly, quarterly and annual incentive plans.
 Key responsibilities include maintenance and accuracy of employee compensation data, conducting market research, compensation program design and administration (including broad-based, short- and long-term compensation), key project participation and tasks related to these processes.
 The Job

 Perform job evaluations and analysis of jobs, compensation benchmarking, data collection, base salaries and incentives to evaluate internal equity, external competitiveness, and legal compliance of global pay practices.
 Reviews and analyzes job duties to determine scope of work including assessing and evaluating jobs to determine grade, classification, and market value for new positions, as well as requests for compensation increase, structure, grade and title changes.
 Provides analysis and counsel to management on compensation programs and initiatives related to pay structures, short term incentives, pay change recommendations, new hire offers, and wage and hour regulations.
 Continually evaluate for and implement process efficiencies
 Examine compensation trends and develop recommendations supporting business initiatives
 Assists in the development and implementation of salary administration, compensation policies, and variable pay plans (e.g., merit, annual incentives, bonuses, awards, sales commission, etc.) for salary administration including policy review and pay structure development.
 Assists with annual merit increases and other similar projects by working collaboratively with HRIS, Payroll, and cross functional teams to ensure project goals are achieved.
 Compiles salary survey submission files, performs global job matching, responsible for market pay system maintenance and administration, ensuring accurate market data and internal data validation. Responsible for auditing data on a regular basis.
 Acts as a main contact for day-to-day compensation matters, including monitoring and answering queries to a functional email inbox.
 Maintains and updates job description library and job data in appropriate HR systems for new Company roles and changes to existing roles, ensuring consistency among functions.
 Maintains HR data tools integrity by ensuring the accurate and consistent input of data. Performs regular audits and addresses data concerns.
 Coordinates and assists with human resource projects, programs, and special assignments.
 Ensures the confidentiality of sensitive information.
 Develop, analyze and maintain complex Excel reports to support data analysis

 What Skills You Bring

 2 to 4 years of previous experience with compensation function at a global company preferred.
 Experience utilizing compensation theory, principles, and practices to perform independent analysis of programs using market data
 Must have advanced level Microsoft Excel skills
 Above average analytical skills, especially in other MS Office suite products
 Proficiency in HRIS systems preferably with Ultipro
 Strong data mining and quantitative analysis skills
 Must have strong quantitative, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with ability to research and analyze various types of data.
 Excellent verbal, written communication skills, presentation, and facilitation skills as well as interpersonal and consultative skills
 Ability to use good judgment, be discreet and highly trustworthy, and demonstrate ethical conduct.

 Education

 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Human Resources or equivalent field from an accredited college or university.
 Certifications in compensation, general HR practice or related fields preferred, especially from associations such as SHRM, World @ Work, or similar.

 About Sandvine  Networks are evolving, and operators need to keep up. At Sandvine, we’re working with innovative customers who are looking to embrace change and constantly improve. By combining analytics, machine learning, and automation, we help hundreds of network operators around the world make their networks run simpler and smarter – all while exceeding their expectations. As a Sandviner, you will take on new challenges, learn from industry leaders, and contribute to creative solutions as part of a growing team that is transforming the way the world runs networks.  What Can You Expect From Us

 Competitive compensation plan
 Flexible working hours – in some roles work from home
 Employee development including training programs and mentorship
 Career development and advancement opportunities
 International travel opportunities - we are a global company.



 Thank-you for your interest in Sandvine. While we’re not able to reach out to everyone who applies, we will contact you if your skills and experience are a match for the role. Otherwise, we’ll keep your resume in case there is a match with future opportunities.
   In the meantime, if you want to learn more about life at Sandvine, follow us on Twitter (@Sandvine) and Facebook (Facebook.com/Sandvine).
   Sandvine is committed to supporting a culture of inclusion, diversity and accessibility to employment for all. We are proud to operate as an equal opportunity employer.
  


The Sandvine Global Talent Acquisition Team

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence Solutions - Spanish
Description:
Requisition ID: 154271  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose:
 The purpose of this job is to provide added value to the global team and local operations by supporting and leading reporting and data driven solutions and teams focused on optimizing and improving Business Intelligence (BI) capabilities for Collections. The incumbent will work & collaborate with Divisional and local counterparts in Canada, LATAM and Caribbean regions to set these initiatives in motion and drive their benefits. The incumbent will be under the guidance & supervision of the Sr. Manager Business Intelligence.

 Accountabilities:


 Supports a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.



Relationship management with internal and external stakeholders across Divisional and local counterparts in Canada, LATAM, and Caribbean regions to ensure all data processes and reports meet business needs.
Lead reports and low-code applications solutions teams, providing guidance on best practices for development, training, and soft skills development.
Responsible for creating Business Intelligence Applications, reports, and insights to continuously improve the control posture within Global Collections, focusing on visualizations to “story-tell” but supplement with the underlying actionable details.
Stays up to date with the latest technology trends regarding Data Services and Business Intelligence to drive innovation, accomplishing business goals, and remaining competitive.
Accountable for supporting BI development, coding, analysis, design, and implementation activities including:
Leverage various data repositories and tooling to produce timely and impactful reports and metrics that measure the productivity, efficiency, and risk posture within Global Collections
Lead maintenance of data sources, data models, production jobs and documentation related to Business Intelligence processes
Lead the design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve current reports, dashboards, KPI scorecards, and low-code applications using MS Power Platform suite
Work/hands-on experience in building complex SQL Queries using MS SQL
Analyze, design, develop dashboards, views, data models, DAX measures, documentation for reporting and analytics in Power BI
Identify opportunities to complement data presented in reports with low-code applications and/or automation tools and develop solutions using Power Platform
Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in the Reporting Packages and Dashboards
Design and create predictive models, analytic models, scoring models among any other model required to support the business
Provide and present insights of data from existing data sets and/or from new analytics modelling with value to the business
Partner with local operations to implement the Global Collections Analytics and reporting framework across the Bank’s footprint resulting in state-of-the-art reporting and self-service analytics capabilities
Collaborate with data team members to automate, optimize, improve, and augment data services / capabilities
Work with business partners, business lines to document and developing collections operations data models and analytics for senior management reporting
Lead modeling of existing and new data to provide insights and business recommendations from the Business Intelligence and Reporting perspective
Enhance report and data capabilities by leveraging data-oriented technologies such as Microsoft Power Platform
Query, analyze and process ‘big data’ to provide reports, summarize and visualize data
Develop tabular and multidimensional models that are compatible with warehouse standards
Communicate effectively with divisional and local teams across the Bank
Collaborate with Business partners, business lines to bring relevant data for analytics purposes, document, and support integration of data to current date models.
Demonstrated ownership for their personal development.


 Education / Experience:


 Bachelor’s / Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field is preferred
Proficient in PowerBI, Tableau, Power Platform, and/or any other relevant Business Intelligence Platform. 5+ years’ experience
Strong knowledge in writing complex DAX, SQL statements, and VBA scripts
Proficient in SQL2008/2012/2014//2017/2019 (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, PL/SQL, T-SQL queries, stored procedures, functions, cursors, user defined functions, triggers, index, view). 5+ years’ experience
Ability to troubleshoot queries, suggest indexes or design modifications, and help to incorporate best practices of database design
Working knowledge and/or understanding of Microsoft Power Platform and Sharepoint. Power Platform Fundamentals Certification is a plus.
Experience with Microsoft Azure Databricks OR Databricks
Experience in Online Transactional Processing (OLTP) databases and Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) databases
Experience with designs and implementation of ETL (Extract, transform, load) components to load data from disparate source systems using SQL Server and Microsoft BI tools
Skills for tools such as Microsoft Azure, SQL data warehouse, PolyBase, Visual Studio, etc.
Strong problem solving, learning agility, and logical thinking skills
Writing skills in documenting user requirements and liaise well with counterparts or divisions to address the matter at hand.
Business acumen and organizational awareness
“Never stop learning” attitude, open to new information, inventive approaches, and progressive techniques
Knowledge of Big data, Hadoop, Hive, SAS is a plus
Customer focus. Able to work with counterparts in Canada, Latin America, and Caribbean
Written and verbal communication in Spanish is a must.



 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Variable Compensation Analyst
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

 OVERVIEW
 The Variable Compensation (VC) team is a value-added customer service driven department committed to providing relevant, accurate and timely variable compensation information, guidance, and training. The VC team’s primary goal is to pay plan participants the right amount at the right time while ensuring compliance with plan provisions and company policies. The VC team collaborates with their partners in HR, Finance and the business to produce innovative and scalable variable compensation solutions that support future growth. They contribute to the plan design process and manage the applicable systems and processes to ensure that the agreed outcome can be executed and administered effectively and efficiently.
 
The Opportunity
 The Variable Compensation Analyst will be assisting the Finance and Variable Compensation teams in the accurate calculation, preparation, and communication of variable compensation/performance results for worldwide business units. Reporting to the Manager, Variable Compensation, this person will be responsible for performing variable compensation calculations and analysis of variable compensation accounts. The Variable Compensation Analyst may be called upon to work on special projects throughout the year and will contribute to the overall team success by participating in the High-Performance Team model (HPT).

 What you will do: 

Preparation and submission of monthly incentives and bonus calculation files
 Data analysis, audits, and review of system setups
 Provide triage support for the shared inquiry mailbox 
Respond to inquiries from plan participants and business stakeholders with focus on excellent customer service
 Perform staff activities including administrative tasks as assigned
 Work on special projects such as process improvements, data analysis/compilation, presentations, report building 
Perform in a challenging and extremely fast-paced environment, while being able to change direction when circumstances change


 Skills and Knowledge:

 **New grads welcome**
 BA or BS Degree in accounting, economics, finance, mathematics, science, statistics, or other quantitative subjects 
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (Advanced), Salesforce.com and technically savvy in other data systems an asset
 Excellent communication and organizational skills, and the ability to collaborate with a variety of people and job functions 
High attention to detail, a commitment to quality and a results-driven and customer focused mindset 
Ability to work independently and as a team player to achieve goals and tight deadlines while managing cross functional responsibilities and not sacrificing quality/integrity
 Self-starter who will take the initiative to learn the various processes from start to finish


 OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com

 Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: NA
Description: NA

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
AMA: 
  YOU’VE never MET A PROBLEM YOU COULDN’T SOLVE.


 Posted: 2022-07-11


 Closing: Until Filled

Location: Bridgewater Bank, Calgary (hybrid)


 ABOUT YOU

 The word “problem” isn’t even in your vocabulary. You prefer to think of it as a challenge waiting for you to work your analytical magic. In fact, you don’t know if you’ve ever met a problem because you only meet opportunities. You love the thought of turning ideas into real applications. You’re always on the hunt for innovative new technologies that can help people work smarter not just faster. You have a knack for data and details, without losing sight of the big picture. You’ve got the skills to coordinate a project from start to finish; you work well with a broad group of people; and you communicate clearly every step of the way.

 WHO IS BRIDGEWATER BANK?
 Unlike a traditional bank, we have no branches. This means less time managing logistics and more time focussed on you and our ‘why’ – helping you succeed. Our focus is providing honest, straightforward service and financial solutions for everyday living and important life events.
 We’re financial service experts with flexible mindsets. Being a smaller bank makes us nimble, and that means we can respond quickly with innovative approaches that don’t need to go through multiple levels of approvals.
 Our customers are everything. When you become a customer of Bridgewater Bank you’re like our neighbour – even family – and we treat you that way.

 WHAT MOVES YOU

 You have a knack for finding simple solutions to complicated problems and explaining them in a way that helps others see the possibilities too.
 You’re hyper organized – there’s no clutter in your workspace or in your brain, and you can handle even the tightest deadlines with a cool head and clear vision.
 You like making things betters – it’s why you constantly try to improve the way things are done.
 You’re the MacGyver of the BA world – resourceful and creative while always keeping the end goal in mind.

 WHAT YOU’LL DO

 Report to the Director, IT Operations.
 Responsible for managing IT related change requests to provide assistance with analyzing and implementing desired change. This will involve meeting with business users and vendors to define and document business, functional and non-functional IT requirements.
 Enhance program management office processes, templates, checklists, policies and guidelines, best practices, lesson-learned documents and methodologies for use by others within Bridgewater Bank.
 Identify potential opportunities and risks associated with current and future states of the business and assist management decision making for organization objectives.
 Assist with design, documentation, and maintenance of banking system processes.
 Act as project leader, manager, mentor, or team member on assigned projects.
 Assist team members with technical issues related to the systems by investigating problems and developing suggestions for resolutions.
 Liaise with vendors to discuss issues and requests, and to identify and implement solutions.
 Realize business requirements and make recommendations to meet these requirements. 
Work closely with the IT team to advise on decision making, project status, and discuss/consult yearly business event calendars to strategically plan initiatives.
 Collaborate cross-functionally with team members such as business unit managers in order to achieve project objectives. Doing so by planning and facilitating meetings, encouraging strategic discussions, negotiating business options and sharing insights and findings.
 Promote best practices of the systems while maintaining a high level of customer service.
 Working as the subject matter expert of banking technologies.

 WHAT YOU’VE DONE

 You have a diploma or university degree in a business-related field.
 You’ve been certified or have taken post-secondary Business Analyst courses.
 You have a minimum of 5 years’ business analysis and project management experience (strategic analysis, troubleshooting, project testing & documenting), along with a minimum of 5 years’ experience with application/change support.
 You’ll get triple gold stars if you have financial industry knowledge and/or cyber security skills, and Business Analyst skills found in BABOK.
 You’re experienced in identifying and documenting business and functional requirements, business processes and you have a strong understanding of information technology.
 You’re an Excel pro, able to also use Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook with ease.
 You can navigate your way through the technical world with ease in areas of systems development, integration and implementation.
 You are keen on self-improvement and are willing to work toward certifications and skills that will make things better for yourself, your team and the bank.

 WHAT YOU'LL GET

 Competitive salary.
 Flexible benefits.
 Outstanding employer-paid Pension Plan.
 Great AMA discounts.
 Unlimited learning opportunities.
 Paid floater day.

 We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: HRIS Analyst - Workday
Description:
What makes SYNNEX extraordinary? We believe that success is achieved by bringing together unique points of view. Our team is comprised of innovative perspectives from a diverse group of bright minds who are inspired with a vision to imagine and the energy to make it happen. Whether you're just starting out in your career or a seasoned executive, we have a wide range of opportunities for those who have a passion for technology and a desire to bring their full self to work every day where you can grow and make a difference.
 
 Take the next step towards a rewarding career and be a part of a team that embraces inclusivity and teamwork. You're ready to be SYNNEXtraordinary!
 
 Our recruiting experience is digital!
 
 Technology is at the core of our business - we don't just sell technology, we use it. The power of digital interviewing allows you the flexibility of using your computer or mobile device to record your interview on your own schedule in the comfort of your home. Our recruiting process allows you to tell your story in a stress-free way that is interactive and fun, so if you receive a link to Share your Story with us, we hope you have an awesome digital experience.
 

HRIS Analyst - Workday 

 Our HRIS Analyst plays a vital role to optimize the Workday system and create business value through data integrity, use, reporting and flow. This role supports the day-to-day administration of the system and contributes to the design and the implementation of new modules and system features. HRIS Admin/Analyst works closely with the entire HR team. This an exciting opportunity to join a fast-paced, growing team and company and to work with a system that is a recognized leader in Cloud HCM.
 
 As of September 2022 in our new hybrid work environment, we will be moving to our new office workspace located at 
 6911 Creditview Road in Mississauga, ON. 


Get Inspired by the Work You'll Do

 A deep understanding and experience with:
 


Workday configuration specifically in Recruiting, including Talent Marketplace, Career Hub, and Skills Cloud.



Working with internal HR Domain & other sub - workstreams.



Designing creative solutions and evaluating solutions provided by partners.



Reviewing and signing-off Requirements and Test Strategies, Scenarios and Results.



Reviewing, assessing, and reacting to Workday releases.

 A good understanding and experience with:
 


Workday Security, HCM (ideally with completed Workday training/certification), and reviewing solutions for impacts to security and access.



Managing initiatives, and supporting and delivering upon operational goals.

 Key skillsets that include:
 


Delivering timely, accurate, and efficient work, including exercising judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems.



Building effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.

 Additionally, the successful applicant will serve as an advisor and partner between the business/group and Technology teams to define & document technology requirements. This may include:
 


Acting as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group.



Assisting in the development, recommendation, support, and implementation of strategic plans.



Helping to determine business priorities and the best sequence for executing business/group strategy.



Breaking down strategic problems, and analyzing data and information to provide insights and recommendations.



Identifying emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.



Supporting the business in production support, system enhancements, product upgrades and development.



Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.


 Your passion is sparked by:


 3+ years of hands-on Workday Experience - Preferably Recruiting and Onboarding experience
 Expertise in Workday modules, including the ability to complete functional configuration;
 Experience supporting a medium-to-large global organization
 Excellent project management skills and solid ability to prioritize
 Broad knowledge of human resource business processes and cross-functional impacts
 Self-motivated, creative, and adaptable with excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with leadership and our partners across the company
 Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and balance multiple initiatives
 Ability to focus on the essential issues and simplify complexity


 We have Great Perks • Flexible Time Away (flex vacation) • Every day is Casual Day • Comprehensive Group Health Insurance plan • Discretionary Profit Sharing • Employee Referral Award program • Employee Purchase Plan/ Company Discounts • Out of Country travel assistance • Health/ Wellness initiatives • Paid Personal Days • Employee Assistance Program • Education Reimbursement • Milestone Service Awards • Community Involvement activities in partnership with Kids Help Phone • Employee of the Quarter awards • Group RRSP with Company Matching • Training Opportunities • Huang Leadership Development Scholarship • Bi-annual President's Club • Annual Founders Award
 

Be Inspired In Your Career.

 #LI-AI1
 

@ SYNNEX Corporation, we believe employees are our greatest asset and we empower them to make a difference in our business.
Diversity and inclusion makes us all better. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, protected veteran status, and all other protected statuses. 


@ SYNNEX Canada Limited, we are committed to supporting accommodation and inclusivity for persons with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and employment lifecycle. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know; we will work with you to meet your needs. 

 Note: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees with this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Title: Identity & Access Management Analyst
Description:
Overview 

 At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions. 
Corporate Technology @ Neo 
Our Corporate Technology team aims to empower our business units through high impact, technology-driven services and solutions that will enable our company to adapt quickly to our growing customer base. Our high performance team works cross functionally to deliver and maintain systems and solutions to support our growth and drive our business forward. 

 The Opportunity 

 Neo Financial is looking for a full-time Identity & Access Management Analyst to join our Corporate Technology team in our Calgary, AB headquarters. In this role, you will support us in designing, operating and improving identity related IT General Controls across the business. You will take a lead on working with auditors (both internal and external) to ensure we are compliant with standards including PCI-DSS and will be responsible for Identity Governance, Role Based Access Control, MFA and IAM. 


What you'll be doing:
 Managing and executing access lifecycle processes and controls as part of access request, fulfillment, and administration processes 
Monitor, restore services, changes, support, and handle day-to-day activities required to run the mission critical systems 
Be the main point of contact for auditors, responding to audit testing requests, providing evidence of control operation and designing improvements to controls as required 
Own audit remediation actions and track them through to successful completion 
Work alongside other teams across the wider business to implement Single Sign On and user provisioning (where applicable) for internal and SaaS applications 
Develop workflows and other automation using our IAM and Identity Governance tooling 
Analyze data in order to identify roles and then automate the management of those roles as part of our RBAC initiative 
Create and publicize self-service tools for requests for access outside of automatically managed roles 
This is a challenging role that includes planning and implementing technical solutions and collaborating with teams throughout the organization 
Conducts proper root cause analysis and makes recommendations to improve IAM processes to prevent future occurrence of end user access issues 


Who we're looking for:
 You bring 3+ years of experience in Identity Management 

 You have experience in IT General Control design, implementation and operation 

 You bring knowledge in identity management principles such as Authentication, Authorization, SOD, Access Certification, PIM / PAM, RBAC, B2B / B2C, MFA 

 You have experience with Role Based Access Control design and operation, including role mining, attribute based access and automation of access changes 

 You’ve worked with OKTA alongside other identity providers 

 You have experience with identity and access management technologies, development, and application integration 

 You have used a SIEM tool such as Splunk to analyze identity related log events 

 You’re capable of writing comprehensive documentation, making presentations to an internal audience and interacting positively with upper management, colleagues and end-users 

 You are a detail oriented thinker who can make technical plans and execute them with discipline and due attention 


About applying with us:
 At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future. 

 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Business Analyst, Information Management
Description:
The Business Analyst, Information Management will join the dynamic Enterprise Data, Analytics, Architecture & Engineering (EDAAE) team within Data & Technology. EDAAE applies data, analytics, and AI to develop scalable and appropriately governed solutions that drive sustainable growth at OMERS. The Business Analyst, Information Management will focus on data migration projects and roll-out of other information protection and data governance capabilities for enterprise content. They will work with the Business and technology to transition the data to cloud-based systems. 


As a member of this team, you will be responsible to:
 Work with the Project Manager and Business Stakeholders to understand the current system’s functionality, data, infrastructure, and its integration with other systems and conducted the gap analysis to reach the target state. 
Work as part of a project team to facilitate the migration of content from legacy content systems such as SharePoint, Content Server etc. to modern content platforms such as Microsoft 365/ SharePoint while ensuring the appropriate governance controls are implemented 
Create test cases and test plans based on business requirements and perform testing including system/integration testing, functional testing, cross-browser compatibility, user acceptance testing 
Design and implement information architectures in SharePoint (which may leverage metadata and content types) to improve access and retrieval of day-to-day information 
Collaborate with the Enterprise Information Risk & Compliance team to ensure that information management solutions are designed to effectively apply controls related to data classification, retention, and disposition 
Provide the knowledge transition to end user by creating training manuals, presentations, and conducted training sessions 
Support the Information Management team in managing the incoming employees’ requests related to M365 (SharePoint, Teams) 
Support OMERS in remaining on the leading edge of emerging data, analytics and AI technologies and techniques by identifying industry innovations and related information and data risk and compliance challenges 


To succeed in this role, you have:
 A degree in Information Management, Computer Science, Data, Technology, or Engineering 
3-5 years of data and information management experience, with an emphasis on information management system implementation, particularly SharePoint and Microsoft 365. 
Business analysis skills (e.g. partnering with business stakeholders to gather and document business and technical requirements) coupled with a solid grasp of information management, data classification, retention, disposition, content management systems, privacy, and data governance best practices 
Experience in data migration projects to cloud based systems. 
Experience implementing governance controls in information management systems (e.g. applying retention and classification labels in Office365) 
Demonstrated experience in modernizing records management, data protection and operational privacy controls via process engineering, automation, and other leading-edge approaches 
Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively articulate and communicate with both business and technical development teams 
A team player with a good understanding of the Agile methodology and Change management 


Our story:
 Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

 OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

 Vaccination Policy 

 At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Title: Business Analyst, Drugs
Description:
Job Description: 
 
 We are Canada Life



 Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.
 




  You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.
 

 


  Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.
 


 Be your best at Canada Life.
 


 We are looking for a 
  Business Analyst, Drugs



 This position is suited to an individual who has an enthusiasm for investigating, analyzing, and solving problems.
 


 A Business Analyst provides business and technical direction to Head Office, Benefit Payment Offices (BPO), Group Customer Contact Services (GCCS) and Field Offices.
 


 As a Business Analyst you will be developing and communicating solutions to a variety of units within Canada Life. The solutions and support you provide will be invaluable to our clients.
 


 What you will do


 Provide direction to Benefit Payment Offices (BPO), Group Customer Contact Services (GCCS) Offices and Head Office staff on complex claim processing problems.
 Establish and implement business or system enhancements, including documentation throughout project lifecycle, for the BPOs and Head Office staff.
 Provide business and technical support to Field Office staff on complex plan designs/complicated claims adjudication.
 Extract, analyze, perform calculations on claims data from internal and external sources; compile reports for BPO, other Head Office Departments, Field Offices/Consultants, Other Insurance Carriers; will involve large volumes of data from multiple sources in varying formats and degrees of complexity. Advanced excel and database knowledge would be an asset.
 Work on drug related projects with a third-party vendor (TELUS) to ensure business and system impacts are addressed and tested prior to release.


 What you will bring


 Business related post-secondary education or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
 Knowledge of Health & Dental benefits, specifically Drug claims knowledge would be a strong asset.
 Business Analysis certification with strengths in data analysis would be a definite asset.
 Mathematical and statistics background an asset
 Advanced skills in Excel & Access/Database and data visualization applications (i.e. PowerBI) knowledge.
 Word, Visio, PowerPoint would be a definite asset.
 Well-developed analytical and problem-solving abilities.
 Excellent oral and written communication skills
 Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle changing priorities and fluctuating work loads.


 Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today



 We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!



 Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.



 We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee 
has the opportunity to
 reach their potential.



 Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

Title: Board Certified Behaviour Analyst - Education Centre - 35hr
Company: Kawartha Pine Ridge District School Board
Description:
Board Certified Behaviour Analyst 


Start Date: TBD 


Pay Band: 12A 


Salary Range: $36.61 - $40.68 per hour 


Benefits: Full benefits, including pension 

 35 hours/week 

 The Board-Certified Behaviour Analyst works 10 months+ 10 Days; however, this position is paid 12 months in consideration of lieu time. In addition, the successful candidate will receive paid time off during Christmas, March break, and the summer break. 

 The Kawartha Pine Ridge District School Board (KPR) offers a world-class education for approximately 34,000 students in 87 schools. Spanning over 7,000 square kilometers, across diverse rural and urban communities in southeastern Ontario, KPR serves the Municipality of Clarington, Northumberland and Peterborough Counties, and City of Quinte West/Murray Ward. 

 The Board is situated on the traditional territory of the Michi Saagiig Anishinaabeg people, serving three vibrant First Nation communities which include Alderville First Nation, Curve Lake First Nation and Hiawatha First Nation. Today, this gathering place is home to many First Nations, Métis and Inuit peoples and we acknowledge the contributions and accomplishments of all Indigenous people across Turtle Island, current and through history. 

 All positions in the Kawartha Pine Ridge District School Board support the school’s priority of student achievement and the Boards mission to educate our students to excel in learning, to succeed in life and to enrich our communities. 

 Employees demonstrate empathy and respect in all interactions, are committed to service excellence, and embrace change through innovation. 

 As part of our strategy to provide on-going support for our schools, the Board is now accepting resumes from qualified applicants for the full-time position of Board Certified Behaviour Analyst. 

 The purpose of the Board Certified Behaviour Analyst (BCBA) position is to work in collaboration with a variety of school board staff and outside agency professionals to provide consultation, behaviour analytic assessment, and support staff in the application of ABA procedures within schools. 

 The BCBA should have a broad understanding of applied behaviour analysis, the ability to analyze data for the purpose of developing behaviour intervention, and identifying goals and measurable outcomes for students using evidence-based practices. 


REPORTS TO: Principal of Special Education 


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Consultation to School and Board Staff 

 Provide behavior consultation and professional support to students, teachers, administrators, support staff, and other board professional staff regarding research-based ABA procedures, reliable and valid data collection systems, staff training procedures, and other topics as requested. 

 Support schools with their implementation of ABA procedures by interpreting technical community agency assessments (functional behaviour assessments, experimental functional analyses, VBMAPP, ABLLS-R, AFLS, etc.) 

 Model the use of behaviour analytic procedures and data based decision making. 

 Provide feedback to school staff to ensure the ABA procedures being implemented in schools meet ethical and procedural guidelines. 

 Assist teachers, SERTS and ILCs to identify student goals and appropriate assessment and teaching procedures for an IEP. 

 Support staff and students with transition planning support. 

 Attend Case Conferences, Multi-Focused team meetings, Multi-Disciplinary Team meetings and parent meetings to report on student outcomes. 

 Professional Development for school and board staff 

 Develop and deliver professional development sessions on technically accurate, evidence-based ABA concepts and procedures to school staff using research-based staff training procedures. 

 Provide and interpret research literature for school board staff to support their use of ABA procedures in their work (ILC’s and BSA’s). 

 Assist with the development and implementation of resources and protocols to support students with ASD as per Board and Ministry requirements 


Coordinate the referrals, gathering data re: needs of school to meet the needs of the student, make recommendations to bring to Principal of Special Education 

 Clinical Student Assessment 

 Use clinical judgement to determine appropriate assessment procedures (e.g., FBA, FA, indirect or criterion-referenced assessment). 

 Conduct and analyze indirect assessments including questionnaires, checklists, and interviews. 

 Analyse data collected through direct observation of staff and students in a school setting 

 Design, and conduct functional behavioural assessments (FBA) and Experimental Functional Analyses (FA) in accordance with BACB ethical guidelines. 

 Conduct criterion-referenced assessments for individual students. 

 Prepare and present clinical written reports to a variety of stakeholders (i.e., caregivers, school teams, board staff, and community partners). 

 Develop and prepare behavior programming and provide supervision and performance feedback to staff to ensure optimal effectiveness of strategies. 

 Monitor and evaluate behavior programming to determine an ongoing model of support. 

 Clinical Staff Supervision 

 Train school and board staff to competently perform recommended intervention and assessment procedures using performance monitoring, feedback and reinforcement systems. 

 Monitor the implementation of behaviour programming by school staff using treatment integrity checks to ensure safe and ethical best practices, and procedural guidelines are followed. 

 Provide training and performance feedback to board staff in developing and delivering effective and technically accurate professional development sessions based on evidence- based practices. 

 Provide clinical supervision for student placements and board staff seeking BACB credentialing (BCBA, BCaBA, and/or RBT). 

 Establish clear performance expectations for the supervisee (BCBA, BCaBA, and/or RBT) based on assessment of the supervisee’s skills. 

 Train supervisees to competently perform assessment and intervention procedures using performance monitoring, feedback and reinforcement systems. 

 Evaluate the effects of supervision on student outcomes and supervisee repertoires. 

 Use functional assessment approaches (i.e. performance diagnostics) to identify variables affecting supervisee performance. 

 Provide on-going clinical supervision for Support Staff (EA and/or CYW) who have the Registered Behaviour Technician (RBT) certification or are working towards the certification as per BACB Guidelines. 

 Engagement with Community and Ministry Partners 

 Collect and monitor data regarding ABA resources, training and professional development within the board as needed for Ministry of Education training and reporting requirements. 

 Facilitate collaboration between schools and ABA community agencies for students receiving ABA supports through the Ontario Autism Program (OAP) or private funding. 

 Gather and share information and resources regarding ABA Programs in Ontario (OAP initiatives, ONTABA strategic plans, etc.) to support the board with planning and responding to policies and public sentiments regarding Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and ABA in schools. 


SUPERVISION:
 May provide clinical supervision for student placements and board staff seeking BACB credentialing. 


EDUCATION & EXPEREINCE REQUIRED:
 Master’s degree in ABA, or related discipline, plus three years of directly related experience. 

 Board Certified Behaviour Analyst (BCBA) credentials are mandatory. 

 Must be a Board Certified Behaviour Analyst (BCBA) registered as part of the BACB. 

 Advanced knowledge of crisis intervention strategies and de-escalation techniques. 

 Excellence in oral and written communication skills with the ability to effectively manage conflict among stakeholders. 

 Be flexible and adapt to a variety of team styles and work as part of a multi-disciplinary teams. 

 Strong research and data analysis skills 

 Ongoing commitment to obtaining new knowledge regarding evidence-based interventions. 

 Exemplary decision-making and leadership skills, including problem-solving and solution focused planning are required to supervise staff and coach school teams. 

 Willing to complete NVCI training 

 Must maintain professional development Continuing Education Units (CEUs) as per BACB guidelines. 

 Competency in reviewing behaviour analytic literature for dissemination to board staff in lay language. 

 Completion of the 8-hour BACB supervision course and additional supervision standards outlined by the BACB. 

 Experience providing consultation services, school based transitions, and knowledge of special education policies. 

 Competencies in evidence-based ABA procedures including but not limited to: Functional Assessment, Discrete Trial Training, Cognitive Behaviour Interventions, Pivotal Response Training, Self-Management, Response Interruption and Redirection, Video Modeling, Picture Exchange Communication System (PECS), Vocational Training, Social Skills Training, Behaviour Skills Training, Differential Reinforcement, Extinction Procedures, and Antecedent Manipulations. 

 Competencies in using ABA procedures to increase skills across a variety of domains including but not limited to: social/interpersonal, communication, self-regulation, joint attention, learning/school readiness, play and leisure, adaptive and vocational skills. 

 Competencies in using ABA procedures to decrease challenging student behaviour including but not limited to: aggression, self-injury, restricted and repetitive behaviour. 


WORKING CONDITIONS:

 High attention to detail, high levels of organization, some visual exertion and keyboarding. 

 A police records check, with a Vulnerable Sector Search and Pardoned Sexual Offenders Database Search, dated within 6 months prior to the date of hire, is a requirement for employment with this Board. With that in mind, we strongly recommend that you go about obtaining this search at your earliest convenience.

Title: Standards Analyst
Description:
Who We Are:
 A neutral, not-for-profit organization, GS1 Canada is one of 116 GS1 Member Organizations around the world. We are a Trusted Strategic Partner who inspires, leads, and enables best in class supply chain by developing and maintaining global standards for efficient business communications. For more than 20 years, we have supported Canadian businesses of all types and sizes in several industries and sectors.
 GS1 has partnered with several industries globally for over 50 years – since we introduced the very first barcode on a pack of gum in 1974. Today, GS1 barcodes are scanned 6 billion times a day, and GS1 standards are the most widely used system of standards in the world.
 A team of friendly and passionate people, we are optimistic about our capabilities and draw strength from our uniqueness, and the drive and passion of our people to carry our values and vision forward.

Our Core Values:

Integrity
Collaboration
Innovation
Accountability
Super-Serve Subscribers



 About this opportunity:
 GS1 Canada’s primary role is the development of global standards and we are looking for an energetic go-getter to join us as a Standards Analyst. In this role, you'll support the Standards team in answering inquiries across our key stakeholder groups, assist on various projects, develop education content and/or deliver education sessions, attend community working groups, process internal and external industry requirements, and respond to GTIN Ombudsman inquiries. This role is technical and requires the interpretation of the GS1 Standards.


 What you’ll do:

Assist in creating education material and in delivering education sessions to support internal and external understanding of GS1 Standards
Assist with departmental projects ensuring timely completion of deliverables
Act as a subject matter expert on GS1 standards and processes for departments within GS1 Canada
Assist in reviews of Standards related content
Assist in the development of business use cases
Assist with website content maintenance
Support the GTIN Ombudsman function. This includes providing fact-based interpretation of the relevant GS1 standards
Perform various other duties as delegated or assigned



 What you’ll bring:

University degree or college diploma (essay-based course) in Technical Writing, Communications, Business or Computer Science
At least 2 years experience and knowledge of barcodes, EDI, data synchronization, or other GS1 Standards
Technical skills (business/data analysis, project management, technical writing)

What Will Make Us REALLY Love you (Preferred Qualifications):

Bi-lingual in French
Working knowledge of one or more of the following business processes: New item introduction, shelf management, order-to-cash, traceability
Experience working within one of the following industries: Retail (Grocery or Pharmacy), Foodservice, Healthcare



 What You'll Love About Us:

Our People First Culture – At GS1 Canada, we embody our values and live them every day. We know that family and health come first, and that’s a non-negotiable for us!
Work that Stays at Work – A work life balance that you can boast about!
Rest and Relaxation – Three weeks paid time off, Ten paid personal/sick days, and we make sure you book that time off!
Health Benefits – Health, dental, and vision coverage, lifestyle and wellness benefits, Employee Assistance Programs (EAPs)
Prepare for the Future – Benefit from RRSP matching that contribute towards your savings
A Culture of Learning and Growth – We want you to keep learning and growing. We provide access to many learning tools that you can take advantage of for personal and professional capabilities development!


GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals. Please be advised that only candidates being considered for an interview will be contacted. We are committed to providing a barrier-free environment to all applicants, including those with disabilities. Throughout the hiring process, we will work with applicants to accommodate accessibility needs.

Title: HR Systems Analyst - Toronto
Description:
Please apply on Isarta.com
 https://isarta.com/jobs/?utm_source=IND&job=82679
 


Our client is a leader in their industry and they are growing. They are looking for a HR Systems Analyst to join their team. 
The HR Systems Analyst will be a key player in the design, development, implementation, testing, maintenance and enhancements of all Human Resources related technology. This position will provide functional and technical expertise in analyzing, designing and implementing HR system solutions in support of organizational and business requirements, as well as utilizing technology to improve efficiencies. The HR Systems Analyst will also monitor data quality and integrity and proactively lead data remediation efforts. 
What you will deliver: 

Maintain and identify the accuracy and data integrity of the Human Resource Information System by running array of reports and conducting regular audits. Communicate and collaborate with respective HR team members to resolve any data discrepancies 
Serve as a technical point of contact within HR and assist subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities 
Collaborate with HR colleagues, IT and external vendors to ensure user requirement and change requests are reviewed and approved 
Assists Senior Manager, Compensation & Systems with the implementation of work processes and system solutions that support business initiatives, enhance the value and integrity of data and create an efficient system environment for users 
Contribute to the design and implementation of new and additional functionality to the HRIS, including Manager Self Service (MSS), Employee Self Service (ESS) and all other required modules 
Works with HR functional areas to interpret business requirements and develop systems configuration solutions 

? Administrate the HRIS system, with an ongoing focus on identifying opportunities for continuous improvement through technology ? Develop reports and dashboards, including alerts and bursts 

Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including all HR applications 
Develop and optimizes system reporting and prepares ad hoc reports based on end user requirements and specifications 
Creates and maintains appropriate documentation and user training in support of HR Systems applications 
Ensure IT General Controls are adhered to for access, changes and incidents 
Responsible for training Property Administrators and Managers/Supervisors on the requirements of Time and Attendance (UTA). This involves hands-on instruction, on-going telephone support to ensure all properties are familiar with and adhere to the prescribed procedures and guidelines for processing the biweekly payroll 
Support technical aspect and data collection for annual employee survey through Qualtrics including pulse surveys conducted throughout the year 
Prepare the annual department budget and monthly variance analysis preparation. Monitor expenses to verify invoices are coded to the correct accounts. Responsible for any budget questions and communications; key contact person for Finance 
Participates in special projects as required 

What you need to succeed: 

Minimum of 3 years' experience working with HR systems or equivalence 
Post-secondary education in Business and/or Human Resources diploma 
Advanced capability with software and application tools including MS Office Excel and Word 
Knowledge of automated systems such HRIS, payroll systems and time and attendance, preferably with UKG Pro. 
Working knowledge of BI reporting.

Title: Senior Business Analyst – Salesforce
Description:
Location: Work is what you do, not where you go. For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in the United States or Canada 

 About the Opportunity 

 Reporting to the Product Leader, the Senior Business Analyst – Salesforce maintains and operates the business systems (with a large focus on Salesforce or SFDC) and tools that service Ceridian stakeholders. Focused on the customer lifecycle, they will analyze processes and experiences across a diverse set of functions and help those functions to use the system in the most optimal ways. They will recommend procedures and practices that help functions achieve business objectives. 

 The Senior Business Analyst - Salesforce is uniquely skilled at engaging with end users and process owners to understand task and objectives. Lead and assist agile product development requirements prioritized by the respective Product Leader, through discussion and collaboration. 

 What you’ll get to do 



Configure new and existing SFDC features including user management, roles/profiles, workflow rules, and permission sets
Design and participate in Salesforce enhancements, releases, and end-user acceptance testing
Create a variety of customer reports for standard objects
Lead gathering user requirements and communicate those requirements through use of mock-ups, storyboards, and process flows
Lead process owners in realizing system enhancements through change plans or control plans
Lead the development and communication of best practices and methods for end users to get the most out of Salesforce.
Perform train-the-trainer for system utilization and educate stakeholders on benefits of changes and acquire their buy-in
Act as a spokesperson and advocate for the business with new capabilities or functionality.
Understand processes by mapping and observing as-is functions
Quantify the improvement opportunity for enhancements through data and estimates
Direct in testing and validation of delivered enhancements and gain user acceptance
Find functional similarity in business needs to capitalize on synergies and understand intersecting system functionality to avoid unintended impacts
Direct cross functional activity and track that it is completed as scheduled
Communicate progress, risks, barriers, and status on a regular basis
 What’s in it for you 



Encouragement to be the best version of yourself at and away from work:
YOUnity diversity and inclusion programs
Amazing time away from work programs
Support for your total well-being through our Live Well, Work Well programs targeting all aspects of your life
Recognition for your contributions through excellent pay, perks, and rewards
Giving where you’re living: volunteer days, Ceridian sponsored events, and our very own charity, Ceridian Cares
Opportunities to fuel your career growth through numerous internal and external programs and events
 Skills and experience we value 



4+ years of experience and hands-on knowledge of concepts, practices, and procedures related to Salesforce systems
Successful experience as a business analyst leading large organizations in upgrading/modifying a Salesforce based system
Required experience creating Salesforce reports and dashboards
Required experience with creating and documenting requirements using Agile and/or other SDLC development methodologies
Proficiency in Excel for analyzing data, with PowerPoint and other illustrative software to present concepts and ideas.
Prefer experience with developing dashboards and reports.
Proven ability to support 100+ end users and process owners through system best practices and procedural documentation.
Teaching user how to be self-proficient and use the system appropriately.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present and influence at all levels of the organization, tailoring succinct and focused messages to different audiences. Strong written, visual and verbal communication and meeting facilitation skills, proven at all levels from process performer to business leaders.
Project Management: Proven ability to direct, lead and collaborate with resources without direct management responsibility. Ability to create and define a plan with little to no prescriptive direction, other than objective. Ability to track and organize tasks and issues in a fast-paced environment.
Change Management Experience: Proven experience of effectively obtaining users involvement and support. Ability to understand a wide variety of perspectives and articulate what is important to each. Prefer experience in training or assisting end users.
Organizational Skills: Strong organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills required
Collaborative Skills: Consultative abilities, sound judgment decision making skills, and ability to work under continual deadline pressure. Demonstrated ability to build rapport, influence and problem solve with various levels of the organization. Able to collaborate, negotiate and persuade, while maintaining positive relationships.
 What would make you really stand out 



Saleforce Admin. Certification
Experience with Service and Sales Cloud within the SFDC ecosystem for a large enterprise organization
Experience configuring and adapting Salesforce for a software or Saas organization

Title: Functional Business Analyst – Enterprise Applications
Description:
META is seeking a Functional Business Analyst – Enterprise Applications. Reporting to the ERP Manager, the Functional Analyst is a new business-enabling role that is part of a team that ensures our people are fully engaged with our systems and the applications are being effectively leveraged. This role requires a strong ability to understand business needs and interpret them into system processes and functionalities that enables business process implementation and governance.
 The ideal candidate for this position builds relationships effortlessly, excels in designing technical solutions, finding efficiencies, and creating tools that enable continuous improvement. This is an exciting opportunity to take recent systems implementations to very well integrated solutions.


 About Us:
 Meta Materials Inc. “META®” (NASDAQ: MMAT) is a developer of high-performance functional materials and nanocomposites. META® delivers previously unachievable performance, across a range of applications, by inventing, designing, developing and manufacturing sustainable, highly functional materials. Our broad electromagnetic technology platforms enable leading global brands to deliver breakthrough products to their customers in consumer electronics, 5G communications, health and wellness, aerospace, automotive, and clean energy. Our nano-optic technology provides anti-counterfeiting security features for government documents and currencies and authentication for brands. Our achievements have been widely recognized, including being named a Lux Research Innovator of the Year in 2021. Learn more at www.metamaterial.com

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for providing on-demand support of ERP application(s) to the organization, troubleshooting user challenges, investigating issues, and resolving functional problems.
Act as level 1 support for ERP applications operational issues, incident management and implementing change requests submitted by business
Conduct interview with stakeholders to establish detail understanding of business needs and translate them into functional specifications and use cases.
Write functional specification document for enhancements, integrations, and reports
Uses an understanding of business functions and processes to suggest workflow enhancement and create efficiencies through enterprise application systems.


Create supporting user documentation and train users of the systems
Build and maintain effective dashboards and reports
Support the rollout of further modules or functionality of the systems
Lead upgrades, patches, and embedded customizations



 KEY REQUIREMENTS

3-5 years of Functional Analyst and/or Business System Analyst experience managing ERP applications (Plex, SAP or similar)
Computer Science, Business or Engineering degree; a combination of education and experience will be considered
Proven experience in performing under tight project deadlines, delivery of work with a sense of urgency, customer service and team orientation
Prior experience with data transformation for new acquisitions within the company’s systems is a strong asset


Deep analytical and problem-solving skills with strong detail orientation
Ability to work effectively on a team, or self-managed and independently as required
Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Teams, Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
Excellent communication skills with proven ability to influence and lead change
Ability to develop business functional specifications and use cases.



 SOFT SKILLS

Problem Solving – High
Planning and Organizing – High
Communicating – High


Accountability and Adaptability – High



 Feel like you can’t tick all the boxes above? If you have some of the skills and experience that we’re looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply!

 What You’ll Love About Us:
 META is a fast-growing company with a positive and committed work culture and a phenomenally talented workforce. Our employees are inspired to do exceptional and innovative work, are proud to contribute to the success of the company and are our greatest asset.
 META attracts people from many countries and cultures, with over 25 spoken languages represented across our teams. META believes that diversity drives creativity and innovation. We welcome and encourage applications from underrepresented populations; Aboriginal peoples, racialized persons, people living with disabilities (including invisible and episodic disabilities) and members of the LGBTQ2 community.

 Our Benefits:

META (MMAT) Equity
Retirement Savings Matching


Company provided Group Health Insurance (medical, dental, vision).
Competitive paid time off policy; vacation, paid sick leave; personal days; time off between Christmas day and New Year’s day
Casual dress

Title: Research Analyst (FT)
Company: Waypoint Centre for Mental Health Care
Description:
The Waypoint Research Institute (WRI) is currently seeking a Research Analyst to assist researchers in the design, implementation, and evaluation of research projects. Incumbents may prepare questionnaires, data entry forms, conduct interviews, complete data collection and analysis, and contribute to grant applications and publications under the supervision of researchers.
 
Located at Waypoint Centre for Mental Health Care in Penetanguishene, Ontario, the WRI contributes to the field of mental health by providing strategic leadership on research and academic issues; facilitating innovating science and high quality applied research that aligns with Waypoint priorities; fostering partnerships and research collaborations across Ontario, in Canada and internationally; prioritizing knowledge translation that improves mental health and addictions care; and offering mentorship opportunities for students and trainees in a unique facility.

 Key Accountabilities:

 Conduct literature searches and reviews
 Assist in preparing materials for submission to granting agencies and foundations
 Participate in project meetings
 Assist in preparation of research ethics proposals
 Design, develop, and critique questionnaires or coding forms
 Develop sample selection and draw samples – recruit and/or interview subjects
 Participate in data collection; prepare data entry forms; enter, verify and clean data 
Participate in data analysis plans and assist with data analysis and summaries of results
 Assist in preparing reports, articles, and presentations; participate in presentations within the Waypoint Research Institute
 Maintain a log of all research activities
 Attend conferences and other meetings as necessary
 Prepare materials for submission to granting agencies and foundations
 Attend conferences and other meetings as necessary


 Requirements/Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s level degree (completed or pending) in a behavioural/life science field with relevant post-degree research training preferred
 Demonstrated experiencein qualitative and quantitative research methods and analysis
 Experience in research with a record of achievement in scholarly work (publications, presentations, completed research projects in work or senior undergraduate/graduate setting) 
TCPS2 Certification preferred
 Detail- oriented in order to ensure data is checked and consistently accurate
 Results oriented work ethic to work independently and undertake tasks needed to accomplish work objectives and deliver quality, consistent and timely results
 Demonstrated teamwork, interpersonal, communication and organizational skills 
Proven written and verbal communication skills
 Proven ability to adapt readily to change
 Models and promotes core ethical practice, Waypoint Values, and reflects an optimistic and positive attitude
 Preference for proficiency in French/English language skills\
 You must meet the requirements of our COVID-19 Immunization Policy by providing proof of full vaccination, or a request and receipt of an accommodation under the Ontario Human Rights Code, including a medical exemption


 How do I apply?
 Waypoint employees apply through the Employee Self-Service portal at https://employees.waypointcentre.ca and external applicants apply to http://www.waypointcentre.ca/i_want_to/join_your_teamby close of business (5:00 pm) onJuly 13, 2022 quoting Job ID WC22-225. Attach your cover letter and resume detailing why you are interested in this opportunity and how you meet the qualifications and key accountabilities specified. 
We are committed to diversity in the workplace and workplace well-being. As such, applications from individuals from diverse backgrounds such as First Nations, Inuit, Metis, members of a visible minority group and those with lived experience of mental health problems or illnesses are welcomed and encouraged. Waypoint welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon require for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All applicants are thanked for their interest in this position, however, due to high volumes only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Information Security Analyst (Cyber Security Process and Risk)
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Building a World-Class Technology Team at TD
 We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
 TD Information Security covers the development and management of security strategies, policies and programs to assess, prioritize, and mitigate business risk with technology controls. Priorities include: mitigating and managing cyber security threats, ensuring systems availability, aligning with global regulatory risk and compliance requirements, managing systems and network complexity, and partnering with businesses for better technology delivery by providing advice on technology controls. 
There's room to grow in all of it.



Job Description

About This Role 
We are looking for someone to develop and implement Information Security related processes, to document and report on status (particularly as it pertains to risk and governance), and to gather and present evidence in support of Internal Audit, governance, and regulatory requests. You will provide expertise and identifying risks and potential gaps, working with Fusion Watch colleagues to identify remediation and mitigation plans. You may also participate in providing reporting, analysis, and assessments at the functional, business line or enterprise level. Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:

 Monitor the work intake requests and assign work
 Develop and maintain metrics on work intake and delivery
 Contribute to the review of internal processes and activities, and assist in identifying potential opportunities for improvement.
 Develop and maintain process documentation for all Protect Fusion domains (threat intel, data & analytics, crisis management)
 Engage with Internal Audit, Operational Risk Management and various governance and regulatory functions to understand requests for information and evidence
 Retrieve and assemble evidence packages in support of Internal Audit, ORM, Digital Crown Jewels, and regulatory requests
 Assist in the development of on-going KPI / KRI reporting 
Adhere to internal policies and procedures, technology control standards, and applicable regulatory guidelines.
 Influence behavior to identify and reduce risk 




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:

 University Degree.
 Information Security Certification / Accreditation an asset.
 3-5 years of relevant experience. Technical writing or evidential response or documentation with in security and risk.
 Knowledge of IT security and risk disciplines and practices.
 Knowledge of organization, technology controls, security, and risk issues.
 Demonstrated ability to participate in complex, comprehensive or large projects and initiatives.
 Ability to work independently with colleagues in Protect Fusion and across TD's Cybersecurity teams and Lines of Business
 Familiarity with enterprise tools such as Archer, Splunk, Sentinel, ABOR, CMDB is desirable
 Experience developing and running queries using SIEM platforms (e.g.: Splunk Enterprise Security, Microsoft Sentinel) is desirable
 Familiarity or experience with cybersecurity threat intelligence and/or crisis management functions is desirable




Additional Information

Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:

 Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
 Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, 




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
