Title: Capital Markets - Business Analyst (FX Trading)
Description:
Story Behind the Need

Business group: GWRT - Global Capital Markets Technology
Project: G20 Remediation Program
Reason for request: Backfill

Candidate Value Proposition- The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work with big data and build out a data warehouse where all capital markets reporting data is stored.
Typical Day in Role

Project centered around the remediation of data gaps related to FX (from an audit an compliance perspective)
Contribute FX (Wall Street) data to the warehouse
Enhancement items that need to be viewed on a regular bases. Management/project will prioritize items and assign to the contractor
Analysis and typical roles for a BSA
Will undertake some work on the back end using Unix
Running SQL queries and work with Oracle
Looking at data warehouse attributes, as well as Wallstreet FX, and ensure that the data is accurate and complete. Ensure that what is being fed downstream is accurate (investigation, analysis, altering format to fit system format, etc.)
May be expected to look into downstream reporting to assist with building out some reports from the data platform (secondary role to their key role of ensuring accuracy of the data being fed into the system)
Will be working internally with the project team, other BSAs, Developers, as well as with some business users

Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:

5+ years’ experience working in a relevant capacity as a BSA (with data)
3 years’ experience within Capital markets (ideally within FX)

o If the experience is under a different asset class in Capital markets, more experience would be needed

Professional experience writing and designing SQL queries (intermediate to advanced skills)
Working knowledge of Unix
Understanding of SDLC (testing and technical specifications), as well as a strong understanding of configurations, technical mappings, data attributes

Soft Skills:

Willingness to learn new things is a key value
Problem solver

Nice to Have Skills:

Wallstreet FX experience is an asset
Experience with big data technology (Kafka, Hadoop) is an asset

Best vs Average: Has both FX and data experience. The contractor would have more years of experience in Capital Markets, as well as diversity in their previous exposure to different asset classes (something beyond FX is appreciated). Technical aptitude is important, as well as understanding the software development life cycle.
Job Type: Fixed term contract
Salary: $80.00-$90.00 per hour
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Experience:

Capital Markets: 3 years (required)

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the job

 A Business Intelligence Analyst leverages and manages data that is consumed by the world's most elite financial institutions by applying structured thinking and leveraging technology. The scope ranges across the full data lifecycle, from acquisition, normalization, consolidation, validation, remediation, preparation and distribution of data about instruments, legal entities, corporate actions, prices, quantitative data structures (curves, volatility surfaces, correlation matrixes, etc.) and common reference data such as calendars, countries, etc.

 Who will love this job


A proud advocate – you enjoy scrubbing and automating compelling data that engages all parts of the business. You are the voice of our customers
A teacher and learner – you like investigating and troubleshooting data related issues across all dimensions of data quality
A helper – you relish acting as the front-line support resource, handling client requests related to TS Imagine's data offering 
A trusted subject matter specialist – you own contributing to the constant evolution of our data management maturity and data management capabilities in metadata management, data quality management and data governance 
An excellent teammate – you appreciate the daily operations of a global, highly distributed team that delivers mission critical data services


What you'll do


Manage data about financial products, corporate actions, prices, legal entities, valuation data structures and common reference data that is consumed by 500+ clients of TS Imagine around the world
Ensure and enhance the integrity of our mission-critical data offering
Learn finance from the data up
Make and implement recommendations to prevent reoccurring issues and automate manual processes
Automate processes and enhance data with Basic SQL, Python, and JavaScript


You should have


Robust knowledge of pricing models for financial instruments and OTC deals
Familiarity with financial products 
Experience in trading, portfolio management, risk management or margin management 
A Master's degree in a quantitative field such as financial engineering, physics or mathematics from a reputable university 
A good understanding of risk management methodologies such as VaR and stress testing 
Familiarity with the terms and conditions of instruments in fixed income, commodities, FX, crypto, equity and their derivatives 
Basic SQL, Python and JavaScript 
Knowledge of Data Vendors, such as Bloomberg, Refinitiv, ICE or FactSet 
A CFA and/or FRM or be a candidate pursuing one 
Relevant financial internship experience 
Master data management (instruments, corporate actions and valuation data), metadata management, data quality management or data governance

Why TS Imagine / Benefits

Currently hybrid home-office 
Vacation and Personal days 
Annual bonus and salary review 
Training budget $1,500 
RRSP with 3% company matching 
Health insurance 
Subvention for public transportation


 About TS Imagine
 Created out of the combination of two best-in-class SaaS platforms, TradingScreen and Imagine Software, TS Imagine delivers integrated trading, portfolio and real-time risk solutions for capital markets. The platform is uniquely positioned to streamline complex and time-consuming workflows across front, middle, and back office functions. TS Imagine has close to 400 employees in 10 offices worldwide, serving approximately 500 global buy-side and sell-side institutions across North and South America, EMEA, and Asia Pacific including hedge funds, traditional asset managers, pension funds, mutual funds, and financial institutions.
 We challenge our employees every day to think creatively and innovate across silos and across platforms.
 Join us!

Title: Quality Assurance Analyst (QA Analyst) - Canadian Business Banking (1 year Contract)
Description:
Requisition ID: 156783  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Quality Assurance Analyst (QA Analyst) – Canadian Business Banking (1 year Contract)

 Purpose

 Reporting to the Manager, Business Acceptance, the QA Analyst is responsible for the accuracy and integrity of the client due diligence process (KYC) including the review of the CPI and all other associated/relevant documentation for new and existing customers at onboarding and client refresh.
 The Quality Assurance Analyst operates independently day-to-day within assigned authorities/limits and uses sound judgment in the interpretation of data and instructions, and escalates issues with recommendations as required.  This role contributes to the overall success of Canadian Business Banking’s adherence to Client Due Diligence (CDD), KYC standards and document review in Canadian Business Banking ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives; ensures all activities conducted follow governing regulations, enterprise policies and business procedures.

 We are looking to hire for 3 positions for a new team!
 Accountabilities:


 Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.



 Provide an excellent collaboration experience by:

 o Taking responsibility for reviewing CPI documentation, thoroughly, promptly and accurately. o Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment. o Completing KYC refresh documents in line with established processes and procedures o Advising Relationship Managers of information gaps and requesting additional information as required. o Keeping KYC/AML knowledge current. o Maintaining a thorough knowledge of the KYC and CPI documentation requirements. o Demonstrating professionalism and commitment to adhering to established SLAs and where not possible, develop plan for communication to partners and advise/consult with Manager as appropriate; o Maintaining a good understanding of the Commercial Banking business unit’s products and services. o Actively participate in team huddles and initiatives o Escalating issues and/or concerns immediately to your supervisor for corrective action in a timely manner.


 Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all CPI and KYC/AML documentation, data, and information by:

 o Reviewing all documentation received for accuracy and thoroughness of completion by Relationship Managers in line with regulatory requirements and established procedures o Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Standards , and the Guidelines for Business Conduct o Identifying higher-risk industries/individuals (e.g., PEPs, Sanctions etc.) during new Client Onboardings, Refreshes or Remediations and escalating through the proper channels when necessary. o Working with Relationship Managers, Business Service Centres (BSC)and the necessary Bank partners in order to gather the necessary information as required. o Working closely with the Canadian Banking AML Team to complete KYC/AML remediations of existing commercial portfolios, if required within established timelines. o Maintaining an accurate log of information gaps for training purposes and establishing best practices; o Escalating complex or non-standard structures to your manager as required. o Reviewing name screening alerts in Fircosoft for Commercial Business Units that are under ACRM Lite process and dispositioning the alerts promptly and accurately.


 Ensuring strict adherence to Bank security and control procedures for customer information, data, access to systems and documents by:

 o Adhering to regulatory activities and guidelines including Privacy, Anti Money Laundering/Anti-Terrorist Financing and Know Your Customer policies o Following department guidelines for the storage, access, and delivery of client/Bank documents o Ensuring authentication of clients prior to the release of information o Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions. o Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct, and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk. o Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
 Education / Experience / Other Information:

Working knowledge of the Bank’s products and services
Works very well within a team environment, ability to work independently when necessary
Exceptional organization skills
High levels of accuracy and thoroughness to review and perfect documents
Ability to effectively and concisely communicate issues and concerns related to issues/challenges identified
Experience in back-office production, branch environment or BSC environment an asset
Ability to work non-standard hours as required
Ability to travel domestically if required


 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Developer, Technical Business Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Req Id: 380091

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 Bell Residential and Small Business provides the most innovative, industry-leading Internet, TV and Smart Home products and services to Canadians.

 The BRS Business Intelligence team collaborates with partners across the organization and provides strategic guidance supported with data. We work with the latest and greatest BI technologies like Teradata, SAS, Microstrategy and Hadoop. We enable better results through an integrated market view of customers and competition. Senior management and stakeholders rely on the timeliness, accuracy, integrity and interpretation of information provided to make critical business decisions.

 Position Description:
 Reporting to the Senior Manager of Business Intelligence, the Developer will be responsible for the management and optimization of consolidated campaign and household reporting supporting BRS and Mobility marketing and sales teams.
 
This position calls for a dynamic and resourceful specialist with proven technical and programming skills, problem-solving abilities, and operational expertise. The individual will take part in analyzing business requirements, development, ensuring consistency of definitions and business rules and materially improve our household and campaign reports. He/She will build and maintain collaborative relationships while working with partners and cross-functional teams. 
Finally, the successful candidate is a self-starter who continuously looks for ways to improve effectiveness in reporting processes as our business evolves.

 Primary Responsibilities: 
The Business Intelligence Developer will be responsible for processes and reports residing in our Unix and Teradata environments. They will execute the following tasks:

 Translate business requests into reporting solutions that enable fact-based decision making, ad-hoc analysis and insight generation.
 Maintain expert knowledge of all main data sources for the data used within the business unit and effectively utilize these data sources for reporting purposes.
 Ensure data integrity by proactively monitoring trends, investigating anomalies and variances from a variety of sources throughout the organization. This includes working with partners to understand changes in strategy, and system initiated modifications or data issues.
 Participate in the overall project life cycle. Work with other Developers and Business Analysts to ensure timely and successful project completion.
 Design and propose suitable solutions to the Business needs in collaboration with the rest of the team
 Utilize continuous improvement methodologies to proactively identify, recommend, and implement improvements to internal reporting processes and procedures.
 Capable of working on multiple projects simultaneously in a highly dynamic environment while meeting all project deadlines.
 Take ownership and accountability for deliverables, communicate proactively and escalate when required.
 Act as a subject matter expert on household marketing support with a deep understanding of tools capabilities and technology infrastructure
 Ensure all database programs meet defined IT standards and performance requirements.


 Competencies / Skills:

 Bachelor’s Degree or Masters in areas such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Business Analytics or other Bachelor’s Degree equivalent from a recognized educational institution.
 3+ years of experience working directly with data warehouses, including design and development of ETL processes, optimization, documentation, testing and deployment.
 3+ years of experience with relational database systems (Oracle and PL/SQL Server).
 3+ years of experience in SAS.
 3 years of experience with Unix, NCR-Teradata.
 Solid experience with EDW environment.
 Extremely rigorous with regards to the data and information provided.
 Experienced with Agile / Waterfall development methodologies.
 Demonstrable history of cross-team collaboration.
 Proven ability to interpret data and communicate complex problems and solutions in clear and simple language. 
Strong organizational and time management skills to meet deadlines & handle multiple and/or changing priorities.
 Excellent presentation and interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact effectively in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
 Ability to work on their own, with a minimum of supervision within a dynamic environment.
 Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).


 Preferred Qualifications/Competencies:

Experience with Bell’s legacy and Grand Maison source systems and business rules


 Experience with campaign (Unica Campaign/IBM EMM) tools 
Knowledge of Bell Canada’s Residential and Wireless Products/Pricing
 Knowledge of the telecommunications business 
Experienced in developing cubes and reports in Microstrategy 
Working experience in big data using Hadoop or cloud platforms, and related concepts and technologies


 #LI-AD1

 Additional Information:
 Position Type: Management Job Status: Regular - Full Time Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Don Mills || Canada : Ontario : Mississauga || Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Quebec : Montreal Application Deadline: 07/19/2022

 Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

 At Bell, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities.

 Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions regarding accessible employment at Bell please email our Diversity & Inclusion Team at inclusion@bell.ca.

 Bell, one of Canada's Top 100 Employers.

Title: Senior Power BI Developer
Description:
Our Oil & Gas client is looking for a Senior Power BI Developer for a 6-month contract with possible extensions in Calgary, AB to work with their Production Operations Team.
Location: Downtown Calgary (NOT Remote)
Responsibilities:

Develop new Microsoft Power BI dashboards and enhance and maintain existing Power BI reports
Manage the end-to-end development cycle of Power BI reports from concept to deployment
Process and manage large quantities of data through SQL, DAX, and other languages to support the back-end data needs for our business intelligence applications
Develop and update technical documentation for BI solutions
Provide operational support for Power BI
Understand and implement access controls to reports and data
Continually enhance the usability and performance of our BI Dashboards and Reporting solution
Lead and attend feedback sessions to improve BI and Reporting
Train and educate end-users on the usage and capabilities of Power BI
Create and expand solutions utilizing other Power Platform tools, like Power Automate and Power Apps

Qualifications and Experience:

Strong Power BI Development skills in both visualizations and data modeling (including DAX)
A solid grasp of data modeling concepts for the creation of PBI dataset
Experience with Production Operations data is a must

Soft Skills:

Can work in rapid changing and not very structured environment
Self-starter and can perform without too much direction
Flexible and can deal with changes in priorities
Attention to detail and accuracy
Strong organization, planning and communication skills

Please note that while all applications are appreciated, only candidates selected for interview will be contacted. Title: Category Business Analyst, Christmas
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibly embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
What you’ll do 
The Category Business Analyst plays a direct role helping equip Canadians for the jobs and joys of life in Canada, by managing vendor processes, examining new and existing product lines, and performing analysis that better prepares us to meet the evolving needs of our customers. 
As a key member of our buying team you will be at the hub of our retail organization. You will support Category Business Managers in creating a compelling and relevant assortment for our stores by providing robust analysis and key insights that strengthen the brand with our customers and that deliver against the category level objectives and financial goals. 
Who you are 
We are looking for individuals who are: 
• Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment 
• Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business 
• Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business 
• Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward 
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be. 
What you bring 
• You have an undergraduate and/or post graduate degree in Business, Commerce, Retail Management or Data & Analytics with experience in retail in an analytical role, is an asset. New graduates are welcome to apply! 
• Demonstrated ability to collaborate, influence, and negotiate with colleagues or more senior business members 
• Strong presentation skills with demonstrated ability to adjust style and format as required to suit the audience 
Our best Category Business Analysts are progressive thinkers, with solid experience in retail merchandising/buying, and managing cross-functional partnerships. This group is masterful at project coordination and planning, and have highly accomplished quantitative, problem-solving skills. To be successful in this role, you should have an analytical mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data in order to create recommendations. 
About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. To learn more follow us on LinkedIn. 


  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Merchandising 
 

  Ontario-Toronto 
 

  Permanent 
 

  Full-time

Title: HR Systems Analyst
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY  As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

 OVERVIEW:
 
OpenText is looking for strong candidate to be part of a diverse team responsible for technical implementation and ongoing management of SuccessFactors system. The SuccessFactors Reporting Analyst will be responsible for technical delivery of SuccessFactors reporting module at OpenText.
 This candidate will be an integral part of the Open Text IT Enterprise Business Systems organization while partnering with the HR organization to deliver reporting solutions to meet business needs. 
Please note that this is a temporary position. #INDOT

 WHAT YOU WILL DO:
 
The SuccessFactors Reporting Analyst will have the following responsibilities:

 Work with the HR and IT teams and be responsible for design, creation, and management of reports specific in the SAP SuccessFactors suite
 Own ongoing day to day technical support in aspects of SuccessFactors reporting 
Leverage best practice technology solutions to continually upgrade and improve the implemented SuccessFactors suite particularly Reporting Center, WFA and People Analytics 
Work with HR and IT resources to define reporting system role-based security.
 Provide ongoing technical expertise and operational consultation on system functionality, system upgrades, configuration, and reporting/analytics.
 Work with SAP SF to create and resolve incidents for the business.
 He/she will act as a mentor and counsel junior team members.


 WHAT YOU’LL BRING:
 
Required Technical and Professional Expertise

 Minimum 5 years’ experience in SuccessFactors reporting
 Has experience with full cycle (end-to-end) implementations of SuccessFactors Employee Central.
 Have proven extensive relevant experience in understanding People data analysis and reporting
 Candidates must be have SuccessFactors reporting experience including WFA, Advanced Reporting, Canvas reports, and People Analytics.
 Good understanding of HR specific business processes
 Self-starter that is capable of working effectively as part of a team; in-person and remotely
 Strong skills, including analytical thinking, problem solving, and superior communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
 Training in other modules of SuccessFactors HCM suite
 Previous employment in a Human Resources-related capacity; technical roles in integration Payroll, Recruiting and Compensation are a strong plus
 Previous experience with Nakisa Hanelly a strong plus


 
OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com).

 Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Specialist, Business Intelligence, Strategic Information Management, BC Mental Health & Substance Use Services – Vancouver, BC
Description:
Specialist, Business Intelligence, Strategic Information Management
 BC Mental Health & Substance Use Services
   Vancouver, BC
 



 As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.



What you’ll do


Architect and implement analytics solutions to develop, enhance and improve analytics and use of data at various BCMHSUS programs and external stakeholders. This includes leading the design, development, documentation and implementation of complex data marts, multidimensional cubes or other semantic models, reports, dashboards and other front-end interfaces.
Architect and implement optimal database schemas and ETL solutions to integrate data from various source systems into integrated linked data marts. Collaborates with other members of the team on conceptual design, development, and implementation of the Enterprise Data Warehouse.
Lead the identification of new data sources and implements data extraction routines from departmental feeder systems. Provides advice and direction on data availability and quality. Consults and problem-solves with feeder departments regarding routine data extracts.
Participate in the development, definition and reporting of performance indicators as related to program operations, access and throughput, for use at the program director and executive level. Liaises on behalf of the agency with external consultants on the provisioning of patient specific data, as well as providing education on analysis and interpretation.
Provide technical expertise in the development of Analytics and Business Intelligence solutions by assessing client needs and requirements, reviewing technical options, determining the design and architecture and leading all levels of the solution development and deployment.
Ensure the designed solutions meet the established architectural, security, and quality standards set by the department by actively engaging peers and leads in design and review processes. Maintains current metadata, definitions and documentation of the solutions.


What you bring




A level of education, training, and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Health Information Science, Management Information Systems or a related field, plus 3 to 5 years of recent BI, data warehousing, data modelling or analytics experience. Strong understanding of health care system operations and public and population health concepts is definite asset.
Advanced knowledge, and experience in application of best practices of data standards, database design, data architecture and modelling.
Expertise in developing ETL solutions, relational and multi-dimensional databases and data marts.
Superior database querying, and query optimization skills using Structured Query Language -preferably T-SQL, MDX or DAX or equivalents
Knowledge of experience with BI and visualizations tools such as Microsoft Power BI, and Tableau, and collaboration solutions such as SharePoint.
Proven hands-on experience with standard data warehousing and Business Intelligence tools such as Microsoft SQL Server, Integration Services (SSIS), Analysis Services (SSAS), Reporting Services (SSRS), and related development tools and version control tools, or comparable technologies from other vendors.




 What we bring




   Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
 

Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Perks include access to fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.




 Job Type: Regular, Full- Time (1.00 FTE)

Location: 4949 Heather Street, Vancouver BC V5Z 3L7

Applications will be accepted until position is filled.

Hours of Work: Monday – Friday; 0800-1600.

Requisition # 126161




 What we do




   BC Mental Health & Substance Use Services (BCMHSUS) cares for people with complex mental health and substance use challenges.
 



   BCMHSUS is part of the Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA).
 



   The Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, manages and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose.
 



   Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services
 



   PHSA and BCMHSUS are committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.
 



 ATTN: PHSA Employees:




   To be considered as a PHSA employee (internal applicant) for this position,
   you must apply online via your internal profile at 
http://internaljobs.phsa.ca




   Please note the internal job posting has 
  expired, please contact the Internal Jobs Help Desk and advise that you would like to be considered as a late internal applicant for this position. 
  Please do not apply for the external job posting.




   If you have not registered your internal profile, a password is required to log in for the first time. To obtain your password, please contact the 
  Internal Jobs Help Desk at 604-875-7264 or 1-855-875-7264. Please note regular business hours are Monday – Friday (excluding stats), 8:30am to 4:30pm. For inquiries outside of regular business hours, please email the Internal Jobs Help Desk at internaljobshelpu@phsa.ca and a Help Desk Representative will contact you the next business day.

Title: Architecture, Development and BI Director
Description:
Company Description
  Become a part of AIM’s growing success. 
American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a recognized global leader in the metal recycling industry, with more than 125 site locations and 3500 employees worldwide. We have continued to prosper for the last eight decades (we just celebrated our 86th birthday!) thanks to the dedication of our employees and the ongoing trust and support of our customers.
 Become part of team AIM, a growing team who has over the years, successfully evolved into a multifaceted company with business divisions that include metal recycling (AIM Recycling), construction waste recycling (AIM Eco-Centre), manufacturing of solder assemblies (AIM Solder), demolition and decommissioning (AIM Delsan) and auto-recycling (Kenny U-Pull). We take pride in doing good things for the environment to help create a greener, more sustainable future for all.
 It’s simple; we do it right. We AIM for excellence.
 What we offer! 

Competitive salary + other perks
 Group insurance & RRSP program
 Company-wide events throughout the year (BBQ, Holiday party etc.)
 Free gym on site
 Two cafeterias on site (subsidized meal program available)
 Dynamic & rewarding work environment- work on high-impact, meaningful projects while also having fun!




 Job Description
  Capitalizing on knowledge about the business environment, the organization’s customers, markets, products/services, competitors as well as their expertise in technology.
 The Architecture, Development & BI Director is expected to:

 Provide vision and insight into the development of the IT organization’s strategy.
 Demonstrate leadership and expertise for business technology initiatives.
 Ensure trans-enterprise integration of business processes, technology solutions, data, customer experience, etc. to drive competitive capability, innovation, and new revenue.

 The Architecture, Development & BI Director is also expected to keep the business running by ensuring the integrity of all technology systems and solutions, whether owned and operated by the firm or supplied by third parties.
 The individual will report to the CIO and as such will have close and regular contact with senior management peers to develop and review strategies and initiatives.
 The individual will exploit technology as a critical aspect of the customer, client, and employee value proposition within the context of risk and benefits.
 As a leader of the IT department, they are expected to develop strong relationships with their team and facilitate connected thinking between the IT department and the rest of the organization.
 They will have regular contact with regulators and other external partners, and are expected to develop a network of vendors, advisors, and peers through membership in professional association, attendance at conferences, and other events, and through the use of social networks.
 Key Accountabilities

 Technology Leadership & Innovation: Seize opportunities created by emerging technologies to facilitate innovation in business models, products, and services; uses information and technology to drive value into and from the customer experience; develops solutions for complex business problems that require ingenuity and creativity.
 Enterprise Architecture: Develop and oversees the EA program; facilitates trans-enterprise integration by providing natural mutual points of engagement and communication both within and outside the organization; optimizes the delivery of business services at the enterprise level to realize the corporate strategy.
 Investment Management: Manage the risk‐efficient investment of enterprise capital and other factors within the context of the organization's innovation goals; exploits ideas for change and manages them as a portfolio of investments.
 Solutions Facilitation: Manage service providers and ensures their products are secure, integrated, and cost effective; establishes a converged cloud approach and manages the lifecycle of the services requested by the business; responsible for services governance and its sourcing from the right provider.
 Technology Stewardship: Manage and maintain the information technology of the organization, ensuring the technological stability of the organization, and building IT functional capabilities; responsible for all aspects of developing and implementing technology initiatives within the organization.
 Information Security: Manage information security architecture, information risk management, information privacy, security and information assurance, etc.
 Business Strategy: Contribute to the growth of the organization using understanding of the organization’s industry, core functions, products, services, customers, and competitors.
 Stakeholder Engagement & Management: Identify, build, and maintain formal and informal networks and constructive relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. It includes leveraging stakeholders to influence positive outcomes for the organization.
 Data Stewardship: Help drive the growth of the organization through better management and delivery of data throughout the enterprise.
 Management: Manage growth and direction of all the resources of their team to achieve the strategic goals of the organization and the objectives of all business and functional units.




 Qualifications
  Formal Education & Certification

 A graduate degree in Business or Management supported by a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering or other related discipline with an IT focus is preferred, or equivalent work experience.

 Knowledge & Experience

 At least 10 years of experience leading strategic business transformation initiatives and/or major development programs.
 A minimum of five years of experience in strategic planning.
 Proven experience with technologies such as ERP, collaboration tools, data collection, consolidation and analytic/business intelligence tools, social networking platforms, etc.
 Proven experience in researching, evaluating, negotiating, and managing third-party service providers.
 A minimum of five years of management experience leading an IT department or other business unit, including demonstrated competency in:
 Leadership and stakeholder relationship management (external and internal).
 The complex analysis of business structure and processes, and the design of effective and efficient solutions to address complex business issues.
 Leading multidisciplinary work teams.
 Implementing organizational change within that department/business unit.
 Demonstrated knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws, and other industry-relevant regulations.
 Proven ability to architect and present technology alternatives based on a business concept.
 Demonstrates strong business acumen and understands the key business drivers for performance and growth, and the use of sound business practices.

 Additional Information
  American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are given consideration regardless of race, religion, colour, gender, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class as provided in applicable employment laws.
 Although we’d love to be able to speak with everyone that applies, due to the volume of applicants we receive and time constraints, only those selected to move forward will be contacted.

Title: Analyst, Tax [Transfer Pricing]
Description:
Who we are You know those big cities that still feel like small towns? Where everyone’s friendly and helps each other out? That’s like Grant Thornton. Except here we’re all professionals and there isn’t a mayor or a general store. What we’re trying to say is that we’re a large and growing professional services firm that still feels like a community. We employ over 2500 people across Canada, and we truly care about our colleagues, our clients and the communities where we work and live. That’s what’s most important to us. We’re building a thriving organization that’s purpose driven and still want to remember what your favourite milkshake flavour is.

 A career in Tax with Grant Thornton will provide you an opportunity to:


Work with a team of professionals who assist individuals and businesses with a wide of tax services
Be part of a unique work culture that challenges you to further your professional development and enlarge your chosen career path
Be part of a fast growing environment with well-respected professionals who are locally and internationally renowned in their respective field
Develop solutions with clients and co-workers through collaborative efforts and discussions
Be engaged with clients on a variety of local and national projects



 As an Analyst, Tax [Transfer Pricing] some of your responsibilities will include, but not limited to:


Participating in fact gathering and undertake industry research
Analyze financial statements
Analyzing financial statements and assist the team with economic analyses
Writing reports and other business communication
Working with large sets of accounting and transactional data
Supporting the team in the resolution of transfer pricing audits by tax authorities
Staying abreast of global transfer pricing, tax and business developments
Developing presentations for clients, colleagues and other teams within the firm



Be Grant Thornton If you’re a bit like us, you’re driven to connect with how others are feeling and thinking. Here we walk in others shoes before taking action. Just imagine being part of a team that puts “we before me”, where flexAbility is a mindset, and where you trust your colleagues to have your back. At Grant Thornton, you’ll work with inspiring leaders who support your development, both personally and professionally. This is a place where your insatiable curiosity enables you to think, see and hear from a variety of perspectives, a place where every day is different and having the courage to grow is part of who you are. And when all this comes together, well that’s when the magic happens!

 Want to learn more about who we are and how we live our purple every day? Read our colleagues’ stories at www.discoveryourpurple.ca


Think you’ve got what it takes to be an Analyst, Transfer Pricing? Like the color purple? Great! Here's a few more boxes we’re also hoping you can tick:


Master’s (preferred) or Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business (Finance), Law, and/or an Accounting designation, JD/LLB or LLM
Proven analytical, problem-solving, communication (oral and written), organization and interpersonal skills
Experience with business writing
Proficient in MS Office tools such as Word, PowerPoint and Excel
Able to multi-task working with numerous deadlines
Eagerness to learn and a commitment to deliver an exceptional client experience


 At Grant Thornton we’re focused on making a difference in the lives of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. That’s our purpose. Or, as we like to say, living our purple.  Are you ready to Discover Your Purple?







#LI-HYBRID








Grant Thornton LLP is committed to employment equity, human rights and respectful workplace principles throughout the life cycle of employment, including at the recruitment and hiring stages. We welcome applications from members of all equity deserving groups, including persons with disabilities, women, racialized and/or Indigenous applicants. Should you require accommodation in relation to the recruitment process, please notify us by emailing careers@ca.gt.com and we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs.

Title: Senior Associate - Business Intelligence Sales Support - BMO Global Asset Management
Description:
Address: 100 King Street West 
 







Job Family Group: 






Data Analytics & Reporting 
 
Job Description: 

BMO Global Asset Management (GAM) is seeking a subject matter expert to manage and upgrade BMO GAM’s Salesforce CRMs. The candidate must have hands-on Salesforce upgrade and development experience as they will be responsible for the strategic direction of the BMO GAM Salesforce CRM upgrade and evolution project. This involves managing a project budget of $2m to overhaul BMO GAM’s current CRM structure. This will include upgrading the CRM instance, improving data integration and growing adoption across the various sales teams. Following the project completion the candidate will work closely with the Sales Strategy team to leverage the CRM to drive sales results. This includes providing advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Also championing newly released CRM features including presenting to end stakeholders. 

Manages people and leads a team capable of delivering the desired business results. 
Maintain direct responsibility for updates, support and maintenance of the production Salesforce and CRM environment 
Provide Salesforce and CRM support for all BMO Retail Investment users, involves administration of the Salesforce and CRM component including user profiles and all updates through the “admin” console. 
Ability to distill complex business asks/requirements to simple, implementable solutions 
Assist with coordinating new product information and service changes to Sales force, Client Service, Dealer Service and Information Service groups. 
Liaise with IFG to actively manage the day-to-day product support requirements of Client Services, Dealer Services and Unit Holder Support as required. 
Leads the design, development, and implementation of analytic solutions. 
Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business 
Strong communicator, comfortable presenting to large audiences and engaging all stakeholders 
This candidate must be capable of juggling competing deadlines and multiple projects at once 
Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of new analytics & reporting solutions. 
Automates validation tests to improve quality and efficiency of the validation process. 
Promotes reporting automation, self-serve analytics consumption, and the culture of analytics-driven decision making. 
Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues. 
Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting. 
Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights. – Nice to have 
Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations. 
Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences. 
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives. 


Qualifications: 

In depth knowledge of Salesforce CRM platform, including underlying infrastructure – expert 
Experience launching large scale technology projects, with a history of delivering innovative solutions 
Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Previous management experience 
Knowledge of asset management / financial services industry – nice to have 
Ability to train and influence sales teams - In-depth. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Data driven decision making - In-depth. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence and Reporting
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

The Treasury and Balance Sheet Management (TBSM) department of TD Bank is responsible for overseeing the management of TD Bank’s Canadian and US P&C: non-trading market risk, consolidated liquidity risk and consolidated capital position. The Closed Balance Sheet team (CBS) is integral for the bank to accurately represent the true costs/benefits of our product offerings by ensuring Funds Transfer Pricing (FTP) is accurate. CBS takes a thought leadership approach by collaborating with treasury management to identify, quantify & determine root causes for any deviation to the FTP framework and the resolution of structural balance sheet measurement discrepancies. The team is responsible for socializing findings and solutions with senior management.  Additionally, CBS is responsible for timely and relevant management reporting, planning, forecasting and analysis. The results provide TBSM's management with rich and detailed analytical insights and the requisite information to better manage TD's balance sheet.  Culture:  The CBS team will ensure a culture which focuses on development, open mindedness, collaboration & value add initiatives. Emphasis will especially be placed on developing team members by ensuring a teaching culture is in place while valuing diversity. Collaboration is crucial for team successes and the team operates with a best idea wins attitude amongst all team members.




Job Description

The Senior Manager will lead and develop a small team of finance professionals and collaborate with various groups across TD - Treasury, Finance, Finance Operations, Chief Accountants, Risk Management and Technology.  The CBS team owns, reports and analyzes all components of the TBSM P&L. As a centralized function, the CBS team act as ambassadors for TBSM across the bank when discussing key drivers of P&L results which can include, FTP framework changes, hedging strategies, hedge accounting results, funding, capital and liquidity movements.  CBS is also a key control function for TBSM through which the bank's financial results, transfer pricing and risk management are reviewed for alignment. The candidate will have to develop an in-depth understanding of how the Banks' business and hedging activities manifest in financial reporting; how the bank's activities are represented in the transfer pricing management view of results; and how financial reporting and management reporting can differ. This role will provide an excellent opportunity for the successful candidate to lead a team in understanding key NII drivers in Canada and US, explain results and PnL implications, and more generally analyzing the structural balance sheet issues.  Key responsibilities of this position include:

 Concurrently lead multiple cross-functional projects to:
      
 Investigate and address highly complex issues identified through investigations and CBS results, and constantly question the status quo while following the financial and reporting implications of day to day treasury operations
 Develop new measurement processes and reporting capabilities
 Leverage TD's infrastructure, tools and technologies in order for the team to function more efficiently and deliver results more effectively

 Provide oversight of the monthly reporting and ad hoc requirements, as well as ensure the process to measure and report the CBS results remains cohesive and sustainable
 Develop a team of finance professionals to help deepen knowledge of Treasury and Balance Sheet Management principles, strengthen data analytics skills, improve the presentation of business results, and identify and implement value-add opportunities
 Foster a motivating and engaging work environment focused on developing, and enhancing the team's capabilities




Job Requirements

Job Requirements This position requires a highly results-oriented individual who has:

 5-7 years of experience in finance / accounting, bank treasury or other relevant experience
 Post-secondary degree in Finance, Math or Economics
 Valued designation: CA, CMA, FRM, CFA, MBA
 In depth knowledge of:
    
 Features and characteristics of banking products
 Accounting, Financial Controls and Capital Markets concepts
 FTP and hedging concepts and their application to personal and commercial loan and deposit products and their impact on financial reporting
 Asset/Liability Theory and Fixed Income portfolio management concepts and techniques (e.g. duration, convexity, key rate immunization)
 Experience with:
    
 Producing and analyzing management reporting results as well as managing projects, gathering and analyzing business requirements
 Leading initiatives across different departments and business segments
 Reporting complex financial concepts in business terms understandable by audiences with varied backgrounds and seniority levels
 Competencies and Personal Qualities:
    
 Curious by nature
 Exceptional organizational skills, and ability to prioritize and manage many different competing requirements simultaneously
 Ability to teach skills and concepts to colleagues and staff
 Ability to develop good business relationships with internal stakeholders and influence change
 Be able to prioritize CBS work and explain the importance to internal and external partners (FTP, market risk measurement, liquidity, investments, finance etc.)
 Develop a talent pipeline
 Quick to learn and apply new concepts
 Strong work ethic, ability to take initiative and balance multiple tasks
 Demonstrated strong analytical abilities
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly with Senior Management
 Must be able to think conceptually (“out-of-the-box”) and have a high degree of attention for detail
 Proactive and highly motivated individual who will take the initiative and who can work independently and in a team environment
 Role requires ability to perform in an ambiguous environment with potentially changing priorities and tight deadlines




Additional Information

    #LI-Hybrid
   


Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

    Business Intelligence and Reporting

    Enterprise Data & Analytics

    37.5

    Other

    Regular 
   


Country

    Canada

City (Primary)

    TD Centre - TD Tower - 66 Wellington Street West

Title: Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Portfolio Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity? 

RBC Global Asset Management (RBC GAM) is the asset management division of Royal Bank of Canada. RBC GAM is a provider of global investment management services and solutions to individual and institutional investors. RBC GAM manages approximately $560 billion in assets and has approximately 1,500 employees located across Canada, the United States, Europe and Asia. For more information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com

 The Investment Products Advisory Group (IPAG) supports the positioning of RBC GAM investment solutions and capital markets views across Canadian retail and private client distribution channels. The team specializes in providing product support and producing impactful investment content in collaboration with our investment teams and marketing partners.

 The ultimate goal of IPAG is to empower RBC GAM distribution teams with the resources they need to deliver best-in-class service to advisors and help them drive better client conversations. The Portfolio Analyst plays a critical role within the team, developing and maintaining a broad range of resources that communicate our investment capabilities, while delivering highly responsive and exceptional service to our channels.

 In this role you will collaborate with other members of the Investment Products Advisory Group as well as our investment teams, marketing partners and sales teams. You will be responsible for ensuring that our sales teams have the investment insights, education and presentation materials required to promote and position these strategies to their clients. You will become the subject matter expert in the strategies that you cover, with the ultimate objective of actively participating in the delivery of presentations to sales teams, advisors and clients.

 What will you do? 

Direct accountability within the Investment Products Advisory Group for developing and maintaining deep knowledge of specific investment strategies, market conditions and portfolio positioning that can empower our sales teams with the information they need to successfully position GAM capabilities with their clients.
 Direct responsibility for the production and maintenance of advisor and client facing materials across a variety of asset classes and strategy types including slides, research and sales materials as required.
 Actively participate in the development and delivery of presentations to sales teams, advisors and clients as experience and familiarity develops.
 Produce timely, relevant and substantial investment-related content that can be used to galvanize GAM’s credibility and leadership position as a trusted asset manager. This includes writing commentary and articles in response to markets trends, as well as editing and modifying content for specific target audiences.
 Produce consistent, high-quality product-related content that communicates portfolio strategy, positioning, results, market insights and/or capital markets views. These include pitch decks, fund commentaries, slides, and sales materials as required.
 Work closely with RBC GAM portfolio management teams and distribution teams in the communication of investment product and market-related information as a subject-matter expert.
 Maintain a detailed understanding of RBC GAM’s investment philosophies and processes and be able to concisely relay this information in verbal and written communications.


 What do you need to succeed? 

Must Have

 5-10 years of experience in the financial services industry
 Exceptional written communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
 CFA designation (candidate or charterholder)
 Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills, specifically related to charting, formatting, and data analysis
 An ability to work independently and prioritize across numerous tasks and various stakeholders
 Innovative self-starter with acute attention to detail and strong organizational skills with ability to work in high pressure situations
 Team player with the ability to work independently and to prioritize and multitask in an unstructured environment in order to meet tight timelines


 Nice to Have 

A strong understanding of the retail banking landscape and its investor base; client facing experience a strong asset
 Previous experience developing and writing investment-related content, particularly in a fast-paced environment
 Experienced with Morningstar Direct and Bloomberg, some familiarity with VBA
 Bilingual French communication would be an asset


 What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Flexible work/life balance options
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
 Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies







































 Job Summary










































































 Address:




































 TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

2022-06-29-07:00

 Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.  We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.













































































































 Join our Talent Community  Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.  Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description:
Nucleo Digital is searching for Technical Business Analysts for an ongoing large-scale transformation initiative. 
Requirements
 What will you do? 

Plan and execute detailed system requirements phases and identify, track, and resolve business systems issues 
Assess, research, analyze, and document stakeholder needs, using the recommended or selecting the appropriate information gathering and/or modelling technique to elicit requirements 
Contribute to successful completion of project objectives with high quality, within budget, and on time 
Review test plans scenarios, cases as needed 
Support Development, Quality Assurance and User Acceptance Testing activities 
Build and maintain a repository of reusable system documentation 
Identifying risks, dependencies, assumptions and constraints 
Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, stakeholders, and business unit partners through all project phases 

What do you need to succeed? 

5+ years experience as a Business Systems Analyst and/or as a Data Analyst with progressively increasing responsibilities in the areas of requirements management on large and complex projects
Experience with vendor integrations
Excellent leadership skills
Strong data analysis skills - Experience with data mapping, data dictionaries and creating data catalogues

Agile Framework experience
Experience with Microsoft Office suite; Visio; Lucidchart, Jira; Confluence
Strong verbal and written communication skills
