Results oriented
Organized and detailed oriented
Organized with strong time management
Teamwork and Cooperation




Benefits
 What this contract position has to offer:

Competitive rates commensurate with experience
Supportive, challenging, and collaborative work environment

Title: Business Solutions Analyst, HR (Workday)
Description:
Company:
  Finning International Inc.
 

   Number of Openings:
  1
 

   Worker Type:
  Permanent
 

   Position Overview:
  The HRIS Business Solutions Analyst will provide technical expertise and support complex business processes implemented in Workday and/or other HR applications at Finning. This role will support the global Human Resources organization through needs assessments, reviewing functionality and provide recommendations on enhancements to align with business strategies. Working with project managers, this role will play a key part in delivering enhancements through diligent testing, quality control and focusing on security as well as data integrity. The Business Solution Analyst will work directly with HR users providing support and technical troubleshooting, requiring those in the role to have strong communication skills.
 

   Job Description:
 


 Translate business requirements into functional technical specifications
 Provide support according to SLA’S when analyzing software problems, data issues, and workflows and recommending solutions
 Test automatically delivered enhancements as part of Vendor Releases
 Provide data interpretation and analytics through reporting, audits and collection of human resources data to support complex operational decisions
 Prepare/maintain detailed support documentation for assigned business systems
 Collaborate with relevant stakeholders on upgrades, patches, enhancements, testing, validation and overall performance management of the system
 Provide guidance about security
 Provide data management guidance, procedures and policies
 Work with HR Operations teams globally to understand the needs of the HR and related communities



   Specific Skills:
 

 Strong analytical and problem solving skills
 Strong attention to detail
 Strong communication skills. Concise and clear written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to adapt to the needs of specific audiences
 Solid time management, planning and prioritization skills, with an ability to manage multiple task and priorities concurrently
 Solid organizational, interpersonal and customer service skills
 Resilience, with the ability to adapt under changing business priorities
 Ability to continue to learn and develop



   Knowledge/Experience:
 

 Post-Secondary Diploma or Degree in a related Information Technology (IT) discipline or HR discipline
 Experience with Cloud based HR technology is preferred, specific Workday Experience an asset
 3-5 years related HRIS analysis, business system analysis & support experience
 Combination of Education and/or experience related to a specific business area is required



   Education & Experience:
 

 Post-Secondary Diploma or Degree in a related Information Technology (IT) discipline.
 Formal education in specific applications, tools and languages.
 Minimum 5 years of experience in business analysis and application design
 Education and/or experience related to a specific business area is required.
 Experience with Agile Development Methodology



   We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst, Credit Risk
Description:
Overview 

 At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions. 

 Risk Analytics @ Neo 

 Neo’s Credit Risk team works hard to enable a high growth portfolio with sound risk management principles while optimizing credit decisioning across the customer lifecycle. This team of high-performers leads the development and implementation of key credit risk strategies to effectively manage the lending portfolio inline with our business objectives. 

 The Role 

 Neo is looking for a data driven individual with strong knowledge of advanced analytical techniques to join our team in our Calgary headquarters. Leveraging your knack for data and a strong statistical foundation, you’ll make an immediate impact via development and deployment of advanced analytical techniques across our credit and fraud decisioning projects. You’ll be contributing to our innovative, strategic, and high-performance team with a mission to improve the financial experience for all Canadians. 


What you'll be doing:
 Develop reporting capabilities to actively monitor performance, and identify trends to enable strategic business decisions Analyze risk profiles across the credit lifecycle, leveraging advanced analytics and machine learning to best identify exposure/opportunities Forecast key business metrics including vintage loss rates, approval rates, loan conversion rates, and credit quality for new initiatives and marketing campaigns Collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization to integrate foundational risk practices 


Who we're looking for:
 1-3 years experience in data analytics; experience in risk management considered an asset Strong knowledge of SQL, R and Python Data-driven, eager to understand the numbers and provide meaningful insights Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to adapt communication to different audiences Self-starter, highly focused; driven to achieve business objectives Self-organized, ability to prioritize effectively Able to collaborate with others, engage stakeholders purposefully 


About applying with us:
 At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future. 

 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Sr. Business Analyst - Market Infrastructure Program
Description:
Equivalent Experience 


Description:
 The purpose of the Regulatory and Business Initiatives Group is to provide support to Global Banking and Markets (GBM) and International Banking (and in some cases at the Enterprise level) to deliver large scale initiatives which require in-depth technical knowledge of products, technology or process and to ensure that change is delivered strategically and in a fiscally responsible manner. 

Project: The Business Analyst will support the GBM Market Infrastructure (GBM MI) program, a new project that was recently stood up and has several workstreams that are interrelated with overlapping requirements. 
Reporting to the Associate Director, the Business Analyst is responsible for the following but not limited to: 


Facilitate and follow a structured approach to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate, and manage business requirements with stakeholders by applying a variety of elicitation techniques to probe, challenge and understand requirements.
Establish and maintain requirements traceability
Identify, document and validate current state processes and work with the business and stakeholders to design the desired future state.
Provide recommendations and direction based on the end-to-end customer experience and lead the prioritization of requirements and leverage data where available when making decisions.
Work collaboratively with relevant stakeholders to support business benefits and changes to business processes, policies and systems across lines of business.
Collaborate with technology, business and provide recommendations to support our partners' development of system requirements and design, testing plans, change management plans, deployment plan, artifacts/deliverables to ensure business needs are met.
Proactively identify and document risks, issues, assumptions, dependencies, constraints.
Communicates progress on BA work packages, including requirements management, in a concise and timely manner, escalating issues to project manager, partners and manager where appropriate
Foster a positive and cohesive team environment / culture that encourages productivity, innovation, process improvement, teamwork and a high-level of professionalism.

Note: The BA will support multiple workstreams on the GBM MI program. 


Skills:
 Business Analyst, Settlements, MIFID, CFTC, Dodd Frank, Requirements gathering, Stakeholder Management 


Additional Skills & Qualifications:
 MUST HAVE's 
1. Business Analyst Exp - 5+ years 
2. Regulatory Exp - 5+ years (implementation or remediation of CFTC, Dodd Frank, MIFID II and/or other similar regulations or initiatives) 
3. Capital Markets products / processes especially in relation to third party products or services 
NICE TO HAVE's 
1. Bloomberg (BPSA / Entities and Corporate Actions Module / Cage / ATON) 
2. Prior Regulatory Exp 


Experience Level:
 Expert Level 


À propos d'Aston Carter:
 Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. 
Aston Carter s'engage fermement à offrir un service de premier ordre aux clients et aux professionnels du milieu des affaires dans un vaste éventail de disciplines, notamment la comptabilité, la finance, la gouvernance ainsi que la gestion du risque et de la conformité. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients. 
Reconnu "best of staffing" par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aston Carter s'engage à livrer un service hors pair a tous nos partenaires d'affaire. 


About Aston Carter:
 Aston Carter is a distinguished global provider of recruitment and staffing services to companies requiring highly specialized business professionals. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aston Carter has an unrivaled commitment to delivering first class service to clients and business professionals across a variety of disciplines, including Accounting and Finance as well as Governance, Risk and Compliance. With more than 60 offices across Europe, Asia Pacific and North America, Aston Carter provides local, regional and global expertise to drive value and meet our customers' unique needs. Aston Carter is a division of Aerotek. Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, a global talent solutions provider. 

 The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Title: Retirement Actuarial Analyst Intern - Calgary - Fall 2022
Description:
We’re Mercer - a global consulting leader in health, wealth and career. Mercer has more than 25,000 colleagues based in 43 countries. We help clients worldwide from small businesses to Fortune 1000 companies advance the health, wealth and performance of their most vital asset – their people. 

At Mercer, we believe that diversity and inclusion are vital components of our future and our goal is to leverage the unique skillsets that each person brings to the company. We provide our employees with a supportive, collaborative environment that leads to innovative ideas and the ability to make an impact. If you thrive on a challenge and enjoy connecting with people, we’re looking for you!

 WHAT A TYPICAL DAY LOOKS LIKE IN WEALTH (RETIREMENT) CONSULTING BUSINESS 

Perform retirement actuarial valuations including validation of data, analysis of the plan’s gains and losses, analysis of the plan’s asset performance, and preparation of the valuation report and related forms
 Production of year-end accounting disclosure and projection of expenses for plans under various financial reporting standards including IFRS, CPA and FAS
 Complete benefit calculations, review plan documents, produce employee benefit statements and prepare annual government forms
 Participation in the design and pricing of employee pension plans and executive pension benefits, including cash flow modelling, demographic projections and evaluation of liabilities within an asset-liability framework
 Production of various experience studies to refine demographic and financial assumptions used in actuarial valuations
 Designing and implementing strategies to manage defined benefit pension plan volatility, including funding strategy, plan design and risk transfer solutions
 Work in an integrated team of professionals from different offices to resolve modern actuarial problems in the Canadian pension landscape, including union negotiations, risk transfer and public policy


 WHAT WE VALUE?

 Strong analytical skills and working knowledge of Excel and other MS-Office software programs
 Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
 Intellectual curiosity; seeking opportunities to develop new skills
 Ability to work in teams and be flexible to work under tight deadlines and changing client needs
 Superior organizational skills and strong attention to detail


 WHAT’S IN IT FOR ME? 

Be challenged to deliver impactful solutions for organizations of any size and varied industries and have a direct impact on their employees.
 Be part of our great training and development programs, including our actuarial education program
 Opportunity to work with the best tools, resources and some of the smartest people in the industry
 Be part of a work environment that promotes social connection and work-life flexibility


 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS?

 Completion of two (2) years towards a bachelor's degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, finance, or a related field when internship begins
 Pursuing an actuarial designation such as SOA


 WHAT’S NEXT?
 Please provide a cover letter, your resume and your most recent transcript, via our website at www.mercer.ca (Careers Section). We will review application submissions and you will be contacted if you are selected for an interview.

 Mercer’s roots are in Canada – founded 75 years ago and continues to be one of the elite Canadian business and employment brands. Currently, the Canadian business earns $340+M CAD in revenue and employs 1,000+ colleagues across Mercer’s core services areas. Along with Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Mercer is one of four Marsh & McLennan businesses with a significant Canadian presence.

 Mercer believes in building brighter futures by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and well-being. Mercer’s more than 25,000 employees are based in 43 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. Mercer is a business of Marsh & McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people, with 81,000 colleagues and annual revenue of $19 billion. Through its market-leading businesses including Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Marsh & McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment. For more information, visit https://www.me.mercer.com/. Follow Mercer on Twitter @Mercer.

 At Mercer, we’re creating a culture where you can bring your authentic self to work. When you join us, you bring your inclusive energy and enthusiasm to a team that values you personally and professionally – regardless of who you are, what you look like, where you were raised or born, who you love or what your religious beliefs are. You are welcome here.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst, IT Investment Applications
Description:
At IMCO, our talent is among the best! IMCO offers a uniquely stimulating and rewarding environment where you can help build and drive organizational transformation, all while seeking to challenge yourself, learn, and grow your career.
 


   We offer a culture of collaboration and passion, creating unwavering value for the clients we serve. Our vision is to be the partner of choice for Ontario’s public sector funds and build a high-performing, value-based Asset Management firm in the heart of downtown Toronto.
 


   If you are ready to drive best-in-class service, and join a collaborative, motivated, and fun team of professionals, we’re ready to offer you a great place to work with exciting opportunities for growth and development.
 


   If you want to use your expertise to drive strategic business outcomes, then we want you at IMCO!
 


 IMCO is looking for a highly motivated Senior Business Systems Analyst, IT Investment Applications to join our team!
 


   As a key member of our IT Investment Applications team, the Senior Business Systems Analyst will work as a trusted liaison with business partners in Investment Management – Public and Private Markets. This role is responsible for understanding organizational objectives, conducting analysis, eliciting business and systems requirements, designing specifications, facilitating testing, implementing solutions, and supporting production operations. The overall responsibility of the position is to deliver value-added solutions while ensuring adherence to IMCO’s procedures and the supportability of all investment applications.
 


   As a Member of Our Team You Will Be Responsible For:
 



     Act as a solution partner to investment management teams with a focus on public and private markets teams
   


     Elicit business requirements, conduct analysis, translate into technical specifications and efficient solutions to support public and private market deal teams – Private Equity, Global Credit, Infrastructure and Real Estate
   


     Support portfolio managers and analysts on trade origination, generation, and execution as part of workflow
   


     Facilitate intake with stakeholders and participate in all phases of solution delivery life cycle including support
   


     Manage small to medium-sized work items including enhancements, BAU and report development
   


     Partner with the front office, vendors, and IT infrastructure and security team to design and develop solutions to support investment strategies and corporate objectives
   


     Identify opportunities for process improvement and create forward-looking solutions for stakeholders
   


     Implement and manage new investment systems solutions to support all front-office functions, including all public and private markets asset classes, total portfolio management, and public markets alternatives
   


     Perform detailed process mapping and document findings as related to investment management and operations
   


     Contribute to business cases for systems implementations, and participate in RFP and due diligence processes
   


     Design and build optimal data access for asset class and total portfolio analytics
   


     Engage technology architects and other IT partners to determine dependency and impact on the overall investment systems architecture
   


     Design and manage testing processes to ensure completeness and traceability of high-quality solutions
   


     Investigate root causes when support issues arise, recommend changes, oversee execution, and maintain accurate documentation
   


     Disseminate knowledge and information with other staff in a collaborative manner
   


     Ensure adherence to IMCO’s processes and procedures, and the overall supportability of all solutions with proper documentation and training
   


     Strive to improve environment stability by working with others to set up and maintain production configurations
   


     Continuously improving service levels with all business users
   


     Understand operational risk and systems performance management in all initiatives
   


     Represent IT team to plan and execute DR/BCP
   



   What do you need to succeed?
 



     5+ years of experience in supporting technology applications in capital markets and asset management industry
   


     Solid understanding of trading lifecycle, investment workflow, and operational processing requirements for all asset classes and instrument types
   


     Experience with investment applications, data, business processes, and business continuity
   


     Familiar with private markets workflows such as origination and deal flow of direct and co-investment
   


     Learn new processes and systems efficiently with attention to detail
   


     Ability to collaborate effectively across multiple stakeholder groups
   


     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a logical mindset and technical aptitude
   


     Demonstrated ability to use analytics skills to analyze data and operational workflow
   


     Display a sense of ownership and take initiation to solve business problems
   


     Ability to comprehend complex business requirements and create detailed artifacts
   


     Direct working experience in all front office operations across different asset classes and teams
   


     Prior implementation experience of public and private markets investment systems such as portfolio management and analytical systems, order management systems, and research platforms, including total portfolio view and analytics by asset class and strategy is preferred
   


     Strong experience in data aggregation from multiple sources and investment reporting
   


     Ability to play multiple hands-on roles such as requirement analysis, solution design and visioning, planning, testing, solutions implementations, and support
   


     Experience with systems and data integration with book of record applications and custody platforms
   


     Knowledge of application development life cycles including planning, requirement, analysis, design, build, testing, implementation, and post-implementation activities in agile and waterfall approaches
   


     Excellent communication skills, ability to communicate comfortably with both business and technical teams
   


     Domain knowledge in IT service management such as incident management, change management, configuration management, and operations management
   


     Prior involvement with third-party vendors, internal and external operational audits
   


     Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Finance, or a related discipline
   


     CBAP, PMI-PBA, CSC, Lean and/or Six Sigma, or PMP designation is preferred
   


     Experience with CIBC Nexen, MyStateStreet, Bloomberg trading platforms, Managed Account Platform, Azure Data Platform, Eagle (Data Management, Performance and Accounting Solutions), Ortec Glass, Argus Enterprise, MSCI Risk Manager, DTCC Alert and CTM, Dynamo, FINCAD, MATLAB, SQL and Python
   


   We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 


   Our hybrid work model offers flexibility and provides our employees with the opportunity to lead a well-balanced life. Our Corporation’s offices located at 16 York Street, Suite 2400, Toronto, ON M5J 0E6 provide a welcoming space for employees to gather, work collaboratively, and grow together.
 


 IMCO is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities in its recruitment process. Please advise IMCO if you require an accommodation and we will work with you to meet your needs. Candidates being considered for this position will be required to submit to a background screening.

Title: Analyst - Risk Management (Business)
Description:
At Desjardins, we believe in equity, diversity and inclusion. We're committed to welcoming, respecting and valuing people for who they are as individuals, learning from their differences, embracing their uniqueness, and providing a positive workplace for all. At Desjardins, we have zero tolerance for discrimination of any kind. We believe our teams should reflect the diversity of the members, clients and communities we serve.
 


   If there's something we can do to help make the recruitment process or the job you're applying for more accessible, let us know. We can provide accommodations at any stage in the recruitment process. Just ask!
 


   Job Level
  NV-07
  As an Analyst - Risk Management (Business), you assist with risk management and supervision analysis, research and development.
 
 You analyze issues, support the more experienced professionals in your unit, and help prepare opinions and implementation plans in accordance with your discipline’s rules.
 
 You draw on your extensive knowledge of the sector and your ability to manage complexity to conduct research and preliminary analysis and develop initial outlines of tools and processes. You interact with stakeholders working in other fields.
 
 You assist clients and partners.
 

   General Information on the Position
 


   Main Responsibilities
 



     Identify, input, analyze and interpret data to support management decision-making and risk management and supervision control processes
   


     Analyze risks, prepare reports and help implement recommendations
   


     Help prepare and propose action plans to address issues in accordance with rules and parameters
   


     Help develop and optimize procedures and implement tools
   



   Other working conditions
 



     Work location: The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work #LI-Hybrid
   


     Number of jobs available : 1
   



   Qualifications
 



     Bachelor’s degree in a related field
   


     A minimum of one year of relevant experience
   



   Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered
 



     For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required
   



   Desjardins Cross-sector skills
  Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning
 

   Key competencies for the job
  Business insight, Complexity
 

   Work Location
  Desjardins Entreprises - Côte-Nord
 

   Trade Union
  Non Syndiqué
 

   Unposting Date
  2022-07-15
 

   Job Family
  Risk management (FG)
 

   Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

Title: Functional Analyst/BI Developer
Description:
Job Description
  As a functional analyst/BI deveoper, you’ll work within projects to transform business needs into solutions, whether these solutions result in product configurations, product custom developments, training or process recommendations.
 You will be focusing on a specific area of the portfolio and will be developing a strong expertise on its products. You will not only define solutions, but also ensure their correct implementation.
 What you’ll do

 Understand and analyze internal clients’ requirements and issues.
 Understand and analyze business context and processes surrounding requirements and issues.
 Ensure impact analysis, design and propose appropriate solutions with the support of the direct manager and development teams.
 Participate in the evaluation and benchmarking of market solutions when required.
 Assist the Project Manager in organizing projects and building plans.
 Assist development teams during the implementation of solutions.
 Prepare and execute test scenarios & scripts and accompany users & clients during certification phases.
 Deliver training and product documentation.
 Act as a trusted advisor to clients and support user training and general usage needs.
 Ensure knowledge transfer to support teams during or at the end of the project.
 Assist the support teams on complex issues encountered by product users.




 Qualifications
  What you bring

 A bachelor’s degree in Computer Sciences or in a related field
 Minimum of 3 years in functional analysis or equivalent experience
 Experience in IT projects
 Great communication skills (negotiate with clients, explain complex issues and train users)
 Business and impact analysis skills
 Problem-solving skills
 The ability to organize your work in a proactive way and to juggle multiple projects
 The ability to easily adapt to changes and proposals
 Knowledge of SQL, Excel or other data analysis and diagnosis tools
 Very good written & spoken French & English

 What to send our way

 Your CV highlighting your education, experience, and skills

 Additional Information
  About us
 Ubisoft’s 20,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come.
 Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves.
 When you join Ubi MTL, you’ll discover a workplace that sparks inspiration and connection. We offer a collaborative space that provides career advancement, a host of learning opportunities, and meaningful benefits centred on well-being.
 If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.
 At Ubisoft, you can come as you are. We embrace diversity in all its forms. We’re committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Compensation Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Manager, Compensation, the Compensation Analyst will collaborate with various partners to advance the transformation of the compensation practice. This valued member of a highly agile and transformative HR team will add value to the organization by contributing research and analysis finding to the design, implementation, and administration of compensation programs. This compensation champion will derive important data insights to inform decisions aimed to implement compensation programs that align with strategic objectives and enhance employee experience.
 This role offers the opportunity for a hybrid work arrangement.
 Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
 Market Research & Compensation Analysis (60%):

 Participate in surveys and conduct market research to monitor trends.
 Prepare data-based recommendations for employee, role, and unit reviews.
 Produce a variety of reports to support HR and Leader data-driven decision-making.

 Job Evaluation (10%):

 Partnering with HR and the business to provide guidance on the application of Hay methodology to effectively evaluate the job.
 Apply knowledge of company positions and structure to contribute insights and high-level support to organizational design reviews.

 Compensation Administration (20%):

 Review requests for compensation or incentive changes against internal equity, external market data and ensure that recommendations are in line with policy.
 Partner with Payroll, Finance, and HR to administration of regular cycle activities, including annual salary and hourly compensation cycle, and incentive administration.
 Advising on the interpretation of SOP’s and practices.

 Projects and Project Support (20%):

 Support assigned compensation project work to research and/or implement changes or enhancements to programs to support employee attraction and retention, while complying with policy and legislation.
 Develop or update process documentation, tools, and job aids to enhance the compensation experience for HR and the business and assist in the roll out and change communication.

 Qualifications
 This position requires 1-3 years’ experience with compensation or human resources, with progressive knowledge in all compensation-related and data analysis areas. The successful incumbent will also possess a degree or diploma in business, human resources, data analytics or a related field.

 Compensation Certification (eg. CCP, GRP, ACCP) considered an asset
 Experience with Hay methodology considered an asset
 Advanced tool building and reporting in Excel, using data from multiple sources (eg: v-lookups, pivot tables, if statements, charts/graphs, etc.)
 Solid business acumen and the ability to effectively navigate various levels of the organization through the application of HR expertise and effective relationship management
 Excellent communication, writing and collaboration skills are necessary with the ability to work within a team and individually

 This posting will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. Apply today at smsequip.com
 SMS Equipment offers rewarding careers in the heavy equipment industry across Canada. As the largest Komatsu dealer in North America, SMS Equipment gives you the opportunity to represent world-class quality in our product offerings and customer service. A few of the many benefits of working with SMS Equipment include: competitive wages, comprehensive group benefits plans, and RRSP matching.

Title: Business Analyst – National Claims Project Team, Legal Claims
Description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.
At Intact, insurance is about people, not things. It’s what we believe, and it shapes everything we do. It’s why we strive to provide a second-to-none experience for our customers and create an inspiring workplace for our employees to thrive in.
We offer you more than just a career. As a Business Analyst, working here means being valued for who you are and growing, both professionally and personally. Alongside Canada’s largest in-house P&C insurance litigation team, you’ll get the tools, support, flexibility and opportunities to succeed and be your best self.











     About the role
     










This is a permanent, full-time opportunity available in Montreal.
This position is part of the various strategic initiatives for the National Legal Claims team. The Business Analyst is responsible for obtaining and analyzing data and developing and presenting reports of the various strategic projects.
Reporting to the National Director, you will be responsible for projects and data for Legal Claims, collaborate with the multiple stakeholders to ensure a comprehensive result monitoring of strategic projects and the timely production of recurring performance indicator reports (KPIs).
What you’ll do here:
Reporting:

Produce recurring (weekly and monthly) performance indicator (KPI) reports and provide a general analysis.
Collaborate with the Senior Business Analyst to ensure data accuracy and completeness through different initiatives with different stakeholders.
Identify needs related to team action plans.
Act as an intermediary between the Claims Data Actuarial Team (CDAT), the Finance team and the national Legal Claims team.
Run existing reports in Excel or Power BI
Manage report storage and accessibility in SharePoint

Projects:

Act as an intermediary between IT and users to define business needs in reporting tools (i.e. SharePoint, Power BI)
Plan and coordinate project activities related to organizational requirements or changes.
Obtain and document the requirements of business communities using techniques such as interviews and work sessions using defined templates.
Contribute to improve productivity according to budget objectives, reducing risks and lower costs.
Prepare activity reports to the Legal Claims management team












     Qualifications
     










What you bring to the table:

You share our values of respect, integrity, excellence, customer-driven and generosity – this will show through your work and your support of our customers, our claims partners, and our legal colleagues
You are an excellent collaborator and a great team player, which will contribute to the positive work environment
You deliver quality work with a quick turnaround because you prioritize, take initiative, stay organized and have sound judgement
You are an exceptional communicator with great listening, interpersonal and problem-solving skills

The ideal candidate has:

Bilingual in both French and English - both oral and written
Bachelor of Business Administration, Mathematics, Actuarial Science or
equivalent
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in an equivalent role.
Experience in Insurance Industry
Knowledge of Guidewire
Knowledge of the Office Suite (with advanced skills in Excel) in Power BI and SharePoint
Ability to manage working groups and rigorously monitor existing business processes
Demonstrated ability to cope with change effectively and positively
Effective in managing multiple tasks and projects at the same time
Time and priority management skills
Must be adaptable and efficient; able to thrive in fast-paced environment
Excellent Customer orientation
Leadership, innovation, and autonomy
Collaborates and team driven
Excellent communication skills (oral and written)

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
An extensive, flexible benefits package
An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements
We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.
#hybrid











     Closing Statement
     










We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.
Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.
